cNqpVwQu8bB6sqTua8Wd5w.review_text: Fun fact: this place used to be a pasta shop.   Bocce is like a hidden gem..having to walk through this outdoor corridor and enter little Italy. The food was OK.  The gamberi was waaay too oily and sour. I just enjoyed the garden-like ambiance, the live music, and warm service. Great place for groups or double dates.

NZiwwULo15SKuIT9K2yk0Q.review_text: This was recommended by my cousin, and it didn't disappoint. I had the eggplant & garlic pizza (so good) and my husband had the Carbonara (beyond so good). We were there early, before the rush, because I had heard it gets busy.

Zcr90BeQ8QWV32XIqpH82A.review_text: Here's the deal with Bocce.  It's a really fun place to come with a big group.  You get very drunk at Bocce.  You eat a ton of food.  Everyone has a great time.  That's pretty much it.  How can you not like that?  You can't.  And I do like it.  I like it a lot.   Now, here's the rest of the deal.  The food is fine.  Fine.  Yes, I had a lasagne that was too salty.   But whatever.  You come for the time--the decor is comfy, the waiters are nice and helpful.  The food is just part of the experience.  It won't be the part of the night you remember or talk about.    To sum up:  Come here with groups of people or out of town friends to have Italian food (American/Italian, to be exact), drink plenty of wine, have a great time, etc.  Everyone will walk away full and happy.

AXQ9ixwEOiIhtTHO7fMTkw.review_text: We were seated on the comfy couches and had the restaurant all to ourselves since we came for an early dinner.  I didn't really enjoy my lasagna (too salty), but my companion (who has been going to Bocce since the 80s) found his mushroom/chicken pasta to be much better than my dish.  The accommodating service and intimate atmosphere greatly made up for my disappointment.  We went on a rainy day, so we didn't get to appreciate the gardens and patio, maybe next time.

xy6nD4IOlne5HTaVb2OLtA.review_text: Some friends and I came here before watching Beach Blanket Babylon because it was conveniently located within walking distance to the theater. Parking around this area is usually always difficult, but if you have patience, people are always coming and going.   The place itself is very spacious, and when we went for dinner, it was also pretty empty, so I don't know if that's a good or a bad thing. The food was good and portions were large enough to share a plate between two people. We had the Fried Calamari (7.95), Salmon Fettuccini (11.95) and Meat Lasagna (9.95) and Steak.   I knocked off one star because the service was rather slow. But other than that, no complaints. I probably wouldn't come back here because there was nothing that screamed "different" from any other restaurant. But if you have never been here and are in the area looking for some good Italian, go ahead and give them a try. The lasagna was our best dish.

9AttfQurgQXPU2LX704CLQ.review_text: after a long week in guatemala i came back to the city hoping for some seriously delicious homestyle italian.  eating one night at dupont's thai restaurant on grant with my boyfriend, i noticed the sign, tucked away on green street.  it was worth a shot - something affordable, which i am always in need of.  but the experience was super underwhelming.  my boyfriend got the penne alla vodka which was actually pretty tasty but i stuck with a simple favorite, spaghetti meat balls.  i don't know how you don't get that right, honestly, but it was a mess.  tiny little flavorless balls of ground meat drowning uncomfortably in a boring tomato sauce.  our beef carpaccio appetzier was flavorless (except for the ridiculously generous sprinkling of capers) and slightly slimy. and dessert was truly wretched.  i am personally one who will eat and love any dessert but i could literally only stomach a couple bites of the creme caramel.  so all in all, this may be one of the worst restaurants i've been to in san francisco.  if you're looking for affordable homestyle, check out capp's instead.

4AvjrJlQqJWjtqmt2Entjw.review_text: I really wanted to love the place.. but didn't. But didn't hate it either. Didn't seem like a great date place.. was very loud with the jazz band in the small place.. I had to sit next to my date to even have a conversation(which has its merits I guess) rather than across.. which was a problem because they had a lot of the 2 person tables. They have a very nice outdoor patio but no heating so could not sit outside in the evening.. a pity.  Food - Bread was excellent - warm and fluffy. Mussels were awesome. Bruschetta was too salty and I had to send it back (I never do that) They were nice about it though and let us pick another appetizer instead. Everything seemed well priced.  Would not be my first choice for another visit.

Y6_gZa4jVXv0d4qiMbbycw.review_text: Pluses: They have a really nice space and location, they're cheap, the service was decent, and the antipasto was good.   Minuses: Loud dining room and then they pile a jazz duo on top of the din, the gnocchi was mushy and the pink sauce was mostly tasteless, the meat balls were OK but the sauce they were bathed in was as red as the sweet and sour chicken at a bad Chinese place. And top it all off, it's really crowded!  Not an experience I would repeat. They have valet parking and take reservations.

geOkfPqfhS9GXwVjfoABJQ.review_text: Basically just reiterating what everyone else here has said: The ambience is fantastic, the food is comically disappointing.  Everything's so bland, you wonder if they are in back with something out of the Duff Brewery, where a single tube fills cans of Duff, Duff Light, and Duff Dry.  Marinara?  Bolognese?  It's all coming out of the same Chef Boyardee can.  Normally the cheapness and ambiance would be enough to get it more stars, but this is North Beach - you can do better in all of those categories.

cEhMBD1_FhyzmzL_AJPG5g.review_text: Okay restaurant for north beach. Slow pace and not crowded.

Ei5KQbCezqsJp44VwZeN7g.review_text: All I have to say is order Gnocchi with Cream Sauce. You will not regret this at all. Soft, delicious, melt in your mouth gnocchi with an amazing sauce. Add in warm bread dipped in olive oil, with a refreshing glass of water (or wine) on the back patio on a warm summer night and you've got a recipe for success. Sure the service is a bit slow and parking is a b*tch in north beach but honestly, whats the rush? Relax and enjoy.

j1TCSbX9cOAQKz_J6WeiQQ.review_text: Awful, Awful, Awful.  Went here with the GF on Friday night, hoping to find some decent Italian food not part of the tourist trap that is Columbus.    Prices were pretty reasonable (~$10 for pasta), but my gosh, the food was awful.  I got Penne Marinara, and the sauce tasted like it was literally straight from a Ragu can. The noodles were extremely undercooked. GF got some kind of tortellini, and was finished 2 bites later.  The waitstaff was rude, barely spoke English, and delivered our bill literally 5 minutes after we got our food.  If you're looking for budget Italian food in NB, go around the corner to Golden Boy Pizza.  Just please don't spend your hard-earned coin at this joint. Awful.

2FaXRQT44HLMDxXrM9XVQg.review_text: Came with a group of about 50 for an alumni dinner event.   When you enter it feels like you walked in via someones side gate. This place has a huge back patio.   There weren't many single tables with couples, seemed to be a bunch of large groups.   Full bar, always a plus. Live music, surprising plus.   We had a set menu for our group - I had the veggie lasagna. It was yummy!

7-RPJN6w8zEfIHw9RxNTyA.review_text: My friends and I ate like kings here.  We were treated very well, and the food was fantastic fuel for a fun and rowdy night.  I would go back in a heartbeat.  Meatball Sub; that's what's up!

JITevzyEgskIJc6sgOyEgw.review_text: Bocce cafe is a hidden gem in North Beach.  The prices are reasonable and the decor is pleasant and the restaurant is spacious.  I came this past Saturday for a rehearsal dinner and it was wonderful!  Not only was our large party on the deck, there was a wedding going on inside.  Our food came out in record time and no we didn't order ahead of time.  The minestrone was a bowl full of heaven.  I finished my bowl AND my date's bowl.  I didn't have the meat lasagna but everyone who did cleared their bowl dry, to the point it could of been stacked back in the cabinet if no one was looking.  The tiramisu was also delicious.   I'm not sure how it is on a regular night but I imagine if they can get out 60 dinners in a short period of time and still manage to create something that tasty it has to be good!  However with that said, you don't necessarily come to the Bocce cafe for the food, you come for the prices and location.  Give it a shot if you are in the area, you won't be disappointed.   its a nice change from the hustle and bustle on Columbus.

8QCdHp9s3PHhcfOLpYynhQ.review_text: Let me start by saying this:  I am biased.  I am a creature of habit.  I am a sucker for "the familiar".   I love Bocce Cafe.    I have been coming to Bocce Cafe once a month or so for about 5 years now.  (Sometimes I get on a Bocce-kick (no pun...) and end up here several times in a week....  This place has old world charm.  This place has good cheap pasta.  This place is off the beaten path.  This place draws locals and the few tourists who get the word.  This place has good consistent service.  This place is terrific.  Live music most nights.  Always a festive late dining crowd.  If you go at 8pm, it is packed.  If you go at 5pm, it is empty.  It is always good.  It is always fun.    I gave up on Stinking Rose.  I gave up on Columbus Ave (EXCEPT of course, MOLINARIS!!!)  I have never given up on Bocce.  You want character and charm?  You want North Beach?  You want a great selection of pasta and a few delicous seafood dishes to choose from?    YOU WANT BOCCE CAFE.

pgHydP7mJBryEw5_Ldp36Q.review_text: I enjoy dinning at hidden places - such as bocce cafe. You'll see their sign but you'll have to walk through a path to see their entrance on the right side. Once you are inside, you'll think this is a log cabin with high ceiling and wood interior.  We have a $20 off scoutmob discount (free if you have an iphone/droid app). Our total bill was only $45 including tip (2 entrees, a side veggie and two glasses of wine). We got great value for our money with the discount. Otherwise it would not be memorable at all.   The food was decent, it's traditional, classic, old school Itatlian food. You will not find creative pasta dishes or trendy appitizers but you have a solid selection of pizza/pasta/protein/salad dishes.   Service was a bit on the slow/don't care side. They didn't ask if we wanted another glass of wine or care to explain the menu. The hostess looked terribly bored the whole time (I happened to sit facing her).   I probably won't go back with a small group. However, they are the perfect place if you have a huge group and would like to sit for as long as you want. Also free Jazz on Fri/Sat night.

qTXk4MTFfWRAX36d-OWE5A.review_text: I've always enjoyed coming to Bocce Cafe because it's cozy and comfortable. If you want to eat good food, and not be saddled with the pretentiousness of many other restaurants in San Francisco, this is a good place.   I just had lunch here this past saturday after a wedding in North Beach. There was 5 hours between the ceremony and reception, so I needed a place to grab lunch. Although I initially expected to eat with a group of 5, it ended up being a group of 30. The service staff of Bocce Cafe didn't blink an eye, although I'm sure they were expecting a pretty laid back lunch. In any case, the food was good and service was excellent. The gnocchi my wife got was spot on and my penne alla vodka has the most tender cubes of salmon. Their pasta dishes are on the over-dressed side, so perhaps not "italian-authentic" but definitely "italian-american authentic".  Overall, Bocce Cafe will not have the best food or wine in SF (there's tons of competition), but as I said earlier, if you want good food in a cozy enviroment without the pretense, this is the place. Their bread is soft and warm, which is perfect for dipping into the balsamic vinegar and olive oil (and it's good vinegar and oil, no skimping here),  and the prices are reasonable (between $10-$15 for most pasta dishes, $15-$25 for specials and meat entrees). They also have valet parking, which is of tremendous value in North Beach.

UpFyXb73mTaFm_3I2Ma_Gw.review_text: I came here for my sisters birthday a few weeks back and was suprised to too such an oppen lodge style restaurant in the middle of north beach. It's a pritty great FIND. It's tucked away in an ally, and if you can find your way into the secret gaurdan then you'll be rewared with this charmingly oppen dinning experence. There is a live band playing obscure B sides from the 70's and 80's that almost sounded like they where popular are some opint in time, but nothing you'll be singing along to at your table, maybe thats the point... The entire dinning experence was very unique for SF standards. I supose it was a nice change of pase, and definatly a great place to come with a big group of people.  The pricing is totaly reasionable, and in return you'll get food that fits that bill, nothing thats going to knock your socks off but undeniably good food thats calls for a return some time.  After getting over the initial shock of this large oppen room with masive exposed beams of wood, and as my eyes started to drift down to that walls and art, i could not help but notice how cheep everything here was. One table to another it seems like i was taking a trip around a flee market viewing different old womens dinning sets. The art reminded me of old 60's food advertisements, though in italian i still felt like cheap prints of decent  art work would have cost them the same. just sothing about seeing a picture of risotto that looked nothing like mine that kinda made me want to stop eating. Non-the-less good food, good envirment, and ok service, make me think that if they idea of going back here came up i would not object.

HSI7ximOXua8VDv4cbKQVw.review_text: My review is long overdue, as my party here was last June. However, I can't just pass on leaving them (and you) some feedback!  I had a party of about 45 people here for my post-City Hall wedding luncheon. We sat out on the patio, and we had such a great experience.   First off, it is extremely difficult to find a place in SF willing to accommodate such a large party unless you're closing down the place and spending a minimum (actually, more than maximum for us!). Bocce was one of our top contenders at my cousin's suggestion. I came here a few months early with my now husband and cousin to order a LOT of food and scope out the place. Our first visit was good, despite the leaky roof in the rain. I recall that a few dishes were delicious (calamari palermo as an appetizer was particularly wonderful!) and a few were just OK. But based on the awesome service we got, I booked it for our luncheon.  From beginning to end, they helped make our event perfect. They closed off the patio for just us and they let my cousins drop off things a few hours in advance. They even refrigerated our large cake at no extra expense. They had plenty of servers to accommodate everyone, though I do remember them running out of bowls (a little strange). I pre-ordered all the food and had them serve it family-style in big bowls, rather than on platters with veggies on the side, so people would share a bit of each course. The meal was well under what I expected it to be. I definitely wasn't paying attention to how many of each entree came out, but they were very honest and on top of it. No waiting at all between courses. They even brought a glass of champagne on the house to my husband and me :)  Without hesitation I recommend Bocce Cafe for large parties. Enjoy the Italian food and let them make your event worry-free!

f3OWZsSPIrF6p-IKu0elzw.review_text: We visited the Bocce Restaurant on the evening of July 4th, 2010 before we walked to Fisherman's Wharf for the 9:30+ Fireworks show. The North Beach area was buzzing and and our 7:30 reservation was met without any delay. Prompt service and even though there were only three servers and one bus person. They jammed! Well done!! Excellent service!      Our appetizers were simple and delicious. Bruschetta and we (3) split a Cesars Salad. Our entre orders went in just as two very large parties filled the restaurant and the dinner rush filtered in. The entres, Special Seafood Canaloni for my wife, Carole ordered the Veal Marsala and I had Linguine Pescatore w/ Clam, Mussels, Calamari, Prawns and Salomon w/ Marinara sauce the later with a glasses of Sauvignon Blanc. We topped dinner off with a round of Espresso. I was very impressed on staff's attitude and level of service on such a busy night. Happy Forth of July 2010!!

Z4hHu2_K1Ij_3pViIxNdMw.review_text: This is my go-to restaurant when folks are visiting or we are stuck on what "New place" to go to.  I love this place and it is good and consistent.  They just spent a ton of money on renovating. . . wait for it, not their dinning room, but their kitchen.  They offer jazz trios on most weekend nights.  I have no idea why this place is not more crowded?  Just an over all great experience.    And there is a kitty on the outside patio. . .

ij-hrVzJcHaZudj5o7C2qw.review_text: Great food, great service, great atmosphere, great prices.  I love this place because it's excellent without being too fancy, but without being cheesy either.

DCSe39OVjUfz6Bn28xjnPQ.review_text: We ended taking my parents here with their visit and it was a nice experience except for the fact that our waiter wasn't very attentive yet the food was good. The gnocchi was delicious with spicy sauce. The Pasta pescatore had very good flavor.. The place was quiet and only two other couples were there but that could be good just to get somewhere cozy and catch up with the parents.

E0ZywLUXqSrHbcLo9tGF_g.review_text: cheap, good portions, decent italian food w/live music. great for big groups but can be noisy for good conversations. didn't get to sit outside due to pouring rain.  their tortellini w/pesto was pretty good...and im not a fan of tortellini.  TIP: they have valet parking at a decent price, take advantage if you go! beats driving around for parking and i think it's cheaper than a parking lot.

fIfKT5J7OWnr_sNP7VKkAw.review_text: I'm no North Beach regular, the level of bars that interest me is largely reduced here and who knows when a drunken dive bar crawl may be in the cards. But if friends or family are in town that have never been, you're going to end up with a tourist checklist. Everyone knows it's your duty to make sure this list is addressed or you are arrested and the city raises your taxes. So while checking North Beach off, I figured we should score some food.  While wandering the 17,000 Italian restaurants, you'll notice Bocce Cafe by the 'enchanted garden path' gated entrance. I can't think of a better term. The garden patio, a scruffy little cat, sun, butterflies. It's like eating lunch in a Disney movie, the old school ones. Like circa Lady and the Tramp. I half expected little blue cartoon birds to fly down and sing on the table.  Three star food for me. The marinara was good, but I could find similar or better in the vicinity. "However" I remind myself, "it isn't just about the food." If the food were to man up I'd go five stars mostly because of the back patio. Sitting outside while eating and drinking wine is exactly what I want going on during a warm day, we were here just plain relaxing for like 2 hours.   I would grab wine on the patio, just might not sprint back for food. I'll probably give it another shot, maybe I was just unlucky. If I could see cartoon birds though, that'd be even better.

zlxg7BQ6StisAAC0cpUsZQ.review_text: Based upon the food only, I'd probably only give it two stars, but Bocce is great for large group settings and the prices are surprisingly inexpensive.  It's a fun atmosphere on a Friday evening.  I'd recommend staying with something simple like the gnocchi or tortellini, which are both solid.  I had the cioppino once and it was a bust.  Wine list could be better, but again, this is an inexpensive place, so you get what you pay for.

_tBe5IFEMtnYBKjmQ_YQyA.review_text:
Always find this to be a decent, reasonable, and delicious place to go eat with a large group of friends. Friendly waitstaff, and casual environment. Always reliable good italian.
  I don't know how to explain it: but it's both nice AND cheesy at the same time, with delicious food.  A perfect combination to me!

7_I4dzv1AvZmY8hpVe9zLA.review_text: 3.5  give it nod for their atmostphere. try to get the patio seating with your huge group ... if you can all find parking there.

5rYjQS0BV3ihz-jkE-UHuQ.review_text: Great food and a pleasant atmosphere for dining.

d6Oy5dRqfFCkoCnGInFTUQ.review_text: I booked this place for my wife's Birthday Party. We have people who were vegetarian and Kids . The manager and the staff was awesome. The were able to handle a party of 25 at a day notice. The food was excellent . Ambiance beautiful . Every one in our party like the place so much , they were already planning for their next party at this restaurant. They were very accommodating. The setup was very good.

YnhzujdL0_Xear02uxakMw.review_text: Gnocchi, gnocchi, gnocchi.  It melts in your mouth here.  They are light, they are tasty, and they go great in any of the sauces.  I haven't been to Bocce cafe since 2000 and I couldn't be happier to be back.  The other 88 reviews have already summed up the ambiance.  The place is cheesy.  The decor is old and smells like mildew upon entering, but the food is the real reason why you go to restaurants.  Glasses of wine for $5, I can drink out again!  Entrees from $9-15, "I'll take two please".  I actually ordered the lasagna, but had to steal bites of gnocchi from my date when she wasn't looking.  That's how I know it tastes good in different sauces.  The lasagna was delicious too, but my sneaky gnocchi bites stole the show.

v86qehLR8bdFmvNqwi-RrQ.review_text: I had a great experience here as an ad hoc adventure with friends which is why I came back. I was more disappointed this time which brought their 4 star review down to 2.5.  The receptionist was more than willing to take my reservation and requests for a "special occasion treatment" as my friends were visiting and on their honeymoon.  He said maybe the band would play something romantic in their honor or they would bring out tiramisu for the couple as a surprise. Nothing happened even after I approached the waiter to say "did you get that we made a special reservation for newlyweds?".  He smiled and said yes, but that was it.  It even took forever to get the check so we could get out and start a good night.  2 stars. But the food was pretty good,

zpXqbJQ2CT4PsUBTy30DbQ.review_text: Food and service was bland and blah, but this restaurant is definitely a good option for large groups.  They only seemed to have large parties in the restaurant the evening I was here.  I loved how cute ambiance and décor was.  It actually felt like you were really in Italy.  You have to walk down a long sidewalk with pretty flowers, plants, etc in order to enter the restaurant.  Very European feel!   Came here for a work event and we started off with many, many plates of the Antipasto Della Casta, which was a huge plate of bruschetta, olives, smoked salmon, mozzarella caprese, marinated olives, roasted bell peppers, grilled veggies, prosciutto, and salami.  It was deeeelicious! Got to love all these delicious Italian meats.    For our main course, we had the option of choosing either the stuffed ravioli, meat or veggie lasagna, or 1 of 5 different types of pasta (fettuccine, linguine, penne, rigatoni, or spaghetti) with 1 of about 10 different sauce options.  I was thoroughly impressed w/ all the different choices of sauces.  They ranged from a tomato and garlic sauce to alfredo, pesto, or carbonara, to feta, fresh tomatoes, and olives.  I had a hard time choosing which one would compliment my penne perfectly, but ended up choosing the basic tomato and garlic sauce in the end.   I omitted dessert after induldging at a wedding in Florida all weekend, but had the opportunity to try the gelato, which was wonderful, but so thick that I would actually probably constitute it as custard.

N91MSNXJbIuwQ5gGW3sRuQ.review_text: You can't beat the fun atmosphere, the way it is tucked back [hidden] off the street the neighborhood or the gnocchi!!  Loved the decor and the patio.  Can't wait to get back to the city and hit the Bocce Cafe!

nrukepOIPsI71vIzZ6Z4Xw.review_text: The only reason this gets as many stars as it does, it because it's one of the only places in North Beach good for groups and does have an amazing patio. However there is far better italian food a block away from here.  The gnocchi had a grainy potato texture and the dough on the outside was really thick so you didn't get the cloud like texture good gnocchi should have, however the pesto sauce that came with it was pretty good.

4GpPju9R7f2nHTwx-VRXMw.review_text: Ok. The food was just mediocre. Half my party was happy with their entrees and half weren't. I had the ravioli.  However, they do have a large patio out back that's good for large groups.

_sZhCmbR0fBK3U4XMpgQRQ.review_text: Horrible service. Our party of 6 was seated at a table for 4. The waiter took 30 minutes to come by and then it took over an hour for our food to arrive. No explanation. Never again.

_pBzBgtCTN9PNUPfgPDI8A.review_text: The second time we ate here was less magical.  It was still the day before the marathon yet it was so much busier.  I suspect it was because they were in the middle of the dinner rush when we showed up at 7 pm, whereas previously we had eaten earlier at 5:30.  Even though we were on time for our reservation, we had to wait.  The hostess was still amiable and sat us when she could.  The bread was brought out late and we had to ask for our waters a second time.  My cousin did order a mojito and found it to be nicely done.  I ordered a small garden salad, and a pasta dish that was forgettable.  The salad however was a huge disappointment.  It was over dressed and slightly gross.  The garlic bread was good however and sopped up my pasta sauce nicely.  It was full of garlic but lacked any salt.  I was pretty disappointed in the meal this time around.  The restaurant was buzzing though.  They were really busy. Our server just took forever.  They do accommodate large groups, just make a reservation.

3rWdCM2_AK7GWQlwzRO99Q.review_text: This place is good for big groups but the food is sub par.  The live band they have might sometimes actually bother your dining experience as they are very loud.

l7V5w_vf9xv74As3abZukA.review_text: Tucked behind some houses on Green Street, down a long plant & tree lined path lies the a great, rustic, barn shaped restaurant with high ceilings and a huge dining area AND outdoor dining deck/patio.  This place has been my Go-To spot for large dinner groups for years. Why? Because they can accommodate groups of up to 30 people at one long table (or sets of tables) (in my experience). They have a fairly wide, but consistent food selection that is reasonably, if not affordably, priced. And the food is good. Again NOT fine dining. But you get what you pay for.   They have also, in the past, had live jazz or piano music on weekend nights for diners which is great.  And on those warm nights, it's nice to sit out on the back patio, surrounded by white-light-lit-trees and fresh air.   Need to go back!

4Xe0IBOfFsWjNKQRkVRsdQ.review_text: Bad food. Weird atmosphere. It's an italian restaurant, but feels like a swiss chalet inside. Caprese salad had no basil on it. They had sprinkled dried oregano in place of basil. Weird. Tomatoes in Caprese salad were hard and not ripe.   Gnocchi is supposed to be fluffy and light. Theirs is a dough ball. I don't recommend this restaurant.

duMxpfTdUU-97xgyv0Ujfg.review_text: I think the best thing about this place it is the atmosphere and setting.  You wouldn't think much of this place just looking from the outside, but once inside the large space is warmly lit with the option of outdoor seating.  The food is pretty good and on some nights there is even some live jazz playing.

DeNozkS0rQSRj6kSqf6XMQ.review_text: Imagine pulling up to a valet booth in a seemingly quiet residential area in North Beach, then strolling down an alley lined with vines and greenery, then opening the door to a busy, and bustling restaurant...  That was my first experience of Bocce Cafe over 14 years ago, and still held true this past weekend.  The food was still as good as I had remembered.  The fam came here to celebrate a friend's bday and everyone enjoyed their entree's (good variety).  We started with carpaccio, a pot of steamed mussels, and crispy calamari. Our table had fettucine with calamari, linguine with clams (sop up the broth with their fresh baked bread), gnocchi, and pepperoni pizza for the kids.  The wine menu had a good variety, and was fairly reasonable.  Overall service was very friendly and attentive.  The prices were reasonable.  Very kid friendly as well.  $10 valet is super convenient, especially when you are in the hot spot of the city.  Great for accomodating large groups.  Definitely would go back in a heartbeat.

HE2-H4TBQMZMJsjn0rE3Rw.review_text: Went to Bocce Cafe on 8/21/09 before a comedy show at Cobb's.  The place is a lot bigger than it looks as you walk up to it.  The decor is definitely interesting.  The patio looks inviting but it was a bit chilly so we didn't sit back there.  The piano player in the main restaurant was good, but it was a little loud for my taste.  My husband and I shared the Meal for Two (can't recall what it's actually called).  Overall, the food was okay.  It wasn't the best Italian I've ever had and it wasn't the worst.  The best thing about them meal for two was being able to try 7 different menu items.  All of the items were tasty except the gnocci (not firm enough).   It's a large amount of food, so you'll likely end up with left overs.  We would go back here, but with so many other North Beach restaurants, it's likely to be awhile.

2IxVJZHVOVhCfeSeQNqq4w.review_text: I was in SF for a quick trip and decided to try this place...  the place itself isn't so bad. But the service is horrendous. I'd at least be forgiving on that front if the food was worthwhile, but um, no. We ordered chicken parm and spaghetti and meatballs. HOW CAN YOU GET THAT WRONG?   After being ignored for 15 minutes, we finally ordered 2 glasses of wine and our meals. The meals came 3 minutes later, without the wine. What I got was a thin piece of chicken swimming in gummy cheese with some no frills tomato sauce. Clearly, Ragu is better. The wine eventually came near the end of the meal. Of course it wasn't good, but regardless.  Totally. Unsatisfied. Disgusting. What a waste. If you want Spaghettios, just go to the grocery store.  I don't know how any of these people can bother giving this place good reviews. We left and thought spaghettios are better. Indeed they are. SAVE YOURSELF A TRIP! There are plenty other better places that are reasonable.   Gross.

C8DpXJvp2ifv7YQt5jEOPA.review_text: Bocce is a fantastic spot for a large group. You can all sit at a long table, talk without feeling like you are being too loud and listen to live piano. The food is great too, I had the Gnocchi in cream sauce and the Gnocchi was cooked perfectly, which I feel is an art in itself.

pXeGiGgexdzYoVz-uhObAw.review_text: 3.5 stars.  Solid place with reasonable prices & nice sized portions.  Great space for large groups.  The outdoor patio looked perfect when not freezing.  TIP:  Go during happy hour for 50% off apps!  Bruschetta - Yum!  Prosciutto & melon - Good.  Carpaccio - Yum!  Mozzarella caprese - Fresh!  Fried calamari - Crispy w/marinara sauce  Mussels - Great  Cioppino - Great tomato broth.  Some of the seafood was overcooked.  Big portion so be good & share with your pals.

ODSH1it5oAUPu2clIgOvyg.review_text: The restaurant is huge, given its location. But the service we received was bad. The waitress didn't know anything, and they didn't have the wine I ordered, or the alternative I wanted. If you're looking for nice or fancy, don't come here. If you're looking for decent and overpriced, do. I had the smoked salmon pasta, and it wasn't very good. Comfortable couches though

6G6Z1FKUn7kXmbyAyU2Sgg.review_text: Good, average quality italian for the price.  Not to mention, lots of space without any line ups in north beach.

SRcmpMtVnu8SZRFBh9uVwQ.review_text: This place has the best gnocci in North Beach (and I've tried a lot of gnocci)!!!  They also have yummy bread which you can't stop eating.  It's off the beaten path and kind of hidden off Green street but worth looking for.  Its a cute place with an adorable patio and the Italian wine is good too!  I came for a banquet a couple fo years ago and feel in love with this place...

2uHoI9OrE1UqtGUbYFtWfQ.review_text: A good time and very no nonsense after an afternoon out.  Food was solid although the portions were almost too big.  Decent wine list and reasonably priced.  the wait staff was adequate but could have been a little more attentive on a slow Sunday afternoon.  Still, nothing to complain about really.  I would return.

JLMbtwAmC9HH_pmLdUITrg.review_text: Returned to Bocce last night with the kids - haven't been in at least 15 years. Still a beautiful hideaway, and the food was good. Kids enjoyed themselves (sitting on the comfortable sofa side of the table). The bar (which reminds me of something out of "The Shining" - so massive and full of character) is definitely the heart of the place. Bread was a bit stale, house Chianti was good, pasta was good (kids had pesto, my spaghetti was good, as was my husband's tortellini - albeit a bit buttery). But, I can only give this a 3-star rating as the service was not great. Started out friendly enough, but the experience would have been so much better had they been more attentive (we had to get up twice to ask for items like water and the check). Prices were fantastic, though, particularly when compared to other restaurants in North Beach.

RcpJz73lteDkvKPHAhRXPQ.review_text: had takeout lunch from this place. The lasagna  wasn't really that good. They gave me a loaf of bread along with it. I had ordered the garlic bread and that was just a loaf of bread with some oil and garlic. It seems like when they plan the menu, the garlic bread was an afterthought. typical bad North Beach italian.

5qGWqqXBhN4cgNhQ8fR7JA.review_text: Cioppino, Cioppino, Cioppino!! That's all you need.   A night lost in the North Beach area can offer a lot of good options for foddies. We decided to try some Italian food last Saturday night so we went to this fancy place.   The experience started poor and got better as the food started coming.   It was really good, at least our choices were worth it. Calamary (around $12) are fresh and good with the red sauce. Fries are very Italian style (only $3,5). Then we had the shrimp pizza which was just ok. What is really good is the Cioppino ($29). They just make it perfect, very tasty and with fresh seafood. It was just amazing.  The only thing could have improve my experience would have been more attention from the servers and cooler beers since the ones I had were warm. Maybe because it was San Patrick's...  I will be back for that Cioppino!!!

n3S-9uSFSt0kcgsOje7LHQ.review_text: I found this place on accident, as the restaurant that I intended to go to was closed unexpectedly.  As I entered, it felt like I was entering the Garden of Eden. I started secretly hoping to be greeted by Eve, wearing a fig leaf, and eating an apple while I tempted her with my snake. Instead, I was greeted by an Italian guy who looked fresh off the pages of GQ Magazine.  Boner time was over.  I got a great seat out on the back patio under some fig trees, which made me feel like I was back in my Garden of Eden fantasy. I ordered an Italian beer which was incredibly cheap, and appetizers that GQ guy agreed to tweak a little for me, as I requested.  Then Eve walked in.  She got seated directly in my line of vision, and was wearing the TIGHTEST fig-leaf green dress I could ever imagine. Her breasts were perfectly poised to catch glimpses of the sun rays that filtered through the trees, and glimpses from me.  The remainder of my meal was a blur of relatively good, inexpensive Italian food, beer, and 2 incredible melons that kept emerging from the flimsy green dress that was across the patio.   Here's the breakdown: 1 star for atmosphere.....the concrete jungle's secret garden. 1 star for great service.....GQ style. 1 star for cheap eats.....shared with cheap beer. 1 star for Eve.....or the hot waitress that served her.  I need to apologize to the man inside the restaurant. I wasn't staring at you through my entire meal.....I was using the reflective window between us to perve on Eve without getting caught.

igahz_po3FnAojqkQBYomA.review_text: The best of all of North Beach, or so I say. I've been coming here for over 3 years and I have to say it has yet to not appeal to me. From the "hidden" entrance to the nice cozy feel. It is a perfect spot for a nice little dinner with friends, family, or even a date. Just make sure to plan the right time, since it might get a little hectic traversing around North Beach. Bocce Cafe comes with great seating, indoors and outdoors and of course delicious food. The food here has never failed to amaze me, always exquisite and always priced just right. With mighty portions, greater than any other location in North Beach. The bread is heavenly, always freshly baked and soft. I believe I have tired almost everything on their menu, and well all I remember is that I like them all. This is the place to dine. There is live music at night, which can get a little rowdy but still a nice touch. This is the location to dine!  If you choose to dine in North Beach, let alone San Francisco, then dine here. Trust me you wont regret it.

hoAPOzKb4VNoeSwEKDOd7A.review_text: Can't beat this place. A real hidden italian gem in North Beach. I go for the pesto Gnocchi and fried Calamari every time. phenomenal atmosphere

O3toZ3Aw8Qd_15GmIWUjYQ.review_text: Food was fine but not great or inventive. Bartender was really attentive and friendly.  Atmosphere was fine but felt a little generic. I left the restaurant with a bad taste in my mouth (and a welt on my arm) because they gave me my dish too soon. I didn't try to touch it! as they warned my friend it was hot. But my arm accidentally grazed the side for a split second as I reached for my water glass. OWW. It bothered me for the rest of the night. I feel like giving someone a hot plate is fine. Or one of those sizzling grills where the plate is sizzling and making noise and your arm wouldn't dare go near it! But a plate that's actually going to leave a burn from just grazing it?  They could fix that situation.

6xH5ZQ80KWAJk81lLRI3HA.review_text: Nice scenery, great selection of alcoholic beverages, decent wine list. Out of the two times I have eaten at this restraunt, I would say the service is hit or miss. The food is somewhat overpriced for what you get. The two pasta dishes I had were somewhat bland in terms of the sauces. If you go on a busy night, don't plan on having much conversation with your guests -- between the band playing and the high volume of people in the room, its hard to communicate. In general, I would have expected a bit more of what could be a gem in the area.

Euv9MX5XY7bJP1BX-73zxA.review_text: My wife and I ate here for the first time today with a large group for lunch.  It was a great experience.  The mushroom rigatoni with marinara sauce and the caesar salad were delicious and the service was unbelievable, especially for a group of 100.  The owner Welat and Karen, our server, were so warm and accommodating.  Would highly recommend this cozy restaurant to anyone that wants great food in a relaxing atmosphere in the heart of North Beach.

1DeIH9O7Kag_h8i3H-eXYA.review_text: This place rocks!  I am Italian and grew up on home-cooking and this place is much more authentic than most of the trendy "Italian" joints in North Beach.  The staff is friendly, knowledgeable and gives zero attitude and the food is excellent.  Plus, it's one of the few places in the City where you can have an excellent meal for less than $20 a meal.  I've been going here since '94 and I highly recommend it.  I think a lot of people who gave it less than 5 stars were disappointed because there isn't much of a "scene" here. If you're looking to get laid, go to Nikki's or Zeitgeist.  If you're looking for a great meal, go to Bocce.

xtZMctl7AQNspIL_SF3guA.review_text: Better than most Italian restaurants in North Beach. I'm not sure if that's saying anything, but if you really really want to "soak in the flavor" of North Beach and are rolling ten deep with your homies or chicas, this ain't a bad place to hit. Most of the pasta dishes are decent (my favorite is the Bolognese sauce), and the lasagna isn't half bad either. Overall though, when it comes to Italian, I'd rather just cook it at home.

oVR7BUs-uk3n_61RJOcoZA.review_text: When looking for Italian food in North Beach, this is one of our go-to places. It's off the beaten path of all the other italian restaurants. The food is always consistently good. The prices are very reasonable for what you get. Also on Fridays and Saturdays they usually have a live band playing in the restaurant!

3-xbYhGVstuASDDU7qj7PQ.review_text: I held the San Francisco Geek Dinner Kick Off here and it was awesome.  The service was awesome and the food was great!  All the employees were very easy to deal with and friendly.  I would definitely have another geek dinner there in the future!  (P.S. If you know of good restaurants that can take large groups, I'd love to hear about it!)

1CpeEoYdLnP8oAcP6tRPUQ.review_text: After spending all day climbing San Francisco's infamous hills, I was starving and ready for a great Italian meal.   I found Bocce Cafe tucked in a walkway and was immediately captured by the ambiance meant for romantic dates and close family gatherings! The lighting is a bit dark, and there is a tree motif going on with tree branches scattered around the cafe and ceramic flower detailing.   Unfortunately, the acoustics of the cafe means that it is a pretty noisy place. We had a large group sitting next to us, and their volume made our table have to yell to hear each other. Also the band that they have is a cute idea, but not for a small place where it is hard to hear.   We were served with fresh garlic bread and an olive oil & vinegar dip. Delish!!! The prices were decent, when comparing with other nice Italian restaurants around the area. My table ordered the Spinach ravioli, Portabella & Chicken penne, Caviar pasta and a calzone.   In short, the pasta was very average. Nothing special at all. However the calzone was  Amazing! It was huge (enough for 2 people to share) and delicious. Also it was one of the cheaper menu items!!!

ikyU_FnRkUuZMAUUu2UPSQ.review_text: Such a fan of this place! Great customer service! Great ambiance! Food came out in perfect timing. Once you walk in you will be surprised.

WBj8hCWn4yp4FwUTsK7mWA.review_text: Service was awful. Dinner for 5 took 2 hours. 20 min wait between appetizer and salad. Place wasn't even that busy about half full. Don't understand why service was soooo slow?  Lasagna was like a bowl of sauce, hardly any noodles.  My Cesar salad had 3 1/2 croutons,   2 pieces of shaved cheese, that's it!!!  Real bad. Rest of dinner was just ok.  $206 for 5 dinners, one drink each, an appetizer and 3 salads.  Will NOT be going back, too many better restaurants in the neighborhood

6CvBV2AaMoRkbqdbs0z6Vg.review_text: Interesting place. The look is at first very cool. High wood beamed ceilings, couches with pillows serve as banquets, stone work, nice rustic light fixtures. But after being there awhile it just seems unfinished. Like they were going in a certain direction and then just stopped. The food was solid. Nothing to go crazy over, but not disappointing either. The house salad was delicious though. Great dressing. Very bright and acidic. The wine bottle prices are very reasonable.

C2VcjWlbYZSWRksw55yrMA.review_text: Great ambiance and decor. However, we did not enjoy the food at all. My husband had gnocchi pesto and I had capellini Napoleon. Our pastas were drenched in too much sauce. The sauces weren't all that great either. Our appetizer bread was stale and dry. I was disappointed about the processed Parmesan cheese on the pasta as well. In short I won't go back.

75ChsvSkWeoecpnyw1GAQg.review_text: Having recently moved to North Beach my girlfriend and I went to Bocce after having regularly walked past it to get to our flat. The entrance is nice, that's as good as it gets.... We love Italian food but I'm sorry to say this was truly truly awful only made worse by the take it or leave it attitude of our waiter. Thanks but we'll leave it. Tommaso's is just a couple of blocks away and is infinitely, infinitely better.

yeUX_IIw2ysegz2k5Tjwww.review_text: Although I have seen some very bad reviews for this place, I think it was great! I did go here at like 330 in the afternoon, so I didn't have to worry about slow service or anything. We were only one of two tables in the place! I loved the atmosphere, and I would go back anytime!

s4U_v9NQVVaYiLdXmPk2bA.review_text: I've eaten at Bocce Cafe maybe a half dozen times. The food is ok, the atmosphere is quite nice, and the location is pretty cool. This is a good place for an inexpensive dinner with friends, not a good place if you want to impress a date.  So why 5 stars? My now-wife and I had our rehearsal dinner at Bocce Cafe this past July on a Friday night.   As wedding planning goes, this was probably the easiest thing we had to do. The manager Ramon was extremely easy to work with. Our group was about 80 people including a few children and a couple babies. This was a few too many people to sit outside (which in July in SF would have been too cold anyway) so they gave us a nice sectioned off area inside. I talked to Ramon on the phone twice and came into the restaurant once to solidify everything. The whole process was really easy. We picked out a few menu items and pre-ordered appetizers/salads/wine.   Because it was a Friday, there was a band playing. Most of our guests thought we had hired them, which was nice. Overall I think the price came to a bit under $35 per person including tax/tip, and we had a reasonable amount of drinking going on. This was about half of what I had budgeted.   Anyway, I was really happy with this choice and would highly recommend it for a large group like ours.

MiZYWZKC28xofz3yrZ-tRQ.review_text: This place is really charming and the food is great. We went here for a friend's graduation dinner and the set up of the restaurant really catered to larger groups(at least on the night we went). They did a great job of accommodating our large group( i think there were about 16 people), as well as about 4 other groups of the same size. Despite the fact that the restaurant was super busy, service did not lack in the least. We were actually amazed with how fast we all received our food!  I got the eggplant Parmigiana and it was fantastic.  I loved how tomatoey and fresh the marinara sauce tasted and the eggplant was very tender and delicious.  For dessert, we got the carmel custard thing and oh my goodness, it was AMAZING!  I really didn't even intend to have any, but flash forward to me eating about half of it...yeah, you can say I kinda enjoyed it :) Great service, great food, YAY, I'm a fan!

JnGtgOPpkjyWOvWM0SYEXg.review_text: lodge feel...comfy sofa seating paired to tables 'n' chairs...spacious 'n' open....garden patio dining experience....nothin' really like it in northbeach....while food...mediocre....$7 mix 'n' match pasta to sauce a bargain.....definitely nothing to boast...yet...for the price....economical for a sit-down restaurant....complimentary warm soft bread....balsamic vinegar 'n' olive oil to dip...not worth a trek to visit....but...cheap eats for northbeach locals...

Jz5R2yOqHzNWC6c0oXs8DQ.review_text: I normally don't write bad reviews...only reviews for places I like.  But I felt compelled after dining here last night.  Horrible food, horrible service!   We went here last nigh for a company Christmas party.  Service started by some of us getting water and the rest having to ask repeatedly for water.  I had a beet salad and some beets were over cooked, while others were under cooked.  Other than that, it was average.  When our meals arrived it took 15 additional minutes for three of us to be served and I didn't get mine until they were clearing away everyone else's plates.  I ordered veal marsala and I swear they cooked the veal in a microwave oven and slapped everything else together.  It was undercooked in many spots, spongey and/or rubbery.  The mushrooms were raw...which would be find in a salad.  Bottom line, it was inedible.  Even the vegetables tasted like crap.  It came with a side of penne pasta and red sauce.  I've had better pasta at home out of a box with Ragu cannes sauce.  They didn't even come back to ask about my uneaten plate until they were ready to take desert orders.  The response: Oh I'm sorry, would you like something else?  But by that time it was too late, I'd be eating after everyone had desert.  So I was left to get a fast food burger late at night.    To be fair, some people enjoyed their food.  So...I guess it's hit or miss.  But I would recommend that you find somewhere else to dine.  There are way too many places nearby to eat at this dump.

wZG2xlICfUkJiY1NdPJH2A.review_text: Haha, what a North Beach staple. This place has been around forever and doesn't seem to cater to the ridiculous younger NB goers. It's got the old style jazz band playing at night and some characters get into dancing.  They have the typical Italian fare, some type of pasta loaded with garlic, cream or tomato sauce and a seafood or meat topping. Tried the calamari, the mussels, the meat tortellini, and the penne alla vodka. Big wide open space, typical service, loud and bustling. The best part was the special- a beet and mango salad. It wasn't heavy and had a great flavor.  PS parking in a nightmare, so don't go around thinking you can find something easily. Though if you want to fork out the dough, you can do valet.

lYGXirNbzzYq8gV5x5AxQQ.review_text: Personally, I love this place. It's nice, but not stiff or snobby. I love the entry. The back patio is charming. I had great service every time I've gone there. I can not speak for their pesto or gnocchi, as I've never had either there. I don't really recall what I've eaten all the times I've been, but I've always been pleased with my selections. And I grew up in an Italian household with a lot of home made food, so I'm not clueless as to what real Italian food should taste like. Overall, I've had completely pleasant and enjoyable experiences every time I've been there (probably about 6 times over a 10 yer span).

l7snvWeSdoGxofRe6JIGjw.review_text: Bocce cafe came to my rescue when I was trying to plan a surprise birthday dinner for my boyfriend, and all the restaurants I called said they would not seat our large group of 15!  The ambiance is lovely - as soon as you walk in, there's a covered walkway that was very Secret Garden-esque, and there's a beautiful patio to the back that is probably great for wedding parties.  The owner/manager assured me that they were flexible with reservation numbers: "I can make your party 20 if you want!  No problem!"  I really appreciated this flexibility, because people kept showing up!  I loved the food, and the prices were really reasonable.  Every seemed to have a great time and enjoyed the meal, so I will definitely be returning here!

oWTsHWzpnOAPnAYrGgoa9g.review_text: Dropped in here while we were in the area, for a quick bite. I'd been here years ago and loved it but it has really gone down hill from what I remembered. The dining room was almost empty and smelled REALLY bad (my husband said he thought it smelled like dog poop). Service was good but the salad I ordered was iceberg lettuce with Kraft Italian dressing. I sent it back and was given a mixed green salad with a basalmic vinegarette that was so strong I could hardly eat it. Both of our entrees were good but we couldn't get out of there fast enough. The smell alone was enough to put me off my food. Should have left as soon as we walked in.

lxvVnNWEqR4bV5ZGuQiRkw.review_text: Food was OK, nothing spectacular. I had the linguini with mussles which wasnt bad, but it wasnt great either.   The service was very attentive, but almost TOO attentive?? I almost felt like she was rushing to get us out the door.   Normally I would rate it 3 stars, but I took a star away because the valet misplaced our keys and we ended up waiting 45 minutes outside while the guy was running around looking for our car.   Anyways, the atmosphere was really cool- live music and just alot of people drinking wine and having a jolly good time.

SgPvn5Fe0xxCBEKSLBOHSQ.review_text: This is the cutest place. Wonderful, warm, and homey feeling, plus a kickass outside eating space and an additional covered area, great for parties and groups and such.  The food itself is decent, nothing to rave about but solid good food in nice big portions. I had the salmon fettuccine in marinara, which was really tasty. My sister ordered the steak - it was way too well done, but it was okay. My dad had the eggplant and garlic pizza and my mom had the calzone, which they said were okay - missed the mark, but didn't murder a dish either. Plates run around $10-$15 and $20 if you want a more expensive dish.  The service was excellent - we munched on endless bread while we waited and our water glasses were always full - ALWAYS a plus considering the restaurant was pretty busy (it wasn't packed -- you'd need a lot of people to do that).  If I'm ever in North Beach I'd definitely come, but is it worth the trip and the tedious job of finding parking? I'll get back to you on that one...

x3C237jwrtQhDdhDy7TznA.review_text: We asked for an intimate table in the corner, and we got it!  The food is delicious, the pricing is just right, and our server was great.  There is nothing NOT to like, and, when the weather is nice, ask for a table on the patio.

nCYcZqc1S2q-8_NvL2Lrww.review_text: A good old standby resturant in one of my favorite neighborhoods. Tucked down a little alley, the cavern like setting is fun.  Good, cheap food, but service can be fairly non-existent. With the giant Chianti bottles, who can complain? The outdoor patio is great.  The live music is amusing!

ew4eihP7EKp4iYJ3JGJlUA.review_text: Came here for my friend's birthday.  The service was good, but not great.  The food was also good, but not great.  With that being the case I feel like it is a little pricey for what it is.  The establishment is nice though. Large and open with very comfortable seating.  I didn't actually sit out on the patio, but it looked very cute from the inside.  I could imagine a cute little date night set up out there on a warm evening.

iYzbRy7B_Ho3NX-1rXvRLQ.review_text: Pretty much average Italian food, but I wasn't impressed with the stray cats that lurk around your table when you dine on the patio.  Sick!  There is better food around North Beach.

fR6bUB3KSE_1QqTMo-2oNQ.review_text: Yummy in my TUMMY!!!  Bocce was on my list of places to go to in the Bay Area before I moved and I'm so glad I got to come back and check it out!   We were ~15 min late for our 9pm reservation on a Friday, but had no trouble getting seated immediately.  Service was quick like a rabbit.  Seriously, we ordered... had a few sips of wine... and the food was being placed in front of us.  Good food, too!  I had penne alla vodka and almost finished my whole plate.  I wanted to, but I was savoring it too much and everyone else's dishes had been taken away 5 minutes earlier.  Others in our party complained a little about lack of flavor in the alfredo and the ravioli... but they're complainers.    I loved the decor and layout of this restaurant too.  It felt like we were walking into a garden on the way in, but I was glad to see that we would be sitting in an actual building (i had forgotten how chilly SF gets at night)!  The live music was a huge PLUS.  There were a few really large groups, so it seemed to work well for them.  Great location for going out in North Beach.  Three cheers (and five stars) for Bocce Cafe!

wAeREtzI0ca_QCQiuXDwIQ.review_text: When you first walk in here, it's like a cheap log cabin.  The decor is interesting the first time around, but the second time around it seems a little tacky to me.  Just my two cents.  Some people think of it as a great date place because of the lighting and because it's Italian food, but I can think of many better other spots..  The food is decent.  It's average Italian food in my opinion.  Ideale is better.

cXoKpS2xgsAuZlmR__Dm-g.review_text: I live down the street from Bocce Cafe, and my sister went there a few times for dinner.  She seemed to like it a lot, and said the food was pretty reasonably priced, so I had to check it out.   The ambiance and decor is cute, and the wait staff is friendly.  The food however... eh. I thought the prices were okay (not really on the cheap side) and the food taste was okay.  Nothing spectacular to be honest. When I asked my sister, she said she was referring more so to the pizzas which I guess makes sense.

6cWE0CYDP5zflNMjnwO5Cg.review_text: Came for my cousins wedding rehearsal dinner.  There were maybe 50 people that attended. Great service, pretty good food!    Try the Chicken Parmigiana, very tasty.  Also the fried calamari was very good. Tiramisu was mediocre.  The spumoni ice cream was very good.  Pretty cool place, very loud.  I have a 6 month old that we brought with us and it was tough for her to take a snooze.  If you can find a sitter for your infant youngster, it would be best.  My 8 year old had a lot of fun, there was an area outside that the kids ran around in.

pD8FQ7VF8uWvr7WZ184dtg.review_text: update: 1/14/08 ok people. I have proof. This is a video of what happens when you leave your car with Bocce's valet service. cbs5.com/investigates/sf… ------------------------ This review is for Bocce's valet service only. I have never been to the cafe. But if you are planing on leaving your car in the hands of these maniacs, please read my review. It may make you think twice before you leave your car with these people. yelp.com/biz/wQq1urdpyaz…

KU1rWCbKZjGlLsw_0qFe6w.review_text: This is a gem.  Great food, reasonably priced by SF standards, very old time North Beach.  Use to be the Spagehetti Factory. You can smoke outside on the patio under old, majestic fig trees.  Great for two or great for a gang.  Love it !!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!  I've had many work parties there for lunch or dinner.

m07sy7eLtOjVdZ8oN9JKag.review_text: Suburbanites looking for a traditional North Beach dining experience need look no further than Bocce Cafe. More than a cafe, it's roomy inside, it has lots of patio seating in the back, and it has a menu rivaled only by the Olive Garden in its predictability and blandability. OK, maybe that's not completely fair since Bocce does offer non-OG dishes like cioppino and mussels bordelaise. But it is kid-friendly which is why you are likely to be among boisterous families with gaggles of ADD monsters who would rather be on their Playstations. If you can get past the anarchy, you can find decent Italian food here.  Bocce also has the benefit of being slightly off the beaten track as it sits on a residential block on Green right off Grant. Truth be told, Jamie W. and I ended up here only because the new Original Joe's was an absolute zoo, and we didn't feel like being squeezed into a bar table an hour later. Bocce at 5:30PM was the exact opposite - near-empty and overstaffed. We were hungry, so we shared a couple of appetizers right away. And since it was before 6PM, we could take advantage of the fact that they were half-off. Woo-hoo. Jamie ordered the $9.95 Combination of Fried Calamari and Fried Mozzarella Cheese with Tomato Sauce (see photo). Pretty average.  I went with the $8.95 Prosciutto Melon, which was hamstrung by unripened cantaloupe slices despite the salty-tasty prosciutto wrapped around them (see photo). However, given the discounted prices, we didn't feel we had that much room to complain. Our risk-averse entrees were marginally better even though we did steer away from the pricier temptations on the menu. Jamie simply had the $10.95 Spaghetti & Meat Balls, which was surprisingly sparse on the vermicelli but generous on the meatballs (see photo). The sauce was also a tad watery, but Jamie didn't seem to mind as he devoured it in near-record time.  I ordered one of the $9.95 Bocce House Pasta Specials, Linguine Carbonara, which was loaded with cream and bacon bits (see photo). What's to complain about with such artery-clogging goodness? I decided to undercut the creamy indulgence with a $4.95 side of Beef Meatballs (see photo). Two big, meaty spheres bathing in a pool of tomato sauce. We were full and considering a return visit for the live music they have on Friday and Saturday evenings when apparently a jazz combo plays. It wasn't the finest meal we ever had in North Beach, but we could have definitely done a lot worse.  FOOD - 3 stars...standard-issue Italian for big families AMBIANCE - 3.5 stars...spacious for a North Beach venue, something to consider for your next big get-together SERVICE - 3 stars...good at first and then drifted as more customers trickled in TOTAL - 3 stars...mangia at your own discretion

NPUJSuE15zYjgjsrSWMe3g.review_text: Great ambience, very reasonable prices, good italian food, and a great location- a 2 minute walk to Chinatown for trinket shopping after dinner.

gqZvcNfUYWFsZNiZXfS4fA.review_text: standard italian food with HUGE portions...but what makes bocce cool is the decor! the outside patio is whimsical, and the indoor dining area is neat too.

PmTAFPoq3bufn9FVxCWRvA.review_text: wait, i'm sorry, was stealing from me on the menu?   i came here last month with friends and was actually pleasantly surprised, for a short while. it was like a ski resort lodge tucked away in an alley in north beach, totally unexpected. the food was tasty enough, perfectly portioned and priced. we gave them an extra tip simply because christmas was approaching.  actually, the dinner was $228 dollars more than i anticipated. which is why this obligatory 1 star i am giving them is EXTREMELY GENEROUS.  i really don't appreciate how dishonest they were. i accidentally left my burberry scarf on my seat and when i turned around to come back for it, they said they had no idea what i was talking about. i asked the several workers and they all -- burberry what? scarf what? no, no such thing. we didn't see anything. so from the time i left the restaurant to when you cleaned the table (which you did the moment we got up from our seats), you had a lapse of memory loss? i'll admit, the negligence was my fault. but stealing is not something i can justify by any means. and who are you to punish my accidental negligence by stealing from me?!  i'll NEVER come back here, simply because of that.   the scarf was once a gift given to me, and now i hope the scarf made a good dishonest christmas gift filled like a stocking with bad karma for the giver, asshole.

IvwAzC9amLojgo75NV5Uow.review_text: Food is awesome Perfect for groups Reservation a must Service is 5 stars   Took a group of 20 and enjoyed the night with Jazz music. Lots of laughter shared on the table. Decor is very charming too

Ed20T0T3jkAqVBBiyXju6A.review_text: Review #700!!!  Solid 3.5 stars  Portion size is large for lunch! Make your meal family style so you get to try variety!  We requested to sit out doors and the entire patio was ours :)  We ordered: 1) Comp house bread--delish (5/5) since it was FREE! 2) Antipasto della casa--good but not worth the money (3/5) 3) Fried Mozzarella stick (3/5) 4) Mozzarella Caprese (3.5/5) 5) French fries (3.5/5) Delish! Fresh out of the fryer 6) Penne Portobello (4/5) 7) Spinach Ravioli (2.5/5)  Overall good; Prices were fair too

KCWysczcR8t41gHqH2XOyg.review_text: Cold bread, calamari was cold and it smelled like the bar needed cleaned! I would not waste your time here when you are this close to authentic Italian restaurants.

mbqsM-bccmGA8J5LFcrxRg.review_text: My sister recommended this restaurant when I was trying to find a nice restaurant to celebrate and early Christmas with my girlfriend.   Food: Obviously the most important part of the restaurant is the food. I thought the food was fairly decent, although I wouldn't say out of this world. The portions are generous for the price we paid.   Environment/Setup: I must say the restaurant is deceptive right from the beginning. The entrance to the restaurant, in my opinion, doesn't do the inside justice. As you pass the valets at first glance it seems like you're walking through a garden. But as you walk you'll see the restaurant to your right. Although I do like the setup of the restaurant, it was confusing in the beginning. There was a table right next to the entrance of the restaurant but was empty with just a book opened up. But after a while no hostess approached us (or the group in front of us). So I noticed two waitresses standing at a table in the middle of the restaurant, I approached them and they seated us (I guess there was a bit of confusion). The lighting of the restaurant wasn't too bright which was what I was hoping for, although considering the amount of light, there was a lot of noise going around. But you have to expect that when there's large groups there. Overall the place was setup to create a more authentic Italian feel, but it's nothing I haven't seen from other Italian restaurants I've been to.  Service: I don't think there's any complaints with the service, waitresses were responsive and the food came out quicker than we thought, which was always good considering there were two large groups dining there at the time. Usually when you're at an Italian restaurant and there's large groups, you tend to wait a little bit longer for your food and service.   Parking/Price: For parking, well you're in North Beach you can't expect much. I'll admit it took us a while to find parking (at least for free) but hey you're in North Beach and it's going to be like that for every restaurant you go there. The restaurant itself is located on the edge of a residential block, so parking on that side becomes extremely limited, although everywhere else there's a decent amount of parking. But I can tell during the day, it's gotta be hell trying to park around this area, so I guess we got lucky since it was nighttime. For pricing considering it's North Beach I was expecting a much larger bill, but for the amount of food and the ambiance of the restaurant, it wasn't bad.  Overall I thought the restaurant was good but it wasn't anything out of the ordinary. I was trying to figure out whether to give it a 3 or a 4 but I'm going to give it a 4 for now, because it's usually better to review after you've been to the restaurant more than once. But I do plan on coming back here sometime. While it doesn't make my top restaurants, I would still recommend this restaurant to anyone.

QcPN-Dee_dU2IWno-f2oYA.review_text: I went there just for DRINKS so this is NOT A REVIEW FOR FOOD.  The atmosphere is nice and pretty, and surprising.  I didn't expect this restaurant and the patio to start with a door-way size opening on green street.  A friend and I sat at the bar just for drinks, and it was pleasant.  The bartender could have been more attentive, but it was not bad service at all.  Good ambience.

nBbhJmzhXRQaQwyL3VnwAw.review_text: I would recommend this place if you're throwing a party.  Had my bridal shower here on a Saturday afternoon.  We were situated outside, in the back of the restaurant.  It was a really cute place.  It has a garden like feel to it with all the trees around us.  It was nice.  The food, I would say it was good even though I'm not much of a fan for Italian food but everyone enjoyed the food and some probably ate a bit too much.    I'd recommend bridal showers and baby showers in the afternoons here since the place is pretty quiet at that time and if feels like you have the whole place to yourselves.

yZbDsPetl-ePLTxywjU58A.review_text: love the garden ambience and cozy...food is presentable..one of my fav in northbeach to lounge and eat...

cZcmHb-449_At6eSRTXbZg.review_text: Food: 4-Stars Service: 4-Stars  Ambiance: 3.5-Stars  Presentation: 4-Stars Worth the Money:  5-Stars Overall Evaluation:  4-Stars  My family emigrated from Calabria, Italy.  We lived outside of NYC decades and finally came to California.  We value meals that taste like they came from the family kitchen... that's what we found at Bocce.  Often, people get Italian and Italian-American food mixed up.  The difference is the over usage of cheese, salt, and overly acidic tomato sauce that results in a metal taste on the back of your tongue.  Bocce serves high quality dishes (especially the one that include eggplant).  I've been there 4+ times.  I will provide more feedback upon my next visit.  Quality of Food: * * * *  Quality of Service: * * * *  Ambiance: * * * -  Presentation of Food: * * * *  Worth the Money: * * * * *  Overview: * * * *

VSRtEK_c84oJygZ0OX0Oqg.review_text: Chicken parmigiana was good. Girlfriend had linguini with arrabbiata sauce and prawns (or shrimp?). She enjoyed it. Service could've been a bit better. Our server wasn't very attentive.

gkUCyghO1V1k7XFnw3h4IA.review_text: I was simply not impressed with the food. I mean, I go to a restaurant to eat, right?  Ambience is romantic, the live music is loud, (date approved, not girls night), the service is slow, but that was fine with us. We weren't in a rush!   We ordered the margherita pizza, mistake. We ordered linguini with clams and mussels, eh. The caesar salad was a tad bit overdressed.  I feel like we went to a "Plan B" restaurant....A restaurant of second choice.

OHVwV_HxELd40nOP_W5afw.review_text: I say that this restaurant belongs on the show "Restaurant Impossible."   As we walked through the "alley-way" entrance, it looked very romantic.  So, we peeked in to find that it was completely dead (granted it was a Monday) but my boyfriend heard a bunch of people in the patio so we decided to stay and eat there. The waiter asked if we wanted an outdoor seating or indoor, I asked if there were heat lamps outside (since SF is always cold at night) but there weren't so we took the seats nearest to the windows. The place looks like it needs major dusting and a new coat of paint. Also, what is that HUGE AC/Heater/Generator thing that's dangling in the middle of the room on the ceiling??   The waitress was nice, but she seemed a bit uninformative of the menu.  We asked "what must we get here?" She pointed to the "share" item for two, not explaining why... it didn't look appealing so we didn't get it.  Another waiter was right-by so we asked him what's good.  He seemed to know what he was talking about. He recommended the grilled portabello mushroom with blue cheese and the linguini pescatore.  Sounded great, so we ordered that with a side of meatballs as an app. And two glasses of wine.   First, the bread comes out with a side of balsamic vinegar and olive oil. The bread tasted old, but we were hungry so we ate it anyway. Our wine tasted spoiled, so during our dinner we asked when was the bottle opened but waitress wasn't sure and she was kind enough to replace our wines with a newly opened bottle. The wines were so much better! When our meatballs came out, the texture was very mushy (like mashed potatoes), yuck! The portabello mushroom with blue cheese came after, this was so awful, the whole entire plate was drenched in a type of honey/balsamic sauce that was so over-powering then combining that flavor with melted blue cheese... I was disgusted. I wasn't looking forward to our seafood linguini, since our apps and wines were terrible. We shared the seafood linguini, it was nice of them to split it into two bowls for us. Hoping there were some fresh grated pepper and Parmesan but nada. The linguini were eh.. but the mussel tasted also OLD... Had a few bites and I was so DONE!  Lets just say I wished we went to Olive Garden instead. Oh and my boyfriend went and grabbed a pizza after.   1 Star for the nice waitress but it ends there.

gjZp61JZaqcLrKjEDVSPIQ.review_text: This place is good for groups.  They have live music on the weekend.  The food ain't bad.  It's gentle on the wallet, too.

IG9oulUO-tprUZOY4jfG3g.review_text: The interior is desperately in need of an update.    And there's much better food in North Beach at better prices.

caTyk-CW_wiY7znfJrCXqA.review_text: Parking sucks...but there's valet.  Calamari, Prawns Bordelaise, Gnocchi, just to name a few are pretty good.  Cute little place in North Beach to grab a bite.  Maybe not so baby-friendly for busy evenings, but nonetheless, food still a must to try.

gTHfTuSquAd3S-vgezZ_9g.review_text: Been here a few times - usually with a small group of friends.  Gets kind of noisy but a good place to go if you have a group.  The outdoor patio area has a nice atmosphere and the inside isn't bad either.    Prices are reasonable - food is pretty standard, nothing spectacular.

ZztSdVB-ryMbQp1amckV9Q.review_text: Had dinner with some friends here while I was in SF. Not a bad place, but not the best either. They have kind of a cool garden/patio area out in the back (with heaters). Inside it was just way too loud to hold a conversation. Though they did have a jazz band playing in there that sounded pretty good.   The food was okay. I had the tortellini and my husband had the clams. They were both good, and the drinks were pretty good. Overall it's good, worth going to again.

CXKptjJG5g0qhreV3I3RYA.review_text: We dined here for a friend's birthday and there may have been three other groups celebrating a birthday as well since one table would sing Happy Birthday then the next, then us. The live band performs while we wait for our food, which was a really long time, but when conversing and drinking, the waiting doesn't seem so bad because once the appetizers wereserved, you'll forget how long you've been waiting.   Food -3 stars Ambiance - 5 stars Meal - $30 per person

ROIpr8z9XFpngIAG_k77hg.review_text: You know, for a place that has been in business for years ages (18-19 years), it's still retained the same homey feel as when I first visited about 5 years ago to today. And that's a good thing.  Food is solid and waitstaff excellent.

YEB1pj90TVwomI97OBqPKQ.review_text: Our group of 9 came on Sunday night and were seated immediately.  The restaurant was only 25% utilized.  However, the food was very good and the service was attentive and helpful.  We all had different dishes and everyone was happy with their meal.  This is definitely a place for large groups.

egRIlgQu-EIXItZUC4_fKw.review_text: Decent priced Italian Food in North Beach without the long waits.  Big space, with cozy couch seating up front.  The bar/wine list is pretty bare bones though.

qmlWYCCKKqX4S-cRVGL2_w.review_text: Well... My peers and I chose this restaurant to take our class to, and I must say that we had a great time.  I've never been to Italy, but I thought my dish(A trio of Fettucini, Gnocchi, and pesto ravioli) was marvelous.  Can't complain.  I'm not sure it was a typical Italian restaurant setting, but the food was pleasing to the palette, and the staff appeared to be true to Italian service, as well as being Italian themselves.  This experience has definitely  drawn me closer to my lifelong desire of stepping into the country of Italy... I can't wait! If you're interested, check out my Project North Beach! @ joelweston.wordpress.com…

onXQyLokT4mdI7Ac10-kPQ.review_text: Amazing!!! The owner was super friendly. There was live music the night I went with a large group (12 people).  Although I arrived late, they were able to seat me with the group and bring out my dinner in under 5 minutes. Now that's service! The map of Italy on the placemat was useful to find where my friend PS is from (ROME!).

iWJvXrItPJ4nxx8HLJukBA.review_text: This is a great place for birthday parties, in fact this may be the only reason why people go to this restaurant.  I have been there three times and they were all for birthday parties, ironically.  This last time I was there there were about 10 birthday parties going on at the same time. Anyways, the point is that Cafe Bocce is exceeding spacious, so large parties are very accessible.  Waiters are very accommodating and experienced when it comes to serving large parties.  It was reasonably priced and the food was great!

CNB1WsGa5mO4DmMeJ7O1Cw.review_text: Went back to Bocce with some gals before seeing "The Drowsy Chaperone" this weekend. I'm still impressed with how CHEAP this restaurant is. The four of us had four glasses of wine, two appetizers, four salads, four entrees, two desserts, and three coffees for about $30 a person after tax and tip. That's just unheard of for a decent meal in a North Beach restaurant.   Have to say, however, that we tried dessert this time and I wasn't all that impressed. We tried the "Black Magic" chocolate cake and Bocce's Tiramisu. I'd pass on both. Head to Naia on Columbus for gelato instead.

K_hCqC-OASPb22AEgOSGjQ.review_text: Hidden away on a hill a few blocks from Columbus, I never would have stumbled upon Bocce on my own but I'm glad I did.  I never come to North Beach because I hate the parking situation, but when I do, I always stick to the usuals - Stinking Rose, Steps of Rome, The House.  So I'm glad I was forced to branch out a little.  We had a huge party - about 20 people - and service was amazing (our waitress didn't make even one mistake the whole night).  We sat, ate, and drank for over three hours, with no hassle.  My penne vodka ($15) was yummy, calamari appetizer was good, and strangely, I found the fresh bread to be really moist and yummy.  A rustic feel on the interior of the restaurant.  Oh, and affordable decent wine - we had multiple bottles for $20 (or less) apiece.
