2zvUWE9erOVhGn8lLzdzuQ.review_text: We recently hosted a friend's birthday party/dinner here, and we really enjoyed the place.  Even though we in some ways didn't get the full experience since we were seated in their outdoor (though enclosed) patio, we really liked the food a lot.  My mezzelune alla spinaci (half-moon shaped spinach pasta) with roma tomatoes was dee-lish--my only complaint would be that the portion size was a little underwhelming, especially since I'd read that the portions here are pretty big, and that seemed to hold true for everyone else's meal.  That notwithstanding, my entree was flavorful and seemed very fresh.  They'd run out of grappa(!) and so I was thwarted in my attempt to try a caffe coretto, but the waiter was very helpful and honest in helping me navigate other options--and I can't say I'm sorry I changed course entirely to try their cheesecake, which was phenomenal.  It's true that for some, Bocce Cafe will lose authenticity points for serving sourdough bread instead of traditional Italian, but hey--we *are* in San Francisco and it makes sense in that context.  A wide array of choices on the menu and the curiosity to eat inside--so as to more fully take in the lively decor and the jazz combo--do make me want to come back some time soon...

-9CxMilArd4h1h-je5WkHQ.review_text: Where else can you get an authentic tasting Italian meal, generous portions and awesome atmosphere ? Bocce Cafe!

o0DMD32kV-yTdfJY7JsAxw.review_text: Great Italian food and great price.  They serve bread with a dipping sauce of garlic cloves soaked in balsamic vinager and olive oil which was delicious.  We ordered bruscchetta which was good but it was too toasty and crumbled with every bite.  I ordered penne with salmon and vodka sauce which was really good.  The pasta was al dente and had a great flavor which left the salmon chunks bland on their own.  I would order this again without the salmon.  They have a nice outdoor patio which was shaded and seemed perfect for an afternoon lunch but we were seated next to a large window that overlooked it.  there was some sort of company meeting taking place taht reserved the entire patio, no worries, we enjoyed our lunch and learned about the various ways to overcome challenges at the workplace.

e-FsoHJGBAeNIcJvKnJYVw.review_text: We were looking for a restaurant to accomodate a 16th birthday party for 11 young ladies, my husband and myself. We couldn't have found a better venue than the Bocce Cafe. The waiter, Jacob, was very respectful and patient with the girls (to help I gave him a list of all their orders upfront). He insured they had everything they needed or wanted. He even arranged for a special dessert and birthday song from the very enjoyable duo they have which sing classic dinner music. This is a very interesting and pretty restaurant. Being off the beaten tourist path is a little quieter and architecturally interesting. The food and service was very good also. As a native San Franciscan, I didn't know about this place until I found it on the net and was very pleased with the results. We look forward to going back there as a family. Very enjoyable, not to mention, they have valet parking for only $10.

Kg4VJYP60seaknupX3iP9w.review_text: Hi, three of us went here last Saturday after an afternoon at the baseball. It was a recommendation of a friend.   It was good value for money with nice food. It was nothing special but it was good "home style" Italian cooking. For the three of us, it cost about USD100 plus tip which was pretty good value-for-money.  The decor is nice, the staff friendly and the food and drink selection is good.  The only downer was that they had some musicians playing during during dinner and they were a little loud making conversation difficult. There were a few other loud tables and the stone floor bounces the noise around so that was a little irritating.   It's also in walking distance of lots of great bars for before and after.  Give it a go.  AW

1NBeKcRmhj67OSeGUOxdrw.review_text: Things that went wrong:  Some of us received our entree 20+ mins later than the rest.  We got our entrees BEFORE our apps and when asked why, the server said she thought we would want to eat it together. Ok....  3 times we had to have them change the check because they kept forgetting to take off items we never got.  Not so good food and the service was horrible.

vYLEDF29uHRS9TK38ow3YQ.review_text: Great service great food.  Excellent value for your money.  Wonderful large party service.  All staff very attentive.  Tiramasu to die for.  Try it soon!

EjQdVKrGOE7oUz7kpBGv4Q.review_text: I'll admit, when we first walked in and my friend said "i feel like i'm in a lodge," i had to kind of agree. But that was kind of nice. It's a really relaxed environment, it's actually relatively inexpensive and the service was really nice. And, extra kudos for the live band!

XnbGrJNw0wglmqXekW138Q.review_text: i think that bocce is a good standby when you dont have reservations or just want a good cheap italian meal.  i've never been totally impressed with their food but i also have never had a bad meal.  i especially like their lasagne, chicken piccata, and bruschetta.  its definitely a fun place to go with a group too, its usually busy and loud and fun.  they do have outside seating which is nice.

_oV5nI6Zf_dQSYHjS7V3eg.review_text: They have your basic decent, inexpensive, stick-to-the-ribs type of Italian cooking at this out of the way North Beach restaurant.  The outside patio definately makes it a worthwhile trip on a sunny afternoon.

SW-U6u1gbCD2XctrW9L3QQ.review_text: When three winos get together, where do they go for dinner?  Bocce!   At first glance, you would never know it was there, but you enter into an oh-so-cute I wish I was riding a light green vespa cozy and busy dining room. For my roommates birthday we made the (very wise) decision to go for the inexpensive and plentiful carafes of wine and tasty food.   Their pasta was just right.  I had a dish with vodka tomato sauce and Italian sausage and it was delicious and surprisingly light .  My roommate ordered the Gnocchi though and it put my dish to shame- it practically melted in the mouth (and I don't really like Gnocchi.)  For the price, it can't be beat.

9QUc43ndukaWJn4zp9qKbw.review_text: The Man took me out for a night in The City! We hit Golden Gate Park and ended up here at the Bocce Cafe. Great atmosphere and tasty food. We split the Appetizer Plate for two and had two glasses of the Chianti red wine, I can't remember which one, but it was good. The appetizer plate plus the bread (by the way totally awesome) was a decent amount of food, and we still had some walking to do so we skipped the main course and went right into dessert, a slice of chocolate cake with strawberry glaze. It was a little dry, but all in all I had a good time and the wait staff was very friendly. Will definitely go back and order a real dinner.

DH7ABAMHvl6IQfJ_yK7x5Q.review_text: We were still out having a grand ol' time when the food coma & drunken pass-out hit the restaurants of North Beach after the festival.  So, when we were famished and in need of pasta, we were coming up empty.  Capp's- closing up, Sodini's- doors barred.  Pizza was looking like the only option but we gave one last try at Bocce Cafe.  Practically trotting up the lush little walkway, we entered the restaurant to find only the staff in the place, but still completely eager to serve!  We sat in one of the corner booths, complete with a comfy bench and thick pillows.  Even though it was late, they didn't skimp on the service... the sourdough was continuously replenished, and wine, water, and dessert were checked up on.  The space was impressive... supposedly an old spaghetti factory, the ceilings were high, the lights low, and the decor very Roman.  They also had a great little patio.  As for the food, pretty solid:  tasty pastas in trusty sauces.  I liked my gnocchi but wished it had a creamy sauce to compliment.  A great late-night find... always in need of those!

wgrQxY37BGWxGCLr3wG7Gw.review_text: I came here today w/ my firm for dinner.  One word... "EH."  The service was great and the ambiance was interesting, but the food was definitely nothing to write home about.  I had the spinach ravioli w/ marinara.  (I made spaghetti w/ a Trader Joe's jar of marinara the night before which was just as good.)  My friends who had the spaghetti w/ meatballs and lasagna complained about the sauce being too runny - you could tell just by looking at it.  The appetizers are pretty effin tasty, though.  But as far as the entrees go... EH.    I'd love to peep the spot during a performance, though.  Maybe I'll have a more memorable 2nd trip...?   To be continued...

Yu98_qkOrcPiKHVE6uu2gg.review_text: I give this 3.5 Great for big groups, a little loud, so you can't really talk to each other. I had the Mozzarella Caprese to start, it was good, not great. Then the Veal Marsala for dinner, again, good, not great. Very inexpensive. Okay Chianti.  Outside is quieter, but be sure it's a warm night or drink yourself warm.  I hear the bartender doesn't know the proper pour for a shot, so there's where the .5 came from!!! Parking is horrible, but everybody who lives in the city knows that about North Beach.

OWnYWg8L67W-moQJkjrXPQ.review_text: Really like this spot because of their unique setting.  The way you enter, the dining room, the bocce ball court in the back patio.  So many unique features and it still is fairly inexpensive.    Very festive and it seems like you are just eating at one of your old Italian ancestors homes with many friends.  I think with some of the commercials Olive Garden has, this is what they want to be.............

vASaF47nWvCHEEDA8nfCVw.review_text: This place reminds me of a friend's dormitory which I frequented back during my days as a poor college student for free meals: huge portion, disappointing food that taste as if they were cooked for an army of 10,000, uncomfortable straight-backed chairs, ultra-long wooden tables, sullen-faced waiters   and foul-smelling, small and cramped ladies room with two cubicles and barely enough room to wash your hands afterwards.

rK4gc9k95SMSNXkwhArMqQ.review_text: VALET PARKING - need I say more?? Seriously - finding parking in North Beach any night of the week is like finding a needle in a haystack. No worries - Bocce Cafe has valet service and for 10 bucks for dinner you can park you car and not circle the block for an hour! Big restaurant - with an outdoor seating area - I've personally never seen anyone at the bar here - but that doesn't mean you can't order something to drink with dinner.  It's not fancy - it's not expensive it's just basic pretty good italian food. The staff is friendly and everytime we've been we've been seated immediately.  Good for larger groups as well. Oh & never asked to split tabs because when you do that they give you dirty looks! :)

cOVx-cTw3-CSbf_gnA7rFg.review_text: - Off the beaten path a bit - Very reasonable prices - Decent, but not overwhelmingly amazing food.  Have been several times now, but most recently for Valentine's Day. Had the following:  Apps: Minestrone Soup - bland, needed salt, seasoning - vegetables were mushy and had a fresh-out-of-can texture :).  Warm Spinach Salad - a bit overdressed, oily, but tasty bacon pieces.  Mains: Meat Lasagna - always good here.  Risotto Special - was also excellent...perhaps a bit creamy for some folks' taste, but I enjoyed.   Wine:  Organic Sangiovese (name is escaping me) - nice bottle for $30, but it came out half-chilled. I didn't have the heart to point out to the server that it was red wine and supposed to be served at 18 Celsius.   Service: Decent, but definitely a little lacking. No secondary amenities like offering parmesan or fresh pepper for mains, no table bread offered.  This is a good spott for casual, affordable Italian. Nothing fancy here.

R_aCqb62GyeU2h7OmSufeA.review_text: So here's my issue with North Beach restaurants, and why I really like Bocce Cafe a lot: Just because you change a lot of money for Italian food DOES NOT mean it's good and worth your money. I like to go out to eat a lot, but let's get real people, we're in a recession and I'm trying to get my money's worth. This is where Bocce Cafe comes in....great food and reasonable prices. It's not gonna blow your mind away, but it's better than average, for sure. This place never lets me down.       Bocce Cafe is the girl-next-door, to other trendy north beach restaurants being the done-up quad girl in high school that you wanted to date, and then when you did you found out that she's just shallow and doesn't offer any substance and dating her was a waste of time and money, and you are now much happier that you're dating a nice girl-next-door. Does that make sense?       Anyway, Bocce Cafe has a nice outdoor patio that I can't wait to try out during the summer, and a fun atmosphere inside with live music on weekends, and comfy couches to dine at. There's always a big party here that is celebrating some sort of occasion, so it's good for either a small or large group. Go here and give the girl-next-door of North Beach a chance!

scCqjr1-KoE0Q9P6vptG-Q.review_text: I can't submit the most informative or critical review of the food, because during a very late lunch at the tail end of the Union St. fair last Sunday, I ordered pizza.  Pizza is always good.  I don't care if you eat in the car, or if you eat it in a bar.  It's ALWAYS good.  I can, however, tell you that Bocce has a fantastic little patio (with heating lamps) that is draped in fig trees.  You can't help but feel comfortable tucked away from the busy streets in North Beach with a pre-lunch cocktail and the anticipation of warm bread and cheese that will be placed conveniently right in front of you.  The only drawback is the price.  Bocce must serve thousands of tourists that are looking for authentic Italian food in our famous district of San Francisco; hence the prices have been inflated slightly.  If you can afford to pay a little extra due to the location of Bocce, I think you'll find it's the perfect place to get started for an evening out on Broadway with friends, or just relax on a Sunday afternoon with family.  Just a thought, start each meal with a generous serving of Vodka.  It always makes the moments afterward a little more colorful.

nsU3GO1ldbTyusz7EASv-w.review_text: One of those San Francisco hidden places...old fashioned good Italian food...nothing fancy but really nice ambiance and good old food. Used to frequent Bocce very often when I worked in the City...now as often as I have the time while I am in SF.

iflEFcU3QJMEB9YFAsv72Q.review_text: It's cheap, good for big parties, and have live music...but the food is not good.  Food comes out cold, bland and...just don't go here.

R4UX9xJyAHAu_CiPWknjDw.review_text: Margherita pizza pie was delicious! Salmon pesto was OK, but nothing to write home about. Bread brought to table to dip in olive oil was the straight rizzle dizzle doggie fizzle. I coulda made it my meal!   What really stood out was the service. Very nice and accommodating. They close at 10:30p and we got there at 9:30p and asked if it was cool to order some food or if the kitchen was closed and we should look elsewhere. They said come on in!   At first I felt bad but I figured, "we asked and they said it was cool"...plus the food came out without any spit on it (to the naked eye).   Molto bella!

Y2X1wDDShz9inzwd3cOpew.review_text: When my boyfriend and I can't decide where to go for dinner we go to Bocce.  It's the perfect Italian restaurant for those of us who dread having to deal with the tourist-filled Columbus strip restaurants and cafes.  I often head to Bocce on my way home from work for some food to go - they're quick and the prices are just right.  Great wines, great bread, great pasta and the service is always nice - although one waitress didn't even know what Bocce is or how to play it.  I thought that was funny.

sd6iM-x0HamQ6YgrgBYSCA.review_text: Delicious food, great atmosphere and just a fun time.  We went on a Monday and basically no one was there.  A party of 6 but staff was still very attentive.  I would definitely recommend this place to anyone.  I will be back

E900k8TBLe6erG4CSnzV2Q.review_text: Saturday night this place gets packed, there were at least 3 birthday celebrations, as I discovered when the live jazz trio sang happy birthday for each group. Be sure to come in a group of no less that 4 or you may be waiting for a while. Better yet make a reservation. The decor is nice the outside patio looks great for parties and the place gets pretty loud so it works well for large groups. Our plates of food were very good and the service was adequate.  However, a table of four tourists sitting next to us, and who were seated before we were seated NEVER received their order! I noticed the old gentleman who had taken a picture of my group when we asked him, casually sitting at his table and enjoying the band. About an hour later he got the attention of a waitress and asked her "where is our dinner?!" Dang he was pissed... that must have sucked. Although our service was adequate I have to mark them down a star for service. Service = 2, Food = 3, Live music = 3 a very cliche' restaurant band that fits the room well.

I1dKh4olStlU7i-hEi4_TQ.review_text: The food was good, however the service was not so great. My eggplant and garlic pizza was delicious. However, I'm not sure why out of a party of 12 my dish came out dead last and like an additional 10 minutes after the last dish served? I wasn't the only one @ the table who had ordered a pizza though! So what is up with that? And we had to remind the waiter about our request several times... but this place is nice because it has a live band, can accommodate large groups, and seems pretty popular.

QoHxFuhlC0tN405ZDW4fxA.review_text: Used to go here when I lived in San Jose and had friends in the Marina.  It was always a cheap and good alternative to North beach rip off restaurants.  Unfortunately time has not changed the Bocce cafe, it has remained a cheap joint and it shows in the food.  Sauces are watered down, the eggplant parm had more skin that eggplant, the meatballs tasted like they were previously frozen and from the grocery store.  Place is dusty and dirty and dated.  Got to be other alternatives.

sFFdPjsKWMfZA0FbAK9pEw.review_text: The atmosphere is the best thing about this place. Got the vegetarian tricolore for 2 which was good, but mostly sauce. Wouldn't have been enough for 2 hungrier people. Not worth the $20. The bread sucked, and the balsamic vinaigrette at the table even tasted weird. Not the best wine menu either. But the atmosphere is nice. It was kind of romantically lit, which I think contributed to me having sex (with a MAN!) later in the night. So like, if you want to have sex after you eat at a restaurant you might as well try it out.

jy-YyFaGgbzuoJe6nMBDYw.review_text: Food is so so. Patio is great! Used to enjoy many a long lunch here.

5PXVfIG0TR_liOOI6au_HA.review_text: Ok, this place was very cool.   I was here in August of 2010, so forgive me for forgetting some of the details.   Five women out having a good time, in the fall, in The City, how could it get any better? I'll tell you how...walk into Bocce. If you like that rustic feel with boothy benches and high ceilings and "italian" atmosphere, this place'll do it. My one single complaint? It was noisy. A lot of stone and the high ceilings made for poor acoustics.   However, the gnocchi more than made up for it. The wine didn't hurt either. I love gnocchi, and I've tried to make it from scratch, so I KNOW how hard it is to get right. It is definitely one of those things that you have to work at and practice making. So, to get a bowl full of gnocchi that were tender and light and fluffy was very nice. We split some bruschetta too, which was also delicious. We might've had something else, but obviously these two things were the sticking points for me.   My friend actually asked me if I liked it because she didn't want to see a bad review of the place. Nothing bad here! I would go back in a heartbeat. And I would drink wine, eat bruschetta and nosh on gnocchi.   Thank you ladies for a wonderful evening!

A3x81aAKt1fkICRtOz-b3g.review_text: Great for groups, although the wait can be really long. We've been a few times for bday parties or just larger get togethers and it's typically a lot of fun. Good food with services which works well when you've got 10 people at a table.

dhM4hwhzK-2LivN7pAN2LQ.review_text: I was in North Beach for a festival and was starving and didn't want to eat standing up so my group walked up a black and found this joint.   It's actually really cute inside, very villa style-ish. We sat in the back patio  which was pretty packed. The appetizers were decent, mozzarella sticks & bruchetta. But my lunch is what made me fall in love. Four cheese pizza with mozzarella, Parmesan, Gorgonzola and feta. I had never had this combo before but I love cheese so I gave it a whirl. Was sooo NOT disappointed. It was delicious.   We all paid cash so had no problem or stress with paying.   The bathrooms are really dinky though. Good luck if you're the claustrophobic type.

65uUyG9yuF0rdMh0z7ajaA.review_text: A large space, so it's pretty good for groups, but the food is no better than average. Live jazz occasionally.

qYtceH6w5ZD2_CKsZCJdqQ.review_text: While I agree that this is one of the few places in North Beach that is 'good for groups', it should be noted that this place is really only "good" if you lack taste buds or appreciate American Italian food (which is actually redundant). The pesto was radioactive green and the gnocchi was squish. The Chianti was weak. The hostess was nice, so there's your one star. Overall, a slander to my people.

L69NF0v_oRoAqr-al3qIxQ.review_text: Well ordered some food to go and it wasn't stellar in fact so bad I think they need to call in the folks from Restaurant Impossible.  The pasta fettuccine alfredo sauce could have come from a can with no seasoning.  The bread was terrible and at least a day old. Uninspired and the sign of an establishment on the way down.  when you don't care neither does anyone else.

lIM5d1HsNmdkn9LzV8gKNw.review_text: We had a good experience here. Really comfy seating at the booths. Tasty tasty Caesar dressing and excellent anti pasta salad. I loved the chicken picatta too! Not 5 stars but a solid 4.

M0ogKoJH2ZDICUz-xrniWA.review_text: I came here last night with 3 of my friends and sat in the patio outside because the weather was gorgeous at 7pm still (rare in SF)!   Why the 2 star? Honestly, the food was great. For appetizer, we shared buffalo wings and fried calamari. Beware - the buffalo wings are DEFINITELY on the spicier side... For entree, I had the Penne Portobello (which was absolutely delicious and only $15). They also allow you to BYOB but charge $12 corkage fee FYI.  We were just VERY annoyed with the service (or lack of). From the time we sat down, 7:10-15pm... we literally sat there for 1 hour and 20 minutes and still did NOT receive our food. We ended up having to take our entree to go because we had other obligations. When we finally walked up to ask for the check, it took another 20 minutes to PROCESS the check. We actually ended up walking up again to hand over the credit cards and the check. The whole paying process alone took almost 25-30 minutes!!!!!   This would be acceptable if the restaurant was SUPER crowded / busy.. but that was not the case at all. We just kept being forgotten (or something!).

Tb-JkeFvX9krPI3kCYtCnQ.review_text: There are MUCH better places for dinner in North Beach and in San Francisco proper. We went on a Tuesday and the place was empty.   The best thing about this meal was the wine and my dining companions. Other than that, nothing special.   The bruschetta was okay. The carpaccio was blah. It just felt like an over processed canned food kinda place. Nothing felt homemade. The gnocchi were pretty good but the sauce was nothing you couldn't get at an Olive Garden  Try a different spot in North Beach

N8j2-22fGnRFDXGo16pNwQ.review_text: Never really knew about this place before but just sort of wandered into it.  Kind of a big, wooden room, like a lodge, kind of 70s style.  nice little patio out back in a courtyard.  not crowded, at least on Sunday night.  surprisingly cheap prices.  friendly enough service.  food okay, but nothing special.  lots of warm bread brought out complimentary.  atmosphere, esp the courtyard, are probably the best things here.

gA-CZ4lusCbljn0AsInirg.review_text: food was eh - average, overpriced North Beach Italian.  The only reason they are getting 3 stars and not 2 is because of the back courtyard.  It was the perfect place to enjoy a glass of wine on a fine Indian Summer evening.  And they have a house cat - a little calico missing it's tail and with tore up ears.  He was the sweetest thing ~ was tempted to take him home.  I asked if he had a name, but I guess he's not liked enough to be named.  So, we named him "gnocchi" cause he was kind of shaped like a dumpling.  So, go there to enjoy the back patio and hang out with Gnocchi, but don't go there for the food.

mL8c25qywW6_oRX9z4m1YQ.review_text: I decided to try this place out because I see it all the time when I visit my aunt. The entryway is nice...that's what really drew me in, they also have outside seating. I came here with a group of 8 or so and we had a good time. The atmosphere is nice and good for groups. The food was good and the service...don't really recall much about it. overall it's pretty good.

N3joXEbEYn5ljRNqVpdHNA.review_text: after a 20 minute walk from the financial district (yes, i walked it), their allyway covered in plants and greens was soothing after my long walk.  the service was a bit lacking from the beginning. i was unaware of the fact that i was the first to arrive from my party, but upon asking the hostess if the organizer had arrived, she looked on her list and directed me to the outdoor patio. there was a huge party in which i obviously did not belong in. i awkwardly walk back in, out the door and back through the allyway to the sidewalk.  friends started to arrive and we move in. we were placed right next to the live band which made any conversation across our long table impossible. it was hard enough to hear the person next to me without screaming. it defeated the purpose of the dinner--to bid farewell to our departing friend. i dont think i was able to say a word to her as space was limited and was unable to move.  as for the meal, my friend and i decided to share - fettuccini pollo: heavy in cream but appropriate portion for two. a bit lacking in the pollo. the heavy cream gave it the right amount of flavor, but i think i would've preferred less cream and more taste. - margherita pizza: nothing spectacular-pizza.  although my meal was alright, my friends ordered the lasagna which was delicious. it came out piping hot and the cheese was nice and melted. my little taste of the lasagna trumped my pizza.  all in all, i wasnt too impressed with bocce cafe, but thanks for the exercise.

3_FKjtRXuVqGOPiEalOIsg.review_text: Pros: Nice interior, set back away from the street. Large open interior. Servers are friendly. Piano player. Large groups.  Cons: check your water or any other drink for insects, they will land in them. There is open communication between the outside so all the gnats, fruitflies and mosquito's come in. The food is average, bland and not so memorable. The drinks are OK, nothing special. Kind of weak pours so stick with wine or beer.  They open at 6, and besides the giant group I was with not another soul until after 9 walked thru the door.

yWTj88TCZNXfoYbew7N6ng.review_text: A friend recommended Bocce Cafe a few years ago and I'd been meaning to check it out but kept forgetting.  Tonight I had out of town friends visiting and all the obvious places on Columbus were packed,  so we headed over to try Bocce.  We were the only ones in the restaurant but we decided to try it out, and it was a great call.  They have a very reasonably priced wine list ($23 for a bottle of chianti is fabulous in SF), and my gnocchi was probably the best I've had in North Beach.  There was a really wide variety of food for vegetarians and non.  The staff was very attentive and sweet.  I can't wait to bring more friends to try Bocce soon!

WY80xu9YqOx3vex8fPJu7Q.review_text: GREAT birthday dinner with 25 friends and it was PERFECT! Service was great and the food was good and we are all able to talk and enjoy ourselves!   Wish I remembered more to YELP... but guess that means it was a successful night!

XjgqAO5ioujIuw_nrVMERg.review_text: For clarity: review is for their (very) new brunch service.  Our usual favorite for weekend breakfast was packed, but I saw a sign outside this place that said they were now open for brunch Friday-Sunday, with a complimentary mimosa. So in we went. We stopped in shortly before noon. The place was completely dead, but it sounds like they just started to do the brunch thing this weekend, so likely few knew about it.  My husband got the mimosa, and I got plain orange juice (we were charged for neither). The mimosa was "ok" per the husband, until he got to the last bit - extremely syrupy. That was my experience with the orange juice, too - like it was made from (bad) concentrate and they didn't use enough water. It was gross - I couldn't drink it.  Husband got the turkey omelette with the "fingerling potatoes" and ordered a side of pancakes. I got the smoked salmon benedict with the "fingerling potatoes" as well. Why the scare quotes? I'm not sure if they normally serve fingerling potatoes and were out or what, but what they served was french fries. (Obviously frozen bag french fries, too. Not terrible, but not at all what we ordered.) Husband reports that the flavors in the turkey omelette were seriously weird. He said it wasn't so much bad as odd, but he also didn't finish it (rare for him). He didn't receive the pancakes he ordered (and we were not charged for any).  My salmon benedict was also disappointing. They somehow managed to both overcook the poached egg (resulting in hard yolks) and bring it out cold (save for a tiny bit in the center of the yolk, which was lukewarm). The hollandaise and the English muffin were also cold - aside from the fries, there was nothing hot or even warm on my plate.  The service was not as bad as the food, but could use some ironing out. For example, they brought out a basket of fresh bread just as we were finishing what we ate of our food (and promptly took it away when they cleared the plates only minutes later). For part of the meal, we were the only people in the restaurant, and at no point were there more than three tables occupied; even still, the servers seemed very uncertain what they were doing.  It almost got points for the rich decor, the trellis walkway, and beautifully lush patio. It is a pretty place, and uncommonly large compared to most San Francisco eateries I've visited. The mood created by the decor was kind of killed by the combination of odd Italian music (I like a lot of Italian music, but this was weird) and a loud football game one of the servers turned on a few minutes after we arrived.  So... pretty, but I can't see any reason we'd ever return. There's plenty of pretty in San Francisco.

WdRdVg3-yGJ1uPY1mBDYeQ.review_text: Very cute little cafe to have lunch. It's very unassuming from the outside, and much more spacious when you enter. They have a nice patio outside too. They are known for their gnocchi, and we tried them with a pesto sauce, cream sauce, and Napolitano (tomato based) sauce. All were delicious and the gnocci was light and airy. My favorite was the cream sauce as it wasn't heavy but still retained all the flavor. The pesto was very bold and herbacious, very good too.

WdV_xJ-dhFHrqyMF3BNMuA.review_text: So I came here last night for the billionth time with a bunch of people as usual. There is a patio outside which is really cute and the restaurant itself is very unique.  Their service is great and the food is super cheap and good! Try the LASAGNA. It is bomb! I get it almost every time and never have any complaints.  It gets super packed so make reservations.  Parking is crappy but they have valet for cheap.  :)

LHl_3FXXF-XVUEXbl6NeEA.review_text: I give it 2 stars for food.  Not the best quality sauces.  Love the atmosphere though.  Big, airy, good for large groups.  Don't sit by the band.  Can get loud enough so that you can't hear the person sitting next to you.

ix7YZBT-AAhC1BPmx2velA.review_text: We were wondering on the street on a hot evening and trying to decide which Italian restaurant we should go in that area. He happened to see the sign of Bocce and remembered it has a lovely outdoor area. That what we need badly that day, a cool patio area.  We walked through the shade covered entrance, the whole world just cooled down. Stepped into the restaurant, I was attracted by the special decor. All natural wood structure, high ceiling, decorated by strings of garlics.  Maybe because I was concentrated on the decoration, I didn't realize there was no one came to seat us. But now when I think about it, it's us who went to find the waitress to seat us after stood there for some time.  It was great to be able to stay at green-covered outdoor area that day. It brings you peaceful mind and coolness. It's romantic no doubt, except that there were some really loud people. But they have the right to be happy and loud enjoying the nice place too.  I haven't been to many Italian restaurants in North Beach area, so I was pretty happy with the fact that I can have custom-made pasta even the taste is a little bit off. The wine I had is so so.

HYrhE2TyUTPMzIZSzgcqAA.review_text: came here twice for a party. place is good for large party, comfy atmosphere, nice outdoor seating for party. the dishes are average, the pasta didn't cook to al dente. food 2 star, plus 1 for the enviroment, with live music

GQeXr5kbcbpXuC7ZJzB1VQ.review_text: a good glass of chianti.  check.  comfy indoor and outdoors.  check.  cat walking around on the patio. check.      yeah....wtf?  i loved the food both times i went, but i was a bit sketched out about this potentially flea-ridden cat mingling close to my food.  i thought the pricing was reasonable...worth every penny.  going back for sure.

_BHTC7nyCBoZcfiiD5cOXg.review_text: Head through the Italian flag-colored gate and down a garden path to the entrance of this charming cafe, known for its inexpensive customized pasta dishes - you choose the noodle and sauce from a wide variety of options and they bring you a sizable and satisfying portion of the combo you selected. The linguini and clam sauce has fresh clams in their shells and tons of garlic, and ravioli is clearly fresh, not frozen. The Caesar salad is perfect, and chicken and veal conjure memories of Nana's Sunday dinners. Out back, there's a patio that's perfect for sunny days or summer evenings when the fog doesn't roll in, and if the place is full and it's a live jazz night, you might want to opt for al fresco dining to avoid the din. Parking in North Beach is always a frustrating experience, but at least Bocce will reward you for your efforts. Great for groups and music lovers.

1car04FtcGvorI-2pIlUyg.review_text: Wow.   We had my future sister-in-law's wedding shower here this past weekend and it was seriously better that we could have imagined. We reserved one half of the outdoor patio and thankfully the weather was perfect for it!! We were able to set up exactly how we wanted it and it was so beautiful.  The setting, the food, the staff, the service, the atmosphere, the price....everything was absolutely awesome! Ramon, the manager- He was so on top of everything! I was blown away. The food was even better than I had remembered from the first time we dined here and the price is unbeatable. While every other place we looked at for the shower had a minimum or a room fee this place like the other reviews have said, only charges you for what you consume. We were not rushed or pestered.   The cherry on the sundae was that the bride said it couldn't have been better. I will be singing this restaurant's praises forever!  Start to finish- Perfection.

nXa2KNrGsk5mxxxt3-3KzA.review_text: Go to Bocce for an extended lunch. They have a cute little patio in the back and you will completely forget your work place.  That should be the main reason to stop by actually since the food is nothing toooo special. The sausage sandwich is huge and good though. Wait staff is a bit slow for lunch.

Ixd5fdjQreCYpsIkaP_cgQ.review_text: Bocce Cafe..........(sigh)  I wanted to like you.....  Great looking restaurant, looked very promising from the moment i walked in to the door to the outdoor patio. People look like they are having a good time.   That ended after we started to get served. Im not going to be a bitch and start complaining about how inconsiderate the waiter was to tell our guest that a particular dish is no longer available after waiting for 45 mins for all of our food OR how annoying it was to only have 1 waiter to serve 2 large parties (20+ people). No wonder we didn't get all of our appetizer.   When the food came, I thought it was appropriately priced for the most part. I had the pasta alla vodka with salmon. The salmon was a little over powering and i could not really taste the the vodka sauce. Portion sizes are good.    After all that this yelper was gonna give this place a straight 1 star, but after requesting to see the manager this place is gonna have to throw their Hail Mary!   The manger empathized with us and volunteered to take care of everything himself. He personally cooked our guest a free meal. gave everyone free dessert (tiramisu) which was probably the best tasting dish and also removed the automatic gratuity tip leaving us the flexibility of giving them whatever we think they deserved.  its hard to recommend a place if you didn't really have a good experience from it. I give my hats off to the manager for trying his best to make the best of a bad situation. If you do come here come when it is not so crowded, so you can have a better dining experience.

RmxvvwZpjTwO0fvDj9ak3Q.review_text: This is a gem tucked away on Green Street. The pathway to the restaurant is tree lined.  You really wouldn't think you are walking up to a restaurant.    I have been here twice and realize I should be going more often.  I love the atmosphere in this place.  The decor is fabulous (large mirrors, high ceilings)!  I love sitting at the tables with the couches.  It provides for a comfortable dinner! It has an outdoor patio too, live music on the weekends and full bar (YAY!)  The food is reasonably priced compared to other places in North Beach.  Love the fact they bring you fresh bread with Balsamic Vinegar, olive oil  and garlic.  My favorite and not to mention delicious along with my dinner selection (I had the Penne alla Vodka).  The service was great as I never had an empty glass!  Only disappointment was the dessert I wanted wasn't ready. So no dessert for me!  :(    It was a great start to a fabulous night and I will definitely go back!

p2HFXBUsNOgDn0W0HDSOQw.review_text: Everytime I come here I fall in love with this place all over again. I love good Italian food and this place has it at a price is way reasonable for the city! The decor and the patio dining is like a quiet oasis in this crazy city. If you are in Little Italy and want a restaurant to talk about definitely stop by and grab a bite here, you won't be disappointed.

dpdSX2b1Dztt_Un1GM0UKA.review_text: Just visited this place last night for the first time. We had a group of 17 and they had ample space to take all of us (and not only because we were one of two parties in the restaurant). The service was great and very quick and gracious.   The first thing that struck me was definitely the price. VERY reasonable for a restaurant in North Beach. And the food was as good as any other N.B. attempt at Italian. The little "enchanted forest" entryway is pretty charming, and the decor is very warm. I had the bruschetta and shared the tri-color pasta for two (marinara gnocchi, pesto ravioli, and fettucini alfredo a la the italian flag) with a friend. Yum on the bruschetta, pretty yum on the pasta (a little blandish but definitely comfort food). Great bread, as well.   Parking = a bitch. Other than that, its a fun place.

WJDPbSUSiSohQ6R6Ku4wFA.review_text: This is my favorite North Beach Italian resty. Great variety of pasta dishes all very cheap. Nice atmosphere with an outside patio and great homey vibe to the place. Save a little room for the Gelato place down the street.

bd-gMXOsqj_3B-T138C_YQ.review_text: I hadn't been to Bocce Cafe in years so I went for lunch with some friends this past Saturday.   I remember it being a good place for big groups, birthdays,office partys etc. The food is decent  to good  but not great. The pizza is one of the best things to order huge and only $8.95 to $9.95. The bread is warm and fresh and the service is pretty good but it wasn't busy when we were there. The place is cosy and has a Olive Gardenish feel to it. The best thing Bocce Cafe has going for it are the low to very reasonable prices. It has to be the best value restaurant in North Beach. The ( pick a pasta and any sauce deal for $9.95 ) and that's lunch or dinner is packing them in.  Even the Rib eye Steak dinner with pasta is only $18.95. Try and get a plate of pasta for under $10.00 anywhere in North Beach . Most restaurants charge $18.00 to 28.00 for a plate of pasta (Mama Mia.) There are tons of better restaurants in North Beach but Bocce Cafe is worth a try.

USUwr9Q-8HQhcRTr-UJqCA.review_text: This place is really neat, not at all what I would expect from a North Beach restaurant. Cute entrance on the side, you walk down a little path that's covered in plants. I was totally surprised by how big this place is.  The food was what I expected, your typical hearty Italian food. I think I ordered the alfredo, yumm. Boyfriend ordered the clams, also yum. Everyone else was really happy with their food. Oh, and the garlic bread was delish.  I wasn't totally blown away but I think I'll be back.

EsGeKkjMmVNU0vJLFu4Zdw.review_text: I was at Bocce last weekend for a birthday dinner. The service was a bit slow and the food was just OK. They have reasonable bottles of wine so if you are a big group looking to drink multiple bottles at dinner - don't worry about breaking the bank.   Important Parking Tip: This may not be the best place to eat in NB, but it is the most convenient place to park your car! Public valet parking is $15 and closes at 10:30pm. Pay the guys an extra $5 and they will re-park your car on the street after they close.

YEKy3CEFI23R49tpqlMvbg.review_text: Great little find in the North Beach area. The entrance has a cool feel to it as you walk down a little alley and enter through the side. The bruschetta was very good as was the pasta that I ordered. One thing that shocked me was that the it was around $7 for a dish, and it still tasted great!  I'm taking off one star because the parmesan fairy never came around to our table. However, this is probably a good thing for me...

Nuk54dt8Osk8ghUhpuNxqQ.review_text: Solid 3.5 stars. Came here for dinner on a week night. The menu seemed pretty basic to me. It took me awhile to finally pick something that stood out. I ended up ordering fettucini pesto pasta with smoked salmon, mushrooms, and capers. It was actually quite good. The pasta was piping hot and extremely flavorful, although a tad salty.   One of my friends ordered the gnocchi, which I highly recommend. Fluffy pillows of deliciousness bathing in a creamy pesto sauce. The meal came with some soft fresh bread that I couldn't help but dunk into her sauce a few times.  Our table was right next to the door leading to the patio in the back. We received a lovely cold draft every 5 minutes or so, since it was about 45 degrees outside, but it wasn't too annoying. Our server seemed kind of rushed at the beginning of our meal. He actually turned around to leave before we were completely finished ordering and later we had to ask for our drinks to be refilled. He was still very friendly though.   Food came out fast. Reasonable prices. Cozy spot good for groups and families. I left full and happy. I'm a bit iffy about coming back since the majority of the menu didn't entice me, but from what I did end up eating, everything was delicious.

1nZNB49u4Y43w00LvxaAAA.review_text: Last night my buddy Adam came up from Stanford to hang out with me in my new hood: Chinatown/North Beach/Nob Hill. I hadn't explored much around the area since: I was wrongly introduced to North Beach as the city's answer to night life when I was a freshman at Cal, it becomes clogged with frat and post-frat/Marina boys on the weekends, and my partner in crime/love isn't usually down to go out during the week.   I asked Adam where he wanted to go and he suggested Bocce as "not too expensive and pretty good Italian food". When he described the leafy alley that you walk through from the street to the restaurant, I thought I had been there years ago -- confirmed when I saw said alley again -- and I remembered it as good with a nice patio...but was also taking into account my having been 17 at the time and remained yelp-worthily skeptical. Bocce was alarmingly empty but we chalked that up to our early dinner hour: 6.30. The interior is painfully decorated, with painted ceramic foliage all over the walls, silk flower arrangements, and smashed couches lining the place. We sat at a couch, despite the ugliness factor.  The menu was pretty thorough, offering lots of seafood pastas, some expected oven dishes, and a few meat and poultry items. I try not to order meat in places where I think it will disappoint me, and Bocce was sized up as such a place. I ordered fettuccini with calamari and marinara sauce and a glass of medium-priced chianti. Well, it really was cheap chianti, but all the wine was cheap, so I aimed for the middle. Adam got the salmon fettuccini with cream sauce. The wine came a few minutes before our dinners did, and mine was pretty grape juicey and bad. You are probably beginning to wonder what justified even a three star rating, eh? Ahem. Our meals came in gigantic pasta bowls about ten minutes after we'd ordered. Mine looked exciting, with calamari and marinara piled on top of a good amount of fettuccini. I was afraid that the calamari would be tough when I ordered it, but when I tasted my first noodle-squid-and-sauce bite, I was very pleasantly surprised. The calamari rings were tender and piping hot; the noodles were al dente and just the right thickness; and the marinara was garlicky, fresh, and not oily. I ate about half of the huge portion and asked for the rest to go. The waitress, who'd been diminutive but very nice throughout our meal wasn't pushy about dessert or appetizers, which is something I rather expect when I am in a mid-range and pretty empty place.  As we were finishing our meal, more people had started to show up, and I felt somehow triumphant on Bocce's behalf. Overall, the atmosphere is what almost kills Bocce for me, but I would definitely come back for the food and for a spaciousness that seems like it would preclude a long wait. And, while I didn't take advantage of it, a full bar also warrants a  "Bocce" note in my feeble, sodden brain.

1f1vVEMIW-xtZttOsBfLWw.review_text: OMG this place was totes AVERAGE to the max!  It was sooo rustic, and the rusticity REALLY made it kinda awesome, but kinda LAME too.  I was with some of my bff's and we wanted an upbeat place with HOT waitresses.  BTW, there's NO hotties here.  It's an older family crowd, as can be seen by the billie holliday wannabe on the mic, accompanied by john tesh in the corner on the keyboard.  I got the veal peccata, which was TENDER just how I like it!  but the pasta it came with was BLAAAAND and DRYYYYY!!  This joint is good if you have to haul around a bunch of kiddies or if you like 3 star out of 5 star food, but then again you could just go to olive garden and get BOTTOMLESS SALAD AND BREADSTICKS YEAH!!!

8qkccfGgrhV_PL3WT853Tw.review_text: From the minute you walk through the ivy covered walkway, you get the feeling this is going to be a different kind of restaurant experience.  It definitely was different but not what I had expected.  I went there for lunch around 1:20pm and expected it to be packed because of all the great reviews I had seen on Yelp and from co-workers.  The walkway instead led to an huge empty dining room and empty patio.  I was so shocked to see that there was only one person sitting at a table and he was the server eating his own meal.  No customers anywhere to be found (and this was the case during the meal).  I had to check my watch to make sure it wasn't 4pm but sadly for the restaurant it read 1:20pm.  How could a restaurant with such a great reputation on yelp have not one customer in there at 1:20 in the afternoon for food! I had to ask and he said this is more of a dinner establishment so we decided to give them the benefit of the doubt and asked to be seated in the patio.  The waiter was very friendly and gave us superior attention (however, it is hard to gauge their typical service because we were the only ones for him to attend to).  He recommended the Lasagna which we decided to each get a plate of.  He said basically all the "from the oven" recommendations on the menu were good..he had that strong Italian accent to make himself and the food sound and seem authentic.  You have to watch out if you sit in the patio...figs from the overhead fig trees fell onto my co-workers head and sap from the tree fell into his drink as it was being served.  Not impressed but not the fault of the waiter, just watch out if you are eating outside.    The Lasagna was pretty decent..a little too much sauce for my liking and not enough Lasagna...not sure what the big rave about this place was all about...but it is well priced for North Beach.  Not impressive and a little disappointed with the high expectations coming from yelpers.  I give it 2 stars because my experience was not great but I would give this place another chance, perhaps at night...hopefully I will have a better experience to follow-up review with.

2U4Y0Hz6tRD1JjKUJF_Z3w.review_text: I went here with my friend when we were wandering around the neighborhood. Judging by the looks we got from other customers, it ended up looking like we were on a date...which was slightly awkward.  Anyway. If you were to go on a date, go here. It's a very date-appropriate location, with ambient lighting, nice staff who wear uniforms, occasional band music, and fancy tablecloths (or tablecloths at all, really).I guess we should have long known by the romantic shaded walkway in--which is surrounded by plants, and kind of reminds me of the Indiana Jones ride line at Disney Land-- that it was a restaurant of the fancy, date, non-casual outing sort. But the prices lured us in. Oh the prices (considering that it's North Beach). It's an extremely reasonable restaurant, especially when you look at its fancy setting and nice location (if you want to walk up a bit, you can see the city from the top of the hill. It's lovely.). If I remember correctly, some entrees went as low as 7-9 dollars. And I like eating pasta almost as much as I like being a cheapo. And good size portions.

mBoHJmzVWvvV5EIBhkj0yg.review_text: Amazing customer service, delicious food, and beautiful ambiance!  I booked a large party from out of town here at Bocce Cafe, and was in contact with the manager over the phone and via email. Karwan was very helpful and understanding, and together we created a set menu with delicious options for my guests.   The outside patio is beautiful, just breathtaking. I decorated it even more for the surprise engagement party and Bocce's looked like a movie set. The night went as planned, and my guests LOVED the food. We had family style appetizers and the servers just brought out mouth-watering bruschetta, prosciutto melone and insalata balsamico unlimited. We had entrees to choose from such as the tortellini, eggplant parmesan, fettuccini alfredo, and linguini with fresh mussles. For dessert, Karwan went out of his way to accomodate our taste for tira misu.  This place gets 10 stars out of 5!!!! I am SO IMPRESSED with their customer service and quality of food. Thank you so much Karwan, and to all the staff that waited our large party. The evening was a night to remember and I am so grateful to you for helping me plan this long-distance event.  Grazi.

j0j-lXpl3F3lMK8T1Ke0KQ.review_text: I love the chicken sandwich!  It is amazing!  Please note that the chicken sandwich is serve during lunch only.  They serve the sandwich warm with a decent size grill chicken breast along with grill zucchini, eggplant and tomatoes.  The bread is toasty on the outside, and chewy on the inside just the way I like it.  Watch out for the pesto sauce that oozes out of the sandwich when you bite into it.   It can get messy but it's fantastic.  In addition to the sandwich, I very much enjoyed the tacky pop tunes of Italian superstar, Tiziano Ferro!  Oh Tiziano, you help me bring back good memories of Italy.

ks6ocHkiUmwTHY6hzjhVdw.review_text: The mornings and afternoons are usually very quiet here. No reservations are usually needed at the time. The servers there seat you immediately. The restaurant is beautifully adorned with a rustic feel.   The food there is classic Italian. The ingredients are fresh and made to order. They give you homemade french bread and brioche with a side of olive oil, red wine vinegar, and garlic to dip it with. I have had the spinach ravioli, calamari pallermo, and the vegetarian and meat lasagnas, all of which are exceptionally deliciously.   On Friday nights they have live music. A good place to go on a date or eat with a group.

oJ6bb4wnKCNT8v4U53FzFA.review_text: Have you royally eff-ed up? Are you in the dog house and don't know how to redeem yourself?  Listen up men (and that 1% of women that aren't always right): Bocce Cafe will win you back your side of the bed. I promise.  It's intimate. It's cozy. It's romantic. It's cheesy. It's waiters with Italian accents. It's giant plates of "Lady and the Tramp" (yes, you, Tramp) noodles. It's vino and it's love.   The off-street, tree lined entrance opens this enchanted world of old school charm. The garden patio is the perfect place to woo your lady friend on a warm summer night. Cheap valet parking helps with the North Beach location and makes her feel like you really "thought about her and her shoes" (without breaking your thin wallet). Make a reservation, try the chicken piccata and don't forget dessert. You're good to go, champ.  Bocce Cafe is the closest I've ever been to having the moon hit me in my eye like a pizza pie. Do it.

955WzLMXbsqj98G0nZLClQ.review_text: The food was really good. The ambience was very chill. The service was HORRIBLE. I arrived on time for 8pm reservations, I was not seated until 8:30. I specifically requested an indoor table, I was seated at an outdoor table. I complained and was moved. Our orders were not taken until 10pm. The place closes at 11:30, so we were rushed out! I liked the food and the music but i'm not sure if I'll eat here again.

TMWgq3KNRDaESXs8ZCrRtA.review_text: I actually came here with a gaggle of girls for my friends birthday!  We didn't play bocce just ate a lot and drank even more.  They were totally accomodating to our HUGE group.  The food was fantastic.  And they split the bill between like 20 + credit cards.  I will definitely come here again for my next big occasion...and maybe to even play bocce next time!  ADDITION:  No change in score but I just want to re-emphasize my previous review.  I came here again for a birthday only this time it was a surprise.  The staff was super accomodating.  They let us sit outside (more private), put up decorations, hold on to the homemade dessert, and they changed the reservation name so that the birthday girl (when she came in with her boyfriend) wouldn't suspect anything.  They were so friendly and kept the wine coming and continually checked in on us without interrupting the party.

FrXKXsngXOi4DgaKAMva7w.review_text: I love Bocce, I love it! The atmosphere is so cool. The decor and jazz band really lend to the experience.  My favorite dish is the Gnocchi! I've never ordered anything else since the first time I ate it. They do, however have a nice Caprese salad.  The service is always great.  There is a bar, as well as indoor and outdoor seating. The service is family friendly.

BfPrx-qMPgbbhTPox6kMkg.review_text: I came here for the first time with my co-workers earlier this month for our usual monthly dinner outing.  I was impressed that people were able to find their way into the restaurant, as it is tucked away in a random alleyway in North Beach.  It literally felt like you had to meander through a forest to get to your destination, with all the plants and trees.   The buzz about Bocce, that I've heard, was the setting that they present their diners with.  You wouldn't expect your typical Italian restaurant to be adorned with 70s-looking wall flowers, wood hangings, stones, miscellaneous vases, and accompanied by retro couches.  Strange but unique, indeed.   However, as much as I wanted to fall in love with their food, I couldn't force my feelings to sway that way.  Their pizza and pasta portions were huge compared to their costs, but in terms of taste - it was good but nothing too beyond that.  The biggest disappointment, for me, stemmed from the easiest item they could make -- Italian soda.  How hard is it to get an Italian soda right at an Italian restaurant?  It tasted like carbonated melted lipstick drowned in syrup.  Another major letdown was their service.  When we asked the waiter what Italian soda flavors they had, he simply said "Strawberry?  I don't know" instead of checking.  When we requested to move to their outdoor patio, the waiter insisted that we didn't because it would be too cold (even though it was incredibly warm outside).  As homely as the restaurant was, the service ironically made us all feel very unwelcomed.  The only thing that helped me make it through the night was the great company I had with me.

ZRJFcLLnMiht0uSRowyt8A.review_text: I booked a week in advance for mine and the missus' birthday dinner with friends for 9 on a Friday.  They accommodated about 25 people with fast friendly service.  The prices were good, my spaghetti and meatballs were pretty bland though.  Got a slice tiramisu from them for my birthday and then went out to the horror that is north beach on a Friday night.  Good times!

Z0HVR9N-luipZZurPdli1w.review_text: I'd like to like this place. It is charming, especially the backyard dining area under the trees. The valet parking for ten bucks is not a bad deal for North Beach and the prices are reasonable. And it accommodates large parties, like ours, at long tables with plenty of space. But my veal marsala was covered with a sweet sticky gunk, minestrone was tasteless, fried calimari limp, chilly Caesar tasted of bottled dressing. The food arrived suspiciously quickly, as if it had all been sitting in the kitchen, waiting to be ordered.

NXl6XnHM4UZCAhKt-kOjeA.review_text: I have been to Bocce cafe 3 times now, and I really like this place. They have a great patio area, and the food is really good. The only thing i think is average is their bread. But today I had the Linguine and steamed Clams in a white wine sauce and it was delicious. The clams tasted fresh and sauce was awesome! I've had their Eggplant Parmigiana and it was very tasty and the first time I had the Capellini  Pomodoro and the tomatoes were fresh and tasty.  They can handle large groups and couple with ease. check it out... it's very cool...

rFKSPp7Bhd6Sa_69SoWf8A.review_text: Where to go when you can't find a hotel than rents by the hour.  This place is fun for groups and casual Italian dining.  The food is good and the wine list decent.  The veal parmigiana is covered in cheese.  Tasty!  Try the antipasto platter and linguini with fresh mussels.  The atmosphere is a bit dated but still cozy.  The staff was friendly and attentive the night we went.  The only down side was that our server didn't know how to pour wine for a large group.  A second bottle and second attempt didn't improve matters.  Last note.  If you decide to get busy in the men's restroom, don't worry.  The staff will let you finish your business without interruption.

_DmZf8CUPgsuPdSnQcP4Ug.review_text: I've been here before and always liked it until my last visit. I made reservations for 20 people and only 15 people showed up. There were small children in our party and so i made the reservations early (7pm) to make sure to be heading out by 10. We didn't get our food until AFTER 10. Our waiter purposely ignored me and our food was cold when brought to us. It's a shame, the ambience is nice and the band is entertaining, though it is a little loud (like a cafeteria).

_Idlsaw2hXJN8NtNWamt2Q.review_text: Well, then. Business Meet/Greet lunch with my new Practice Group. Our table was like 30 feet long.  Decor: rustic.  What killed me was what looked like the Sauder Screw-it-together-Yourself desk-thingy smack in the middle of the dining area, holding napkins, etc., this eyesore completely distracted from the rest of the place. And there's these huge *things* poking out from the walls or ceiling or something that more than one of our party knocked their head on. The guy next to me said they were painted concrete. I have no idea. My head was spared.   Waitstaff: Looked extremely bored to annoyed.   Service: Three-quarters of our table got wine. I was on the unfortunate end of that slice, but that's probably for the best since my boss was there. My water was never re-filled, and neither was the iced tea of the other Unfortunate Non-Wine Recipients next to me. The poor guy smack dab next to me ended up prit' near sucking on ice cubes by the end of our meal.   Food: Meh. I don't eat a ton of pasta and on this day, was not in The Mood. I had the marinated grilled shrimp salad, which was ok. The shrimp was good, but the dressing seemed a bit umm, sour.  The bread was good.  Everyone ate all their pasta.  There was only one other small table of patrons there while we were there. Spot on Noon. That's kind of weird.

yh0WyD5blQl5EkVO5YOjaQ.review_text: This place has a LOT of potential but someone needs to put some love into it. And get a Chef that cares about their food. My family and I had 5 appetizers to share, grilled portobello salad, bruschetta, steamed clams & mussels, & calamari. Nothing was seasoned, so it was just generic and bland.   Service was not exceptional, as if the guy serving our table was miserable to be there.  The ladies room was worse. One of 2 working toilets and 1 of 2 working sinks.  Would love to see this cool spot get the love it deserves and give it another chance.

ZtmeHAQyNFku338dJMIfTg.review_text: The best reason to go to Bocce is for the comfy couches.  The food is very basic but usually pretty good.  Some nights they have mozzarella sticks which you can never go wrong with.  I took my sister here once and her lasagna was still frozen in the middle so that sorta makes you wonder about how their food is prepared but I just say skip the lasagna and avoid that.    There aren't a ton of places I would recommend in North Beach but this is one I don't think you can go wrong with.

2P9dFRWtA0J1xgZI3PvfoQ.review_text: I celebrated my birthday here a couple of weeks ago!  I LOVE-LOVE-LOVED IT!  It was a perfect experience from the beginning (calling for reservations) till the end (complimentary tiramisu and birthday song for me!).    I made reservations here for 40-45 people and ended up with about 30-35, but there was no problem at all.  The owner/manager was always very professional, patient, and accommodating.    This place is great for large groups, but is also charming enough for a romantic date.  The whole inside portion of the restaurant is kind of in one big room, but it works.  Very happy and positive vibe (could be the alcohol, but whatever).    As for the food--I was an easily distracted host, so I took FOREVER to order, but wasn't rushed at all.  I ordered one of the specials that included chicken, steak, pork..potatoes..all the good stuff on one plate.  I sampled the beef carpaccio, lasagna, and gnocchi off other people.  I overdid it with the bread basket and oil+vinegar.  Devoured the complimentary tiramisu.  Dontjudgeme, itwasmybirthday.    ALL YUM.  Oh.  And the bar.  They actually had a REAL full bar here, with good liquor.  THE SHOTS ARE MONSTEROUS.  Be warned.    I think my favorite part of the restaurant was the live band.  They take requests!

4anfrxnJNGBiMYeJ0k9tTg.review_text: I've been to Bocce six or seven times over the past nineteen years. It's very reasonably priced with a casual yet lively atmosphere. You can go here dressed for the opera or for the beach. The food is consistent and the prices have barely risen in all these years. Sit on the couches if you can... or eat at the bar. You will get great (attentive) service there. It's noisy. It's crowded. It's a fun place to take visitors if you don't want to spend hundreds of dollars.   Tip... order the beef carpaccio. It's not the prettiest plate you've ever seen but it's SUPER fresh, perfectly seasoned, YUMMY and $7.95  *gasp*

mQBtWghC5pE8v98dy-xGUA.review_text: What the hell was I doing in this place!?! I know that i didn't choose it! Passable service by an aloof waiter, mediocre food... two stars for the atmosphere alone.

1ljC2JgUafYC9wtEUXJ3bQ.review_text: I should have reviewed this months ago!  It's a hidden gem and so so easy to miss if you're not paying attention... which is kind of weird considering how big this place is.  This is the kind of restaurant where you could take someone out on a date, simply because it's so beautiful and cottage-y inside.  It has lots and lots of couches, pillows, dim lighting, and it has a woodsy feel.  It's a place where you can actually hold a conversation with someone without shouting over "DJ stuff and stupid shit" and without worrying about the table next to you eavesdropping... because unlike many fine SF establishments, you'll have plenty of space!  The food tasted exactly what you'd think it'd taste like for the price.  Maybe a little better.  It won't blow your mind away, but nothing will be awful.  The menu is large enough that you'll probably find something that you'll be satisfied with.  THERE'S ALSO A BAR.  This would be perfect for a reception.  Or a party.  Something.  Or maybe just casual wine only day drinking on a Sunday when the weather is nice and the patio's open.

Ftx7t5FJ3vvCj0GLSs5fCQ.review_text: Gosh - You know it's not an authentic Italian Ristorante when there are a lot of misspelled words and incorrect Italian grammar on the Menu.   Anyway came to Bocce with a friend for dinner (her decision to come to Bocce). She loved everything about it while I hated everything. Being that I lived in Italy for almost 4 years and experienced simple but delicious Italian cuisine, I just can't muster the energy to consume such horrific cheese and sauce laden "Italian" dishes. It was an insult to my senses. I don't even remember what I ordered but I recall ladling the excess sauce to another plate.   Come for (pre-dinner) drinks or as part of a large group - it's more like Buca di Beppo family-style kind of a restaurant.   I do like the outdoor "oasis" seating.  The highlight of the evening was the cat.

PUId9kLd6IRFAczfgiUqqg.review_text: Great location, yummy food, great for groups!  It was Thursday night but the place was virtually dead.  We were the first group there at 7pm but it slowly got busier.  The place is huge so it just felt so empty.  The service is great!  The penne alla salmone and meat lasagne were really good.  The pizzas were pretty basic but overall, a solid restaurant.  I'd say best for a group or big party.  Pretty inexpensive.

sZapGYtCKcomo3oYc8ychg.review_text: Crummy food that is too heavy, overcooked, and mainly flavorless.  I don't understand how they stay open except they have some unusual Alps feel decor.  With so much to choose from in North Beach, I have no idea why anyone would dine here.

lJiSvYaJlb3QYGdJWntO_g.review_text: I was in SFO visiting the city for the first time.  We wanted to venture out into not-so-touristy place to get some real SFO flavor.  Ironically, a few nights before we visited this restaurant, a server at another restaurant recommended this place to us.  When we arrived at the restaurant, I knew that we were in for an authentic dining experience because of the worn decor, the obligatory old school pictures on the walls and the white table cloths.  Our server took a little more time than I would expect to arrive at the table but, she was perfectly nice nonetheless.  The busboy came along with fresh bread and an olive oil/balsamic vinegar dipping sauce shortly thereafter which was very tasty.  We arrived just in time for 50% off appetizers so we ended up ordering a calamari appetizer and two entrees: lasagna and cheese ravioli.  We were also surprised by how long it took for the food to come out but, we just attributed it to them cooking the food to order.  Unfortunately, the food was not really worth waiting for.  The sauce on the lasagna was a bit watery and my ravioli really tasted like Chef Boyardee.  The price of the food seemed fair but, for the price I would've liked a little bit more salt/garlic/herb flavor.  I feel like I could've gotten better tasting food at Olive Garden or Macaroni Grill.

t4pkt6sPeRyj-QhZGSPQYw.review_text: I don't know what I was smoking when I wrote my first review. I went there for lunch the other day. I do love the outdoor patio and the whole set-up is pretty cool. It's a unique space, that's for sure. But the food just didn't cut it. My pasta was more like soup because of the ridiculous amount of sauce they put on it, which unfortunately is something very common at Italian restaurants in the U.S.  I'm not sure what caused me to call this place 'authentic' the last time I reviewed it, but I take that back ten-fold. Sorry Bocce =(

u2nRZlLez2zz4vmk4hkNwQ.review_text: Great spot for a large group. Sent my daughters and their 14 friends there for their 18th birthday party. Staff was awesome, location is perfect (heart of North Beach), great prices and food. Best place for a large group in NB.

qthtyjV-1dHIApNHtWB40A.review_text: Came with a group of 15 for lunch and were seated on the outdoor patio, which was awesome with the nice weather.  The bread was amazing (steaming hot), although I think I was just starving and would have probably enjoyed eating cardboard!  The service was very friendly. The food was in HUGE portions although I stick with the motto, "it's about quality not quantity."  Good lunch place for a group, but not good enough to go for dinner (in my opinion).

3RYGGAcEzVLGf9YjLq0Y7A.review_text: This was exactly what wanted. Hidden in a garden, this is worth the search. Service and food were great for their price.  :) So good! Check it out for lunch too if you want some privacy ;)

bp96aZmoQxJM-hKx2AP15A.review_text: For the atmosphere, food, wine and price, I don't know of anywhere that's more perfect for people on a budget but who want to eat classy, great Italian food. The inside of this place is a charming brick-and-stucco classic San Francisco design that's filled to the brim with glowing candles, moody lighting and effervescent jazz music coming from the live bands that frequent this place. The people are helpful, though clearly would like richer, better-tipping folk instead of the youthful riffraff like me, but oh well, I'm not complaining. If you've got a date, the patio outside pretty much guarantees that you are going to get some that night/day/whenever. Beautiful vinery, latticed fences and romantic christmas lights all-year-round. How could you go wrong? The gnocchi is a must.

3WqDui5T5ehPDoRlVcEggQ.review_text: 3 trips to the Bocce Cafe and each a different and interesting experience, each time not because of the food.  Haha.  As for the food, it's pretty nice but not anything special.  I feel like the first time I went the food was really good and each trip since it has been less good.  hmmm...  Either way, it's a nice place to eat with a neat interior and live jazz, always nice.  And no, I do not like doing laundry.

_laOfCHYOXa9CuUJRabhFg.review_text: We stumbled upon this place with our Bay Area friends, who we were visiting. They're newer to the area and live about an hour outside of San Francisco, so we were sort of blindly trying to find somewhere to eat in the city. We actually had our sights set on another place, but it ended up being closed. We stumbled upon Bocce Cafe and decided to give it a shot.   We walked through a cute patio area to get in, and because it was fairly warm out, we actually sat on the outside patio. The inside was cute but we didn't spend much time in there. Our server was fine, but nothing really stood out and service was a bit slow for how few people were in the restaurant (we ate at a weird time, probably about 4 or 4:30pm).    Before our entrees, we decided to get a few appetizers. I don't eat fish but my three dining companions had calamari, and we also split some fried mozzarella sticks. For some reason, they came with onion rings, which was odd but I'm also not into onion rings, so maybe that isn't weird to everyone? The mozzarella sticks were good, as was the bread and olive oil dipping sauce.   We all ordered something different. My friend's husband ordered the Cappellini Pomodoro, which he enjoyed quite a bit. It was more of a marinara-type sauce than he was expecting, but he liked it all the same. My fiance tried the pepperoni pizza, of which I had a slice. It was just okay - I am really not picky about my pizza so I certainly would've eaten it, but I expected something a little better from an Italian place. My friend originally ordered the Penne Portobello but when it came out, she was disappointed. It was much more of a stroganoff-type sauce than she was expecting, and she said it was somewhat oddly sweet, so she ended up ordering something else (the Ravioli alia Spinaci). She wasn't stoked with that, either, but took home what she didn't eat and finished it the next day, so I think it was decent.  I had the Linguini al Pesto. It was pretty good; it was a little less al dente than I prefer but I enjoyed it enough.  Although they didn't necessarily have a kids' menu, they were kind enough to make a small dish of penne with marinara sauce for my friends' daughter (who then refused to eat it - silly toddlers).   Overall it probably wasn't the absolute BEST place we could've gone, but I think most of us enjoyed our meal well enough, and the place was pretty cute.

IB341VwGmVkR8DabjP-EYQ.review_text: Maybe 3 1/2 stars.  I went here on a Sunday afternoon with my husband and we were the only ones in the restaurant.  It's got a little hidden entrance and we got to sit on the patio outside.  I ate the ciopino which was very tasty.  We also had calamari and you can't really go wrong with that.  For being the only people in the restaurant, the service was slow.  I waited and waited and I was so hungry by the time the food came.  I would say it was worth the wait.  It would be a nice place to have a group dinner on a warm San Francisco night.  Yeah when do we really get those.   I would probably go back there because I really liked the food.  But if you're really hungry, just keep eating the bread.  It'll take awhile for the main course.

ZKhNODNqHVJYg2tZHwK3sA.review_text: This place has now become a tradition of mine. Every visit to San Fran must be accompanied by this lovely place.  FYI: if you're planning any thing after this, like speaking or making out, don't do it. The garlic that permeates from your body after a meal here is enough to be smelled from miles away. Mind you, I'm not complaining. I love garlic. It's just a "WHOA you smell like garlic" heads up.  I can't place my finger on it, but their Caesar salad is the best I've had. I don't know if it's the vibrant hint of lemon and the lack of sardine taste, but the dressing they use is perfect. It starts my night off on the right foot.  Each time I've come here I ordered the Fettuccine Smoked Salmon, and each time I've left wanting more. Who cares that the portions are big and I end up taking it home? I don't want to stop eating it! The salmon is perfectly blended with pesto, kamata olives, mushrooms, and big slices of tomatoes. It's a heavier dish, but not overwhelming in taste. With each bite, I find myself savoring its food beauty. If you can't tell, I love this dish.  The service here is polite and kind, with my first visit on the slower side. However, our last visit and server was quick on her toes and provided efficient service without being the least bit pushy. They give you time to enjoy your meal and company here.  The parking in this area is kind of a nightmare, so be prepared to do some searching.  However, that won't keep my friend and I from returning once again!

snNaxheDmEtF4Q4DnKGenA.review_text: I had never pictured how I wanted my wedding to be but if anyone could imagine a dream wedding, this was pretty much it. My day was perfect from start to finish. I just got married this past Sunday and it was beautiful.   We went to Bocce Cafe for the evening festivities. I originally searched vineyards in the south bay and considered Napa but we wanted something accessible for families with small children and older people. I was searching on Yelp and came across Bocce Cafe located in the heart of SF. They had a lot of positive reviews from other wedding couples which turned out to be 100% accurate.   Ramon, the manager of the restaurant was so organized and helpful! He was excellent to work with taking care of all the small details so we didn't even have to think about a thing.   There was NO CHARGE for the venue, only the cost of beverages and the food we chose by making a customized dinner menu. It was such a sweet deal compared to the vineyards we visited down in the so.bay!   The restaurant setting was warm with great ambiance adding to our whole Tuscan themed wedding. The Bocce Cafe crew went above and beyond what we had expected of a venue. They also set up all the tables in formation to accommodate the number of attending guests, they rented our table cloths and napkins, printed our menus for us, accommodated all our vendors by closing the restaurant early to allow them to set-up in the afternoon and after the reception, tons of guests told me the food was delicious and the service was excellent with a very attentive staff.   Nothing better than hearing that wedding guests had a great time and were happy with the party. Another bonus: The restaurant also has a small stage (for our first dance, father/daughter, etc..) and a built in speaker system (for our band and DJ). There's a room in the back for the bride to change too and they also had valet service which was more affordable (incl. the tip for the guys parking the cars) than the parking garage if your event lasts 4+ hours. It was very convenient for our wedding guests. I just couldn't ask for anything more.
