X0q4bFpolUwr_MOKEURbHg.review_text: One star for the gardeny, piazza-y atmosphere, and one star for the $7 pick your pasta pick your sauce special.  The food here is OK:  it's not offensively bad, but it's not fan-fuckin-tastic.  Their wine list kinda blows.  Basically, Bocce is a glorified Pasta Pomodoro for people who don't want to go to Pasta Pomodoro.  The service here, though, is sumthin' else.    The last time I went to Bocce, we were seated right next to the stage, perhaps to keep the band company.  They said the band won't play for another 40 minutes; of course, as soon as we sat down, they started soundchecking and rehearsing.  Not even a basket of warm, free bread can make up for the raw crackle of a snare drum being banged repeatedly, right next to my head.  Instead of fashioning earplugs out of the bread, we asked to be moved.  Even though we only had three people total, arrived early, and the restaurant was empty (cue cricket chirps), they hemmed and hawed before they sat us mere two tables away.  Um, ok.  Because the restaurant was not busy, the waitstaff congregated next to our table to gossip and gawk at the band.  I'm not against the staff kicking it during slow times, but in the dining room??  Next to customers??    When my parents finished their entrees, the staff snapped into action by clearing EVERYTHING on the table even though I was clearly only two-thirds through my entree.  We sat back wide-eyed and appalled as the quartet of waiters descended upon us, mercilessly crumplimg paper placemats and snatching away condiments.  Sigh...if only these guys could come up with an Iraq exit strategy, the world would probably be a better place.  After this grand "WE NEED TO TURN THIS TABLE OVER!!!!" gesture (in an empty restaurant, I might add), I'm surprised we were even offered a dessert menu.  Of course, at this point, it was our turn to clear the table of our presence so we could linger over our desserts elsewhere.

-DmpYICjBii640Zny46cLQ.review_text: My friend and I wanted to go around North Beach for dinner and I had a ScoutMob coupon to use.  The entrance is hidden and you have to walk through a gate and enter through the side door.  When we first entered, we were welcomed with a live band and decided that we would enjoy our stay here.  The room isn't fancy.  In all honesty, it looked like a decked out high school prom in an auditorium.  It was very cute.  BUT..the food was a disappointing.  I ordered the prosciutto with melon and the calamari salad.  I was not satisfied with either of these.  The calamari salad was bland and the melon was a little tough.  My friend ordered fettuccine tortellini.  Bland again.  We were not impressed with anything except for the wine.    Luckily I got $20 knocked off the bill with my coupon.  I wouldn't come back here again.  It's a shame though because the atmosphere was very welcoming.

m8x7M-8epOAwureLVcjPEg.review_text: I came here with my girlfriend and my mother a few weeks back and likely won't be back again.  Basically, the service was really poor and the food was mediocre at best.  We started with a beet salad and a salmon carpaccio.  Neither was particularly impressive, but not horrible.  As for the entrees, my girlfriend's penne alla vodka was decent, but incredibly salty.  I had the gnocchi alla napoletana, which was perhaps the saving grace of the entire meal.  The gnocchi were awesome and I would order them again and again, if I ever went back...which I probably won't.  For dessert, we shared a piece of carrot cake, which tasted like it was store-bought.  Various other elements of the meal had a supermarket feel to them as well.  The bread also looked and tasted as if it had come from Safeway.  When we asked for parmasean cheese, they brought a shaker like you'd expect to find at Pizza Hut, filled with some product that bore only a slight resemblance to actual parmasean.  The service was incredibly poor.  We stopped in before the dinner rush got started and still couldn't seem to get the attention of any of the wait staff.  Then the overzealous busboys would appear from out of nowhere and try to yank plates away, while we were chewing and forks still in our hands.  The only reasons that this is not a one-star review are the gnocchi and the space that the restaurant is in.  It's unfortunate that such a great, unique, romantic space is occupied by such an underwhelming restaurant.  With so many other great food options in North Beach, I can't say I'll be coming back.  But...if I do, I'll be having the gnocchi.

yLwmyT58Nrp6taFlfcs9LQ.review_text: My family and I found this place while walking around the North Beach area of the city. It was a busy Friday night so a lot of the places we tried first were too crowded to seat us, but we stumbled on this establishment and since we were crunched for time, we gave it a shot.  Our service was lackluster and inattentive. We ordered several appetizers to share as a family. Nothing stood out as above average. Bland tastes and just lacking a chef's love.  The restroom was even a disappointment. One of two stalls was completely disgusting and not usuable, and one of two sinks was broken.  This place has potential with its location and atomospheric charm, but it needs some serious love and attention.

AZnVfVv82FEvdfpr9kwffQ.review_text: I think mediocre is the best word to describe virtually everything about this place, if not downright bad. The valet parking in front is more for marketing than anything, or maybe--scratch that: obviously--the owner is completely clueless and thinks the only reason his place is virtually completely empty at 7pm is because he didn't have valet parking. Why, of course, sir. All fine restaurants have valet parking, so just add that and you're automatically fine dining!  This place painfully reminds me of why people like Gordon Ramsay exist. I can intuit that the owner is likely new, riding on the coattails of his predecessor, which includes the tiny stream of customers, many of whom likely were deceived by a relatively high Yelp rating, most of which was established years ago, presumably in the hands of an earlier owner, or perhaps the same one, but who actually cared. I wonder what the motives or palates are of those recent reviews with high ratings. I must seriously question their integrity.  Besides the unsettling experience of dining almost totally alone at 7 pm on a Wednesday, the food here is pretty mediocre. Actually, it's just on this side of edible. The chef clearly doesn't have any regard for quality of ingredients and just isn't a very good chef. The caprese as part of the appetizer.sampler was pathetic. The mozzarella may as well have been cardboard, as it tasted like nothing. The tomato was gross and underripe. The chef/owner understands nothing. Caprese is about bringing out and emphasizing the flavors of the few ingredients. Just sad.   We were there for a company outing so we all shared quite a few plates. All of them left something to be desired. The pasta was tasteless. The eggplant spinach dish was very bland. The only decent dishes were the Caesar salad, with a clearly homemade dressing, and the pizza, which was at least acceptable, although not "good." But you can't build an entire italian restaurant on a Caesar salad.  It's clear this restaurant won't be around for long if it continues doing what it's doing, which is serving very poor food in an area known for particularly good, authentic Italian food. People are speaking with their wallets in the empty dining room at prime dinnertime, and it's time this clearly clueless owner listens and gets help before it's too late. Maybe it already is, sadly.

b9cvKheDBWn-_xli6kzgdg.review_text: Ordered the veal piccata this past weekend, and was violently sick twenty minutes after I left. #epicfail

DKmUukETiMVidu548TE-zw.review_text: My sister had her wedding reception here. Not exactly the Tuscan villa where guests eat under a leafy awning, and then danced until the stars came out like my father had visioned as the ideal wedding reception(yes, a really unrealistic and uncharacteristic wish of his), but this is the next best thing if you want to host a reasonably-priced dinner at a cute venue with a lively ambiance.   The backyard is large enough to accommodate a big group. We fit 50 people perfectly under the roofed part of the yard, surrounded by little white Christmas lights that are cozy and endearing. We sat around three long tables, shared dishes my sister preselected for the evening.   Everything was delicious, from the steamed clams to the seafood linguine. When you think about all the mass-produced awful wedding food you've had in your life, this really good.   Service was prompt. No one rushed us when we were waiting for people to arrive. And when half of the guests left before desserts, they took that into account and brought just enough tiramisu for the remaining guests.   Price was really reasonable. I have had birthday party tabs bigger than this.   The only tips I'd give is keep constant communications with the restaurant. My sister's inquiries and emails were often not responded promptly and left her a bit nervous before the reception. Fortunately everything turned out perfect.

vP0WspRfraMLWaN3k3vKHA.review_text: bocce is great for groups.  bocce is not great if you are feeling like a snobbie foodie.  there are plenty of foodie places in the city - this is not one of them.    but it's fun!  decent service, decent food.  great atmosphere.   i like it as an off-columbus, un-cramped, casual north beach place that's comfortable and doesn't break the bank.

xRDJuN7qxqrPnmQi3RTCFw.review_text: The food here is great! The house made garlic bread was pretty unique..a lot like a think crispy pizza. The food did take a while to come out, but when it did, my spaghetti and meatballs were piping hot. My spaghetti was cooked perfectly to al-dente and my beef meatballs had lots of flavor. The price here is quite reasonable and the ambiance of the restaurant is very cozy. The service was good, everyone was friendly. If you're looking for italian food that tastes fresh and homemade, this is the place for you.

IDVX4Is4CanREchBmpFXoA.review_text: I gotta tell ya, had it not been late at night with most of the other North Beach restaurants already having closed for the evening, I would have been pissed off for choosing this place.  Its got a great setting as you walk down a narrow pathway to get to the front and enter into a large, lofty dining room with high-beam ceilings and lots of ecclectic decor.  However, the food left much to be desired.  We had a pizza that basically had no flavor to it; we had to dump loads of salt, pepper, parmesan and oregano on it to give it any flavor at all.  The servers were slow and apathetic.  Sorry Bocce....

PABIXXEx_6ykhF7I6_Fu-A.review_text: Its okay. Kinda reminds me of a glorified and less kitchy Bucca di Beppo. Its tasty and cheap if you are into that kind of stuff - and don't get me wrong. I like the cheap trashy Italian as much as the next gal. The mussels here are by far the best thing on the menu. Its no means at the level of Chef Boyardee, but its not your Restorante Milano or Trattoria Contadina...which reminds me....I've been meaning to write reviews on those.

Jmx01cHco0iYykvUsG8zvA.review_text: Parking is horrible in this neighborhood, but for the price of a good glass of wine ($10), a valet can take care of that hassle for you and you can just enjoy the experience at Bocce.  This place is perfectly suitable for large groups, as they offer a prix fixe menu.  We went on a Sunday evening and our friends had reserved tables for a group of 40, but as word spread that we were at the location, about 60 people arrived and the management graciously accommodated the inflated party.  The portions are generous and the food is very tasty.  Prix fixe menus come with only water as a drink; the bar area is open for you to order beer, wine, shots, and other drinks as needed.  Recommendations: the chicken piccata and the lasagna.

jkiinjUy8RUZKzW5gBpXNg.review_text: It was too late for breakfast on Sunday afternoon, and we ended up in Bocce just by chance.    I can't say that the food was incredible, but for the price I can't complain.  Chain restaurants like Pasta Pomodoro don't match the place for price to food-quality ratio, and certainly not in ambiance or service, if that comparison helps you at all.  We split the seven flavor pasta sampler for two (It's in a box by itself on the back page of the menu) and some bruschetta.  The pasta didn't seem to be fresh, not even the gnocchi, and the sauces were run of the mill.  The veggies in the veggie lasagna were fresh and crisp, but the flavors didn't meld all that well.  I guess it needed some meat.  The food was by no means bad, and I left full and content, but it was just nothing to write home about.  I'd love to see some more unique choices on the wine list too.  The service was great.  We had a dashing server with a killer Italian accent who was very accommodating with substitutions and maybe it was just because the place was dead on a sunny Sunday afternoon (my recommended time to visit), but he was fantastically attentive, as was the busser.  They didn't seem to mind at all that we were taking our time and reading stories to each other out of the New York Times, or that we lingered after the coffee was gone.    The back patio is a great place to sit when the weather is nice, as it is sheltered from the road, gets indirect sunlight, so there are no blinding rays or glare, and the music still flows outside from the restaurant.  I would definitely go back in the right situation.

VlVx6clfF7iZfO_idvuMfA.review_text: I went here on Sat. night, (had reservations, so no prob there.) But.... The food was passable, not inedible, but nothing special. The space is beautiful, it's too bad the food sucks! Went with a few friends, and it was so loud we couldn't even have a conversation! (My BF was right next to me, and we couldn't hear each other!) There was a jazz band right next to a few tables, and it was pretty ridiculous. Given the high celings, and such, it would have been somewhat loud anyway, but with the band in my ear, it really was annoying! If i want to go to a noisy place, and not be able to have any conversation at all, I'd go to a bar! If you're in North Beach, there are better, (and similar priced) places to go. The prices were very reasonable, and there is a large variety of choices. Everyone i was with ordered different dishes, and no one was impressed.

9GCCoFw_UHiAHjZ4kygHgw.review_text: Nice big space with good ambiance.Too bad it was cold and rainy last night because that back patio looked fun and I would love to sit there in the summer.  I started with a goat cheese salad, that was a miss and barely had any of the goat cheese .Instead I was forced to eat pretty unimpressive greens with a drizzle of sauce.  But all was not lost with my cioppino which was awesome.Good distribution of the sea food, and even came with a tasty and garlicy side serving of pasta with marina .Very yum yum.  Staff was attentive.I'm definitely coming back

CX71NDrxCkcuXICKMz3mww.review_text: 45 minutes after we sat down, we still had no food.  Took us 2.5 hours to finish our meal, and the total time we spent eating was probably 25 minutes.  This place was the perfect example of a place that makes me wish I had stayed home.  It's definitely Italo-Americano food.  If you like really American style Italian you'll be fine.  If it upsets you to see typos in the Italian, and similar treatment of the food, then you'd best go somewhere else.  (Like Maccaroni Sciue Sciue.)

SORmXWGbqw7NckE5X7YxPQ.review_text: I was between 3 and 4 stars for this joint and had to knock it down because we really wanted tasty, thin crust true-Italian style pizza and their pizza was very ok.   The other 2 things we ordered were great though. We had the Calamari Palermo and the Beet Salad - both very delicious. The calamari  is now one of my favorite Italian appetizers.   The ambiance was great. Very home-y in a log cabin in the mountains sort of way. It's got a lot of space, so definitely good for groups.

Pta_SKfRKng1yvonGQdN6A.review_text: I was very unimpressed with the door, but very impressed with the ambiance.

op_PKWquyGZyYQkGv9V20w.review_text: I met up with Drue for dinner my last night in town and we took the 45 (craziest bus ride I had my whole entire trip) up to North Beach to grab dinner before my first ever SF DYL.  It was early so the first two choices were closed and that's how we ended up here at Bocce Cafe.  We sat outside on their patio and decide what we want to start with.  A bottle of Coastal Ridge Pinot Noir, bruschetta and calamari Palermo.  The wine was drinkable but not good; however we did finish the bottle.  The bruschetta was good, fresh tomatoes, basil and garlic all mixing well together.  The calamari Palermo which we thought would be sauted calamari was more like a soup; actually it was a soup because we were given soup bowls to eat it with.  Even though it wasn't what I had envisioned it was still tasty, the artichokes and olives with the calamari in the white wine and basil sauce all worked well together and tasted great.    We finish our appetizers and are ready to order our main dishes and the waiter magically disappeared but during this time a tailless cat decided to join us.  We talk, we wait, we drink more bad Pinot and finally after what seemed like forever the waiter reappeared.  We decided to do some sharing so we ordered one of the specials of the day risotto Genovese and an order of the gnocchi in a Napolitana sauce.  The risotto was my favorite of the two, the pesto, grilled tuna and olives made for an exciting dish.  The gnocchi were good if you wiped the sauce off of them but the sauce left a little something to be desired, I wasn't a fan.  Over all I'd say it was a very nice leisurely Italian dining experience al fresco.  I'd order the risotto Genovese again and the gnocchi with the pesto or cream sauce instead if I ever made it back.

KyU8XSX_b3TXAtEcLkvX4Q.review_text: Bocce is a great place for a romantic date or to go for a birthday.  Bocce has 3 great things I like: 1. The outdoor patio is wonderful on a sunny day 2. The pick you pasta and sauce option for about only $7.  I always get spaghetti carbonara (not low-fat by any means).  It's great because you can get it for lunch and dinner. Can't beat that price! 3. The live music on weekend nights, it's perfect for that romantic date.  Go to Bocce and have a great time, then walk around wonderful  North Beach.

e12HULlvzduhe5q0CSohDQ.review_text: Food was mediocre but service was extremely slowwwwww. Orders came out 1 hour after ordering and one person in our group did not get their pizza until 20 minutes after everyone else.

HjFejwki0-Clyp3VVdIOQQ.review_text: Found this place from Scoutmob, and I'm gonna give it 3 stars, but it's a very generous 3 stars.  I would say that the service was worthy of 5 stars, but the entrees were terrible.  You enter through an alley and it looks sorta like a ski lodge.  They provided us with some complimentary bread with a olive oil ,balsamic vinegar, and garlic mix.  The bread was soft and warm and very good, as was the garlicky olive oil mix.  And when we finished the last piece, they brought us a second basket right away without us having to ask.  Throughout the meal, our water glasses were never empty either.  The service was excellent. The sweet potato fries appetizer was also very good.    After that, it all went downhill from there once we got our entrees.  The veal parmigiana tasted like chicken fried steak with salty tomato sauce on it.  It was super thin, yet more than half of it was breading and cheese.  The pasta and sauce that came with it was super salty.  The best part of the dish was the vegetables that came with it.  We also got a pesto chicken pizza and that  was also disappointing.  The dough was thick and dry and the pizza was just not very tasty.  We had one slice each and decided to box the rest of the pizza.    I'm gonna give this place the benefit of the doubt because it's possible that we just picked the wrong dishes.  I would have given this place 2 stars, but because of their great service, they get a 3.

kiT7A29JZj2awLwrLj19qg.review_text: There are some definite positives and negatives about my trek to Bocce Cafe last night.  We only went there because the best place in north beach (Cinque Terre -swoon- ) was mysteriously closed. We wandered around, looking for another spot that I could recognize from Yelp and my best friend's car decided to OVERHEAT and pour LIQUID from the bottom...not good. So, we waited for a tow, fed ourselves with skittles from my purse and lamented about the lack of Cinque Terre.  Tow came, took car -- we walked down the street and hit the Bocce Cafe and best friend remembered eating there once before.   Positives -  Atmosphere was very cute and intimate. The back patio looked cold, but really pretty with the Christmas lights.  Waitstaff were attentive and friendly.  Pepto Bismol colored bathroom.  Bruchetta tomatoes were VERY good.  Mmm...Pinot Grigio  Negatives -  Bruchetta toast bit was COLD and really hard. Not like I am used to at all.  No water refills.  My pasta (Capellini Pomodoro) was wayyyy too salty.  Pepto Bismol colored bathroom.   But, i will give Bocce Cafe props for being so close to where our car died. And a tab of 53.00 for two people with appetizer, entree, dessert and a bottle of wine is not bad at all.  I'd go back and try something new.

QWfyxUKBXDcUYCjUSbbEVw.review_text: On a beautiful Sunday afternoon, my friends and I were looking for this pizza place on yelp. My friends didn't like the limited choices of pizza at Golden Boy Pizza so we decided to look for other places in North Beach. Luckily, we found a place not too far away from our original destination.   We saw the menu and thought the prices weren't too bad for a sit-down Italian joint.  We walked into an alleyway of vines and greenery, as if we're walking through Endor. Eventually, we found the place. The server gave us the option of choosing to dine outside or inside. We opted for the former as it was just a good day to eat outside. The interiors were really nice and would be an ideal place to take a date. If SF is experiencing a sunny day, the outdoor patio is the best place to dine. Thankfully, the place wasn't crowded so it was very intimate and quiet.  The menu had a good selection of pasta, antipasti, pizzas, etc. Prices were reasonable. We didn't feel like having pasta so we ended up getting two margharita pizzas and a shrimp-styled pizza. About the pizzas, they are 10 inches and could make four grown men's stomachs full. So yeah...portions are reasonably big. As for the quality, I thought it was very good. I don't know what the previous reviews are criticising on but I thought it was good pizza. Shit...even my Italian friend from NY thought it was delicious.  Anyway....service was good. I would definitely come here again when I visit the Bay.

qU3E7ENm8VsMc_IZCpTCZA.review_text: Very nondescript from the outside, but go thru the little walkway and it's a nice lodgy type restaurant. I was actually surprised at the elbow room available. The rock wall couch things are interesting if not cool in a cheesy way. But there's also the live music. Nothing like a woman singing and a guy playing keyboards to set the mood. The food was good, but not great. The lasagna I had was tasty, though was piping hot on the outside and just lukewarm in the middle. But it's cheap, so I'm not complaining...too much!

xSae7uRscWkxUJIHLqDzlA.review_text: I was pleasantly surprised with our dinner here tonight.  At first when I arrived, I wasn't sure if it was going to be good since it was not very busy.  Decor was a little outdated, but it was cozy.  We had a group of 8 - most of the group had just arrived from England.  I picked this place because it was close to where they were staying, reasonable prices, and casual atmosphere.  The service was excellent and the food was good.  Great place for a group dinner.

Rho7FqhAH9eRdYi24p-0Eg.review_text: I haven't been here for years but I remember loving the atmosphere. Good interior, a little live jazz, nice big crowd but not too crazy. We were with a huge group for a birthday and they handled our orders nicely. My husband ordered wine by asking for "a bottle of your cheapest Chianti." Which was worth it just to get to say that but the wine was even good!

b0gXU67ssu4hrd5CZtLOyQ.review_text: I have been coming here for about ten years, at an average of maybe once a year. First off, the ambiance and the live jazz has always been great. I really enjoy the overall atmosphere of the place. The service was ok. Last time we went we stood by the door with 4 other couple who were all waiting to get seated [and there seemed to b plenty of seats].  The food has been getting more and more mediocre over the years. The price you pay makes it worse. I really used to love this place, but if you do go, i'd recommend going for some pasta dishes you can't botch up.   I think it's still worth a go if you've never been just to check it out, or maybe even just to get a drink.

Yx7JhHPCo5WmsQiyPHtH4Q.review_text: You so want Bocce to be this hidden jewel among all the other North Beach restaurants. But it's not. It falls drastically short.  PARKING: Bocce offers their own valet parking for a reasonable price of $10-15. If you choose to street park, be prepared to circle the area for least 15 minutes. This may be even longer if it's on the same night as Beach Blanket Babylon. In addition, there are pay lots that range from $15 - $25.  RESERVATIONS: I'd say make them, but it didn't seem to make a difference. Our group, along with another party,  were still waiting for a table 20 minutes AFTER our scheduled reservation.  INSIDE: Despite the unassuming nature of the outside of the restaurant, and the narrow entrance into the dining area, the interior boasts high ceilings and a huge seating area. The bar could have been situated better, oh say, not next to the entrance which clogs traffic coming and going. The decor is reminiscent of some replica Beer Hall you'd find at Busch Gardens or Disney World. The "live jazz band" only enhances the surreal nature of the atmosphere, as the female vocalist manages to sing several songs to the tune of "Somewhere Over the Rainbow" all the while tapping away at the snare drum and accompanied by a keyboardist.   SEATING: The frantic nature of the staff is hard not to feel as their poorly planned seating arrangement is presented to us. Seven people are squashed along one side of pushed together tables, while five others are given a bit more breathing room along the opposite side. Still, four others are placed at a separate table altogether.   WINE AND APPETIZERS: Half an hour later, we finally get the wine we've ordered - though those were difficult choices as their wine list is lacking anything close to imagination. Appetizers begin to dot our tables a good 10 minutes after.   MAIN COURSE: Finally, 50 minutes after seating, we are allowed to place our orders. I realize we had close to 20 people in our party, however, it was 10 o' clock - 2 hours since our reservations - and our food entree is yet to be served. When they do bring the food out, it comes in spurts. The first to get their food reluctantly start eating as it's been 10 minutes, their food is starting to get cold, and not everyone has their dinner in front of them. Apparently the raviolis are their most difficult dish to serve. They not only came out last, but we had to remind the waiter we were still missing one plate nearly 15 minutes after they started serving.   Our party ordered everything from Lamb Chops to Lasagna to Linguine in a white wine sauce. The prices listed on the menu are reasonable. However, you get what you pay for. The food, while no one complained, was adequate. Their one redeeming dish is a dessert - Tiramisu. It is quite good, and surprisingly "light."  LAST IMPRESSION: I do NOT recommend this place. There are so many other great food places in North Beach which are better organized, with fresher food and better wines.

m6p5knAyIS79s6WNbeIdGw.review_text: Bocce is the place to go in north beach when you are hungry, in a hurry and can't find anywhere to park. They seem to always have an available table no matter what size, quickly and they have a valet. The food is ok, not traditional and not ammmazing, but it does the job and sometimes they have live music.

bE5Swrp3qwsgA_SyVBUfbg.review_text: We came a bit early for dinner, so the restaurant is empty. The enterance to the restaurant and the garden patio are very cute. The inside of the restaurant itself is really strange however, it's really big and feels like you're eating inside a castle (or this might be the ambiance they're looking for).  The waiter was extremely polite. Service is not a problem.  Food. They gave us sliced baguette. It's warm, so we ate it especially since I can't eat my entree. I ordered the linguine with clams. Sauce is extremely sour and the pasta is not fresh. It feels that they made the dish yesterday. I can't eat my pasta, so I just dunk in the bread to my pasta sauce.  Good restaurant in North Beach is so far and between since it's such a touristy area. It surprises me that despite the location that's a bit secluded, this restaurant still stays in business.

3bSQjofB_N_ZeUozmTH66g.review_text: I really enjoyed my meal here, it wasn't spectacular, but it was definitely enjoyable. We stopped here after a long walk up and down telegraph hill, and we were hungry! And sense we were in North Beach, why not have some Italian food! It was lunch time and the place was just about empty so we were able to get the whole patio to ourselves. Well, not entirely to ourselves, we were kept company by the local tabby cat, Gustavo. Who was very cute and kept rubbing up against our legs while we ate. (I think he was just waiting for us to drop something) We had a relaxing lunch with a nice glass of chilled white wine.  It was a great place to end a great day.

-vdo-XDggc2QNmdqRA9YOA.review_text: I had a Sunday lunch here recently with a friend who lives in the City and decided we would meet there. When we first got there, my other friend and I thought we were at the wrong place - it was so empty. Reading other reviews on here, I can see why. The space itself is very cool and I like the large patio. The food was ok - I had the special seasfood risotto and it was good but definitely not the best I've had. Service was VERY slow too so that got kind of old fast. I can't say I'd choose to return, especially with all of the other options right there in north beach, but it was alright.

kk2oFTBSU9C2XshIVU7tXQ.review_text: I've been craving Italian and pasta and tomato sauce for weeks now. Just *craving* it. So when given the opportunity to pick dinner for Saturday night, I was quick to offer up a cuisine. We headed over to Bocce's relatively early (5ish) before the dinner rush and easily got a table. Along with several families of tourists with noisy kids (oy that's frustrating sometimes, but not something you can ding the restaurant for IMO).  The restaurant has an elegant decor with cushy, cozy couches winding their way around. Tables are scattered around the couches so half the seating is on standard chairs, the other lets you settle back into cushiness. It's really quite comfortable, I could see settling in for a few hours to drink and relax and socialize.  There's a lot of options on the menu, from appetizers to salads, pasta, pizza, sandwiches, etc, a good range of wine and beer. The bread with olive oil and balsamic was so soft and fluffy it felt like cotton, I could have probably eaten nothing but that and been happy. But you don't go to Italian restaurants for the bread no matter how good it is... no, go for the pasta. The awesome, delicious pasta.  Torn between ravioli and spaghetti, I settled on a pomodoro sauce since tomato sauce is probably my favourite part of pasta. My friend ordered the carbonara, along with a beer of some sort (I failed to notice what brand). I had a glass of the Zin to go with my dinner.  Service was pretty quick and very considerate. Water, drinks and bread were topped up regularly (or asked if we wanted more). It's a large open-concept restaurant and I could see it getting noisy as it fills up, so be careful of this is you're looking for a quiet, intimate dinner with a loved one. Prices are also really decent, in the medium price range. Our dinner ran around the $45 range (before tip) for entrees and drinks, with more than enough on your plate to satisfy your appetite.   If you're looking for decently priced Italian food, you're in the North Beach area, and don't mind potential crowding by tourists, Bocce's is a good option to look at. I'd happily go back to try the ravioli or pizza options. Some of the appetizers look great too!

k6y_KpWMByi8Hpodqft7Kw.review_text: Delicious, simple food, tons of choices on the menu (I had the fettucini alfredo), pretty decent wine list.    The decor reminds me of an Olive Garden-type place.  But the service was fast and put up with our rowdy birthday party.

gWk7tKV5olF-GhSvmOeMhQ.review_text: i love bocce, been going there for nearly 14 years.  i must say the linguini with clams and the chicken lasagna are awsome!

RGrlRPQKVMeALP_Pj8MrMA.review_text: what was that all about?!  this place is huge.. great for groups..  i went here with my coworkers for lunch and it was almost empty except for two other parties. and service still was slow. whats the deal?  i ordered a penne and carbonara.. major quantity than quality. boo.

ChzYysPTcs547-WGsH6z9w.review_text: I love this place!  It is great to eat outside on a nice day.  It would be a great place to have a party too as they have a special section in back where you can reserve.

PSY8Bn0NpppkXgxlLKb9Yw.review_text: Overall, a disappointing experience, although the food itself was very good.    Didn't like:  1) Noise level on Saturday evening.  2) Decor (wall decorations so strange they were distracting).  3) Waitress with an attitude who got huffy over a wine order snafu then was fake-y nice at the end for the tip.  4) Inflexible menu (we wanted the select-your-own pasta deal with half marinara/half pesto ... not allowed ... should be renamed to sort-of-select-your-own).  Liked:  Pasta was cooked just right, and the sauces were very flavorful.  Prices were great -- good value.

0GHsxjCk-Ynzx4Ihj8tjPQ.review_text: My fiance's mom threw me a surprise bridal luncheon here. Nice restaurant hidden in North Beach on Green. I was surprised on how big the inside was...with all the plush comfy couches it seemed like I was walking in to someone's living room...definitely a restaurant that is good for groups. The outdoor patio area seemed nice but it was way to windy and cold to sit out there. The place was dead empty on a Saturday at lunch which was surprising.  My guess is Bocce Cafe is more of a popular dinner spot? The menu is extensive with all different pastas, pizzas, risotto, etc, etc. The salmon penne pasta with tomato cream sauce was quite good. The tiramisu was also delicious. The price points were on par for North Beach as was the quality of the food and service. I would come back to try dinner and get some cocktails out on the patio on a nice warm day.

G9aTxt0n8mewMD9ogCj0yQ.review_text: Okay - the ambiance is great, I get that - we all get that - but the food has to be something at least bit interesting, I mean right?  First the bread, it's french bread. At an Italian restaurant?!?! Seemed like it came from Safeway. They don't have fresh grated Parmesan, just that powdered shit you shake from a glass jar like when you eat gressy pizza at two in the morning.   Had the gnocchi. I couldn't finish it - and I'm a disgusting fat ass who eats everything, especially when I pay $16 for the meal. The gnocchi was fine, it was the sauce. It comes with an Alfredo sauce, when I aksed our (Russian) server if it was made with a Gorgonzola sauce she replied, "Pesto?" -- She had to ask the cook what I meant. I am skeptical of a place where the wait staff does not know a simple Italian cheese, which I might add, is a staple to any good gnocchi dish.   Great atmosohere, but seriously, don't waste your time with the food. You'll be disappointed.  ***I should add, I went here on account of my roommate (a foodie) who liked it. He had tortellini. Maybe it is a new chef or a bad dish I had. Either way, there is just too much good food in SF to mess around with another bad meal.

v0ANF5-KxIWBtQQB0PfI4w.review_text: I've had better and I've had worse Veal Marsala.  I've had better and I've had worse service.  After playing tour guide on my cousin's first trip to San Francisco in 15 years we were all pretty hungry and Capo's wouldn't open for another 2 hours (5pm).  Hunger convinced us to try this place.  There were 2-3 patrons at the bar and 2 other patrons in the otherwise empty dining room.    Our party of 6 was led to a table and left to wait for the wait staff.  We had to flag some down for waters and then we had to flag them down for refills.  When we were done eating we had to flag them down for the check.   My veal Marsala was tender, the penne that came with it tasted like cardboard.  The frozen veggies served with it were ok...for frozen veggies.

R0I9Bvf9bVEw1_rrrO9qgA.review_text: The food was great.. The service was good. our waiter had a large group so his service could of been better.. but it's not his fault because they had 3 other employees that could of gave us bread and butter in a timely manner. I will go back again!

qknZt5qr21xGZqGVWqqdTg.review_text: I remember coming here after I just graduated from college thinking, "this is the poop".  Nice ambiance, jazz band.  "I'm such a grown up!"  Then I grew up and realized what good food tastes like, and it doesn't taste like anything Bocce serves up.  It has it's time and it's place, but for me that was a good 10 years ago.

R_0FzpImqrhCbYkDydtfXw.review_text: came in here on an evening with a group of 6, had tables with couch, i sat on the couch, that was comfortable. nice ambiance in the place, authentic italian-american north beach... didnt get to really see the outside so maybe i would rate higher if i had... food here wasnt anything to write home about. we split an antipasta platter, which seemed like a lot of stuff out of jars, probably not homemade. for pasta i had linguine with clams. it tasted like linguine with clams. nothing bad, but it didnt make me want to come back to try something else...

95QfXg9dTeuw94kCV-lCOg.review_text: love this restaurant... very romantic and cozy..food's good.. service may be a bit slow since they're not always busy...  if you're lucky, a kitty will visit you when you sit at the patio

Z3vY6CM1aSJcyDMrFfhPIw.review_text: Great prices, wine list, atmosphere and Italian food... can't beat it, but make sure to make a reservation, because both times I've showed up without a reservation I had to put in some solid bar time until my parties name was called. I was amazed at how fresh everything tasted given the prices, I really couldn't notice one thing that seemed canned, jarred, dried, etc... Bocce Cafe is a great local spot for North Beach residents or anyone in the San Francisco area. Not much to say on the negative side except for the fact that our table was very close to the live band they had that night so my ear rang for a little while, but other than that, this place is a big winner.

002eP_6BW4CTS8W9cZdEzA.review_text: I was on vacation and found this restaurant via yelp!  I am so very glad we found it.  There was a cute little walkway to get to the restaurant.  It was in its own little world almost.  We walked in and it felt less like a restaurant and more like a lounge, which was lovely.  There was live music and we were seated at a half regular table half couch.  It was so comfortable and the interior was so cute.  The portions were a good size, we couldn't finish our food.  It was really tasty and the service was A-OK.  I had a great time and I would definitely go back there.

3bvNEMdEjdmBIezvIVgs3Q.review_text: It was a blast. Went for a friends 30th b-day. Ordered the mixed appetizer which was fantastically delicious. for a entree i did chicken marsala. yummm. not only the food was delicious, the place is very cozy and the seats are super comfy. liked the live music too... and the fact that it's close to a lot of good bars and lounges makes this place a 4star.  i would totally recommend this place as a date spot.

nJYqi5tRgyYMCXBDhkcZ9Q.review_text: Absolutely adorable interior. Very ski-lodge like. There was a projector for the giants World Series game although there was only one other party in the entire restaurant on a Saturday night...   The two stars are for the great interior and okay food. I don't want to destroy their yelp rating with something even worse because the food was okay although pretty overpriced, but it's UNACCEPTABLE to find MULTIPLE BUGS in my leftovers.   I hope this restaurant can turn it around because it's really beautiful but there's needs to be a management, chef, & maybe waitstaff change? Kind of felt like we were a bother to the workers. But one of the waitresses was kind and put up with us.

60DZrfk3o_Qg4le0477mvg.review_text: There's a nice ambience to this place with a patio outiside.  I'm sure it's better when the sun goes adieu.  I ordered a pasta dish with sauce.  My pasta was swimming in the red sauce, so I had to thicken it with the parmesan cheese.  Turnoff. Waiters refilled the bread, at least that.  I tried the tiramisu, it was borderline soggy, but the flan was good.  We left feeling a bit tipsy and way relaxed.  The menu is very simple. I give it a two, nice waiters, but ehh kinda food.    Are there any good Italian restaurants in North Beach?!

IiSAkYX1YbmPHP4dldzTmA.review_text: This place is legit! Loved it!  I brought my girl here for Valentines Day, and wouldn't you know it? not even crowded. I didn't even have to make a reservation.  Not to say this place is below par, far from it.  The have the most romantic setting, in a remote setting.  Who wants to hang out on the "Italian Strip" as I call it, Columbus Ave is OVER RATED! I don't care for the hubbub. Tourists make me sick. That's why I loved Bocce even more.   As we were swooped up by our cab, we got lucky.  Our cabby was an aging local, wish nostalgia to relay unto us.  Bocce Cafe used to be a Spaghetti Factory.  Not only this, but he informed us that they used to encourage the public smoking of marijuana!  I can't help but wish this were still the case.

zrsOOITf43Modfk1ZmeTig.review_text: Valet ruined the experience.  Rude, hostile, uncooperative, and then tried to scam more money out of me.  Casts a light on how the restaurant treats customers.

5tx3-wYYY6m_rFc2PrhfUA.review_text: This is a great dining experience when you're not too concerned about getting the best food, but you just want to eat in an interesting place and maybe sit on couch cushions while you do it.  The garden / lodge look of the building is neat, and the live music can be awesome too when it's not too loud.  I've come here numerous times and never had a bad experience.  I wouldn't rave about it, but I would recommend at least checking it out.

CcJPsAxQ4Q0AS6oGjYOx_w.review_text: Try their sandwiches for lunch. Their bread is great. There's never anyone here, and if you sit on the patio for long enough, you'll be greeted by the kitties who live in the area.   The pasta is average in my opinion. So it's not my favorite for dinner.

lU5qkrFbxZwI6gCQKoPrDA.review_text: Doh! Loading error, so this is a re-written review. Let's see if I can remember the basics:  Huge place, so good for big groups Great patio with twinkly lights. I don't know about you, but I always look better on a date when there's twinkly lights behind me. Good food, good service, good wine and good company. Can't beat it!

TEHiUF-e8pa37rByg15MmA.review_text: Not a place you'd go to unless you were drunk, alas, I was drunk (not too drunk, though).  I've found myself at Bocce a few times after 10pm looking for something to calm my BAC.  Food is okay (the bread and the gnocchi are very good though).  Interior is very cheesy.  Sometime's there's live music.  Again, you're not coming here for a spectacular meal or ambiance.  You're trying to sober-up.

qDP11YsJcqjz3CiGUK3oog.review_text: Authentic Italian pizzas are great. Ran and owned by a lovely family from lucca, Italian. Yum!

h5-NsPUzUPd2cS4DEEIr4g.review_text: We wanted something off of the 'main' north beach drag and went here on a recommendation.  I think its likely more fun on a warmer day since it looks like they have a nice outdoor patio and bocce ball.  The food is mediocre at best, what they lack in quality they make up in serving size.  The service was fine but the food is simple and close to a 'homecooked' meal, but I've had better.  Simple wine list to match the simple food.   overall, a good place for larger groups (huge dining area) and families.

6RJBeJlbDGrZO91Qc2NG9A.review_text: Still great for large groups, esp. the birthday and special occasion place.  The food tho, argh!  Not good.

DvcAC_nlKaTDsHcA8Slagw.review_text: Bocce Cafe is a mixture of oddities - the overly elaborate rustic Italian decor juxtaposes the paper table setting. A hearty, soul-warming, serving of Cioppino is served in a clinical metal pot. It's half classy, half Olive Garden cheesey. But all in all, Bocce offers pretty good food, quite a lot of it, and at a good price.   The $10 pasta special (choice of pasta and sauce) is a default especially if you like spaghetti carbonara like me. The cioppino is another good dish and it's big enough to share for 2. It comes with a side pasta and you have enough delicious broth, crab, clams, mussels, and salmon for several bowls each. Plus it's only $22 I believe.   But for the sake of my sanity, please stop the wedding singer in the patio from singing "happy birthday" for the umpteenth time in one night. I can hear her from my bedroom and it's driving me insane.

CfV_axQI2rK0eHB9FfG_GQ.review_text: We went to Bocce after wandering the streets of North Beach quite freezing on a winter night. I really enjoyed the secluded entrance, something the other restaurants of North Beach didn't have. We sat down and ordered 2 beers and some marinated olives. Definitely recommend the olives! I ordered the margherita pizza and my boyfriend had the linguini with zucchini, olive oil and garlic. The pizza was spot on authentic thin crust italian. It was nice and salty from the mozzarella and fresh from the basil. My boyfriend's pasta was also quite delicious with really good simple flavors. Portions were about average for the price. I enjoyed this restaurant, the interior was kinda quirky italian and also really homey. Price is average for North Beach, our dinner with 2 beers, 2 glasses of wine, an appetizer and 2 entrees was only around $50-60.

WAe8lmRVSzdUIhiOgQANlg.review_text: I just joined Yelp and I am making this my first review. Why? I had my wedding receception here last September and it was magical! After researching high and low, this place is SF's best kept secret for a small reception. The owner met with my family and I on several occasions and was so accomodating, flexible and friendly-which was a huge relief. The night was magical, the pictures turned out beautiful thanks to all the rustic details and beautiful entranceway. The lighting and intimacy of the restaurant setting the mood, the food was served hot and delicious and the location of the restaurant is great for out of towners to experience North Beach. I can't say enough fantastic words about this place. I highly recommend calling up and talking to the owner or manager if you are even considering this place!

fjk8n7Ef8pRU9G2z33zQmw.review_text: The food was excellent but the service needed to be better in order to match the atmosphere. I had the linguine with mushrooms an cream sauce and my friend had the meat sauce lasagna.  The mushroom and cream sauce was very rich and I couldnt finish it because it was so thick. But boy was it delicious!

pHpa-Y816CBABAfwSJc0vw.review_text: The food is good, but what I love about this place is the atmosphere.  They usually have a jazz duo playing music on the weekends which makes the dining experience even better.  The service is fantastic!  A great place to meet up with all your friends before heading out to the North Beach bars.

QjNjVF-ZdWr-P4zUzXwpVA.review_text: Nothing to delight in but decent decor and service. The entrance is truly enchanting and the staff greets you warmly at the door. We were sat outdoors in their backyard on a chilly night and waited about 10 minutes before being greeted by a rather hurried server. I'm guessing she had the entire patio section to herself.   We both ordered a variation of lasagna and having not eaten all day, I decided to skip an appetizer for fear of not making it to the actual main course. They had no iced tea to speak of that night-how does a place in California not have iced tea?? But anyhow, the lasagna's came out in record time and while I appreciate the little earthen pots they come in, the dried square of cheese could have been done without.   I've had better food and cooked at a better temperature too. The chicken lasagna was actually cold in the center and to save face and not ruin my friends' meal, I said nothing but continued cutting up the lasagna and mixing with the other parts of the warmer sides of lasagna to mask the grits of cold cheese...nasty.   They apparently have a mascot that walks from table to table begging for scraps. A rather large bobcat tabby is this place's very own Garfield, scarfing lasagna and manicotti like a champ. I wasn't at all impressed by the service-or lack thereof but was happy to see the server was all over the table as soon as it came time to pay the bill.

8jahAMal9Hggwm2RDmkgig.review_text: I've been here twice and enjoyed each time!  The ambiance, the food, the prices, and the accommodation for large groups make this place a fun place to eat.  Walking back through the little lush alley way into the restaurant is a lovely way to start the evening.  The dishes are all pretty good, and I am especially a fan of the create your own pasta dish for $6.95.  Yes, there may be better Italian food in North Beach, but Bocce delivers on the price and ambiance.  I went with a bachelorette party to load up before bar-hopping (and have some vino to get the party started) and with a group of swimming friends the night before a race to carb load.  Both nights were delightful (even the tacky jazz duo playing in the background!).

dPb7Kkj1Ci4w8KXO9LFjWA.review_text: this place is great for an intimate dinner w/ your love or for a big group of people that is ready to party balls.  we went to the bocce cafe for a friends bday dinner- there were probably 15 of us.  they have a tented off area in the back where they put larger parties.  it was perfect because we could be as loud as we wanted to be.  good food, good drinks, good company.  done!

FNACom5kNmMt2iPCbe8KJA.review_text: Really bad.  They were out of Chianti and bread (!!??!!).  The fried mozzarella comes with some onion rings and cold tomato sauce (no marinara??); tastes like frozen.  Warm spinach salad drenched with dressing.  Chicken Parm was dreadful.  Wife had gnocchi; said it was ok but mushy.  Won't be back.  Should have just waited for our table at Tony's.

-1wv5xqxIbiRbuHHSSNwnw.review_text: Bocce, darling! I love you, I hate you. I love you. I hate you.  I always have a good time here and great service.  Your charming and sexy Italian waiters definitely work. And the ambiance is bustling and fun.  But I'm actually going to a restaurant to eat. Your food is just not that good. Overcooked pasta and fishy fish.   So I just wait for the next unsuspecting friend or family member to visit from the suburbs. My expectations for the food will be low, and suburbanites don't know good food anyway. We'll both enjoy the experience and have a great time!

dHEYJ1vLgIdb1ks34_2Fnw.review_text: My first and last time ordering delivery (phone) from Bocca...  Promised delivery time: 35 minutes. Actual delivery time: 95 minutes.  And instead of a side of pesto sauce, they gave me a side of meatballs.

DKIz_c_cK1pMcxIuPIK3bg.review_text: Hits and Misses  Hits - Carpaccio was excellent!  Ambience is above average.  The off-street location and garden walk access made me feel like I was entering a private club.  The interior of the building is airy and spacious and the skylights let in some nice natural lighting.  Misses - The service was poor.  We were placed outside in the back and that was how we were treated.  Felt forgotten after the waitress checked on us when we were almost finished with our meal and did not follow up to make sure our drinks were refilled.  It took 15 minutes to get a refill of coffee and water!  My brother says the service tonight was not how it normally is and I hope that it isn't!!

1TFraFC6i-tDhXQ3del0-g.review_text: UPDATE:  So I was watching CBS5 tonight, they ran an investigative story on the valet service used here (run by another company). They found that the valet attendants used customer cars for shuttle duty.   Watch out!!  If you must use valet, take pictures of your mileage.  You're better off parking it yourself and walking a couple blocks than to have your car violated. Yea parking in this area sucks, but I rather walk a mile and not have grease stains from a pizza box from an unauthorized re-con mission.  btw, I never valet my car.  --  Been here twice. Once we sat at the table next to the band... loud! order some white-sauce pasta dish with a side of sausage. I didn't realize the sausage would be in red sauce. I thought it was just sausage, no sauce, that I could put into my pasta dish...I can't mix red and white sauces now. and on top of it, this sausage was COLD! I had to send it back for a reheat.  The second time, we sat far from the band, it wasn't too bad, but we had a table in the corner, it was really hot and stuffy, no air flow. I ordered a pizza this time, much better than my first experience eating here.  There's no parking here, can't even find street parking. They offer valet. I never use valet.  I like the candy by the hostess, goooood. Grabbed a handful as I left.

1dj2Vp9plba4O9hGtKaB8w.review_text: Bocce Cafe is such an amazing value especially for North Beach. When you walk down the Ivy lined walkway to get into the restaurant you feel like you are being transported out of the city. The restaurant is warm and inviting and the live music is a great touch. There is a full bar that serves great cocktails and even better corkage is only $12.00.  The food was great. Hearty and Rustic Italian Food. I wouldn't go here expecting culinary genius however I feel anyone would come out of here full and pleased. The cannelloni was really good and fresh out of the oven. Desserts were good too. Try the Creme Caramel...6 people, 2 Bottles of Wine, 3 Beers, 1 After Dinner Drink, 6 Entrees and 3 Desserts. $170.00 with tax. Great Place to bring groups....

nJ3l3S_zOnyV1RIKGYABow.review_text: My favorite italian place in the city.  I love the decor, especially when I get to sit on the couches and eat.  I haven't eaten on their outdoor patio yet, but it looks fun.  Great lasagna!

-2LAw4y4cqjP7vAbv8zCMQ.review_text: My boyfriend and I stopped by for dinner on Sunday, March 30, 2014 after wine tasting in Sonoma.  We were staying for a few days in SF and this place was recommended by one of the pourers along our winery tour.  He RAVED about the food, calling it the best Italian food in San Francisco.    I highly doubt it!  At around 7:00, the place was nearly empty (one other table inside, one outside).  The service wasn't bad but certainly nothing to brag about, same goes for the decor!    We shared the carpaccio but found it bland.  He wasn't thrilled with his fettuccini calamari and I've eaten better spaghetti and meat sauce at the public high school where I worked for a decade.  We had only visited 4 wine tasting rooms and that was hours earlier, so our palates weren't "blown" but the Chianti we ordered was hard to drink.  The meal was like a brick in my stomach and kept me up until the wee hours.  I'll say this in Bocce's favor:  Prices are decent and we appreciated the vallet parking.

4QKOO2MtsPuL_-wMTjKsLg.review_text: I recently had my rehearsal dinner at Bocce & I have to say, it was great!  You aren't going to get the best Italian food in North Beach, but for the price, it's works!  We had more than 40 people and they perfectly catered to us.   The antipasto plate is pretty freaking awesome.

8Nvvqnb60aFlZutylZd-Aw.review_text: Great Italian food, nice ambiance.  Sexy Russian waitress who was also very nice.  The eggplant pizza was awesome, the veggie lasagna was awesome, I ate it all.  The chocolate gelato was big and rich.  The gnocchi was awesome, the calamari appetizer was nice.    The ladies restroom was like a little weird Alice in Wonderland type of room, check it out if you are on LSD.  Oh, and they had delicious wine also.  And on top of that, the price was slightly on the low side considering the quality of food.  We spent $139 without tip for a group of 6 and we left full.  Big thumbs up.  I'll be back again if I am eating with a medium or large size group.  Who would go to a chain restaurant when you have awesome places like this?

UKsBKla6IjgOeKe_UC5Dbg.review_text: If you want $10 pasta in N. Beach, or a $19 Rib Eye, with fairly priced mediocre wine, this is the place. Bocce doesn't purport to be anything more than it is; a nice place to hang out inside on comfy stone padded couches, or a large outdoor patio. Service has always been A-OK for me; Food gets the same. Nothing amazing, but when you factor in the price for 2 with a bottle of wine and 3 courses is around $60, it makes a nice option if your heading out in the area. But it is hit or miss on the pasta. Just a heads up... Price List: boccecafe.com/bocce_menu…

aPPiNUuVR2TTqSYSX6aj7w.review_text: Great Italian food!  The higher rated places were all too busy to walk in without a reservation on a Saturday night, but they had tables here. Whole the little things made it clear this is not the best place in the area (parmasean cheese in the shaker and not fresh), the food was still very good. The lasagna was oily but delicious with the meat and the seafood linguini and cioppino were plentiful and excellent.  The portobello penne was good. Service was fast and extremely friendly.  Overall if you find yourself in the area without a reservation on a busy night definitely check this place out!

IQymtwcSb7elorFDr_6YUQ.review_text: I would give it a 3.5 if I could but I have to say this place just didn't have an authentic feel. It was deserted, the food was decent, the bread wasn't great, there was no parmesean (unacceptable). The patio looks sweet but was closed when we were there. There are too many dope spots in North Beach to revisit this one unless you are trying to sit outside.

5oqqEMwc1guutGfqQ_Zf5w.review_text: Great food, the spicy shrimp pasta was the best I have ever had, great service too

BOU25_BWQnLdFJBKUe2XdQ.review_text: The bartender is fairly friendly, just the beer selection isn't that great. I like how it seems spacious, I do mean seems until one sits down. When we got our table, our bread didn't come until we finished making our orders and 5 mins to bringing our plates of food. The table is so narrow that our plates we hitting each other.   The portions wasn't that big.

vXYxtW_JpMMdjNzcw91u7A.review_text: I used to go to Bocce a lot as if was one of my friends favorite places. I think with Bocce, it's more about the atmosphere and experience than the food. The food is alright, but nothing to really write home about. Bocce is very open with large comfy almost couch seating. It's pretty loud so it's a great place to have a large dinner party. There's also a outdoor back patio which I've never experienced myself as it was usually pretty cold, though there are heat lamps.  Again, it's definitely a fun place to go with a bunch of friends but I would never recommend it for a date or intimate dinner.

qKY70-70mhZQmZQl50TAcA.review_text: Food is very mediocre.  That being said, this place is great for groups.  Fairly cheap prices and great atmosphere make this a winner for a big group dinner.

JNyLyXn-unUhJmiGJnI6tQ.review_text: Bocce Cafe is a good for big group ordeals.  Getting a reservation never presents a challenge, and although the place seems a bit like a low-budget Olive Garden (if you can imagine such a thing), at least you're not paying for the food, service, or ambiance you won't receive.

pU7CkQLAi6tBdxsO33z4FQ.review_text: Beautiful place, decent food, good for groups.

WecuAsHBDZGj7Z6_sJcQAw.review_text: Chicken met meatballs. Eggplant met linguini.  Everything met a whole lot of marinara sauce. The perfect condiment for an Italian sandwich. The perfect base for a bowl of pasta. You can never have enough. At least I can't.  This was my second time here. First was years ago for a birthday party. Lingering memory of it being both good and very reasonably priced.  Both are now confirmed.  Outdoor seating for warm days. Chicken meatballs for any day.

Sp-S4y8rx1xIX3d5VOK0bQ.review_text: My boyfriend and his friends have been raving about this place for a while.   Being the object of my love's affection for almost two years, I wondered why said boyfriend had not brought me here.  Well, that day finally arrived last night.  I walked down the quaint alley that leads to the side entrance of Bocce Cafe.  The restaurant inside was cute, and like other Yelpers have commented, has a very "lodge" feeling to it.  Being that we went on a Thursday evening, the joint was pretty quiet.  Pouring over the menu, I had a hard time deciding what I wanted to try because everything sounded so tasty (I'm such a sucker for pasta).  My ever so brilliant boyfriend pointed out on the back the "meal for 2."  This included veggie lasagna, meat lasagna, canneloni, gnocchi, pesto tortellini, fettuccine alfredo and linguine alfredo.  How could I pass up the opportunity to try so many tasty treats?!  And, for a mere $22, it was such a bargain.  We started with the bruschetta, which was decent.  I found theirs to be a bit lacking in flavor.  I like my bruschetta to have a lot of fresh basil, and I could barely taste it in theirs.  When our waitress brought out the pasta dish for two, I was so excited.  It was way more food than I thought - I think sharing this dish with 3 people would be perfect.  Everything tasted good.  My favorites were the pesto tortellini, the fettuccine alfredo, and the lasagna.  The gnocchi was not as flavorful as I would have liked, but they were cooked perfectly.    Service was really good, bordering on overwhelming - the bus boy kept trying to take our plates before we were finished.  Overall, the meal was good and a total bargain.  Recommended for those who want to get their Italian grub on, but don't want to rob to bank to do so.  Thank you wonderful boyfriend for finally introducing me to the wonders of Bocce Cafe.

UH6RCH9K1o2VW3CU8PY5iQ.review_text: Love the Caesar salad here! This restaurant has a great ambiance and nice plushy couches to sit on while you're having dinner! It's a bit brighter than i would like it to be, but that's just sweating the small stuff! Parking is a nightmare around this neighborhood. Great wine selection. Not the best Italian, but pretty darn good with a great atomosphere and nice service.

gDcs7q-6U0d85tIHFarKdA.review_text: Restaurant was empty both times I went even though North Beach was busy and other restaurants seemed to be packed. I probably should have taken this as a clue and went somewhere else.  I went here a few months ago and had a poor experience but held off writing a review because I thought it might just be an off night. Cesar salad is good but small for the price. Added chicken to it last time and got exactly six toothpick sized slivers of chicken sprinkled on top.  Had pasta and meatballs this time, spaghetti was overcooked and sauce looked exactly like something out of a can of Chef Boyardee. Bad.  Service was friendly but confused. Even though there were only 4 or 5 tables seated in the entire restaurant, they brought us another table's salads, then forgot ours, then brought us another table's entrees.   Overall really disappointing.

vb9gPCj_79__L1K23a011g.review_text: Yum.  Yum.  YUM!  I'm not even a huge fan of Italian food but this place truly delivered an outstanding meal.  My friend and I had a reservation and we sat near where the jazz ensemble was playing but not so near that we couldn't hear one another.  Our server was a nice young man that promptly took our drink order and brought us waters.  I really liked that when he brought our bottle of wine, he poured us both a bit to try.  I was pleased that he did this because most places I go to eat with a male companion, the server only pours my guy friend a tasting.    We ordered the Beet Salad to share and some marinated olives.  Both were superb!!  I splurged in the calorie department and ordered the Fettuccine Pesto with mushrooms, smoked salmon, and olives.  I wanted to eat the entire serving but had I done so, I wouldn't have been able to walk afterwards.    Nice ambiance, I liked that they had live music.  I'd definitely come back here.

_F2F-yO_oj96rhPPIjlq-Q.review_text: A kitty visited me on the patio.  I like that kitty.  Good food, not excellent, but I always enjoy eating here.  Great for large groups and their bread is like me-hot, fresh, and wonderful.  Fresh at least.    Dirt cheap prices and the tri-color vegetarian meal for two with a caprese salad was just right for Monsieur Evil et moi.

OQImub6evGiBTwpQmoVUjA.review_text: Magical patio.  If the figs on the tree are ripe, pick one and have it with dessert.

obtA9umYYA9xCCWVzQh7kg.review_text: Eating here made me want to Yelp...the food was great, our server was great, but the manager was disorganized.  We made reservations on New Year's Eve so I expected it to be busy but we were agitated waiting for our table since they were not going off of the reservation list. Some people pushed their way to the front of the line expecting to be helped ahead of those in front of them, but they were good about not seating people before those who had reservations.  When we finally did get seated, we had the coldest seat in the house, luckily they moved us once we said something about being seated next to the door. It seemed like they had a really nice patio - something to check out in warmer weather.  In the end, everybody loved their food and we left very satisfied. Our waitress and busgirl were great - we just felt bad for them because they were clearly understaffed.  We will probably come back here, just when it is less busy!

et3ttmvP-HDIqfN-aSYPeA.review_text: I am BLOWN AWAY by the mediocre reviews this place is getting.  I'm a pretty hard sell, being a long time San Franciscan, someone who avoids North Beach like the plague (parking, tourists, douche's etc.), but was in the area watching a friend's gig.    Afterwards, she suggested we try Bocce because many of us were on a limited budget and we also had a group of 15 on a Friday night.  We showed up at 8:30pm and the place was PACKED, but without a reservation, the owner (?) joined some tables in the outside patio area and we were seated w/in 5 minutes.  After that, the staff literally waited on us hand and foot, they were RUNNING back and forth to get us whatever we needed, there was never more than 2 minutes without some sort of wait staff in the vicinity looking to help us, and the food came out within 15 minutes (and it was 100% correct!).  We even asked for a basket of entirely Fogaccia and the waitress brought it without any hesitation or complaint (the bread baskets they brought were mixed bread, and the Fogaccia disappeared the second they hit the table).  I've resigned myself to getting shitty service whenever I come to a restaurant 1.  with a large group and 2. without a reservation and 3. in a busy part of town on a weekend night.  If I could give them more than 5 stars for their service, I would.  Now on to the food.  I'm 100% Italian and my family is from central and southern Italy.  I ordered the lasagna which was decent, but nothing special, but I tried other friends dishes (the fettuccine w/mixed sea food, the calamari) and those were all top notch.  I have a high standard for Lasagna, however, because it was mom's specialty, so it's not their fault for being only mediocre.  At least they used Ricotta instead of cottage cheese!  In addition, the prices were reasonable (most entrees in the $9-12 range) and the acoustics were GREAT!  There's nothing worse than going to a crowded restaurant and having to yell to be heard.   The back porch area was covered and enclosed with clear plastic, and the temperature was perfect and the acoustics great out there, too.  The decor inside was interesting--reminiscent of Tahoe in the mid 90's/a lodge in the woods.  Overall it was a fun experience, great service, good food, decent prices, comfortable surroundings.  That, for me, has always been hard to come by in N.Beach, which is why I avoid it at all costs.

EuuyiAuEa_s3VSS9i8okmg.review_text: Cute spot, perfect for dinner with friends or date night.  We came on a Monday night, so it was pretty mellow.  The bread is delicious.  We shared the bruschetta, which was delightful.  For dinner, I had the Penne ala vodka.  Penne with salmon in a vodka tomato cream sauce.  It was served hot, and it was quite tasty.  My girlfriends had the spinach ravioli and the fettuchini with chicken and broccoli.  Prices were pretty good.  We shared a bottle of Pinot Grigio, which was light and perfect for a summer night.    I do love the path to the restaurant- it is earthy and calming.  The inside of the restaurant is cozy and rustic (in my opinion).  Our server was super nice and sweet.

w4b_-IS0uCqZzRVFMXGsUg.review_text: This place is a little off the beaten path of NB. Had the cioppino ($24.95) which was delicious and served with a side of pasta (also yummy). Service was fine but the server never came back to check on us until we were done.  Otherwise, all was great and we will definitely return for the cioppino alone.

vivFH2_uIcOyqel-cHmxLA.review_text: Good food, nice staff, lovely atmosphere but no more bocce!  I found this last point a little disappointing!  I choose this location because I had two kids in tow and we were meeting two other adults for dinner. Figuring that the kids could play bocce if they got restless, we came here.  What a bummer to find out the court was gone and while I'm sure the patio seating that replaced it is lovely, I felt this establishment sacraficed some its uniqueness to become like a lot of other restaurants in the area.    Still all in my party enjoyed themselves.  The live music was great -- hubby and I shared the "Seven Flavors" --- small helpings of Lasagna, Veggie Lasagna, Eggplant Parmigiana, Tortellini Pesto, Cannelloni, Fettuccini Alfredo and Gnocchi Napolitana. Delicious and filling, the Seven Flavors allowed us to try a variety of offerings from the Bocce Cafe.    Now while there is no kids' menu, my 8 year-old did well with the Spaghetti and meatballs on the menu.  Decently priced, she informed us that the meatballs were tasty and the pasta was perfectly cooked.  The restaurant was also kind enough to work with us on preparing a small portion of spaghetti noodles and butter for our 4-year-old.   Will we go back again?  You bet!! Despite there being no bocce ball anymore, we did enjoy ourselves and liked the classic North Beach atmosphere!

CiYRhDyFbsDbWR45uv822w.review_text: Food = great.  Good quality, decent portions, and just delicious flavors.  Hands-down, best lasagna in the city!  Service = good.  Attentive.  Friendly.  Drinks = good wine list, full bar, etc.  Decor = comfortable and classy  Seating = good, and there is an outdoor area which is covered but still beautiful.  Great for group events as they will actually be prepared for it!  I will warn you, this is a popular spot for natives, tourists, and families!  Oh, and parking is impossible!

IhmBr-yHC8xLjdnoq7O37w.review_text: Bocce Cafe is an awesome little escape through a secret garden right into a little palace of comfy seating and delicious food.  We were told to come here by someone who's tastebuds we trust, and despite the hype, were even more blown away than we expected.  The food here was super fresh and the pasta was incredible. The meat-stuffed Tortellini damn near blew my mind.  We'll definitely be back next time we're in San Fran.

B1qjqUrDcfMrJV9KoQCN5w.review_text: Had dinner here before hitting Beach Blanket Babylon. Entrance to the place is cute, looks like you're walking into an alleyway that's also a covered garden. Inside decor is a little kitschy, exposed wood beams and weird garden-y stone sculptures. Kind of reminded me of the Madonna Inn, if you've ever been there.  Piano player was good but we thought about hijacking the piano because the tunes left something to be desired...a little Journey would have livened things right up!   Food was fast and pretty good! I had cappelini pomodoro and other than having to maneuver my way around the GIANT cloves of garlic in it, I enjoyed it. Since there were 5 of us, we split the check 5 ways evenly, and everyone paid $30 total - which included entree, cocktail AND tip. Very budget friendly.  All in all, a good experience!

d02FlXauQLas1QbkJ84pUg.review_text: Great dinner spot for a group.   Enjoyed the garlic fries and antipasto platter. Ingredients were quality and in season. Could have used more gluten free entree options, but I just had a couple apps instead.

lNSkba_B8yrvpEuHAi7mXw.review_text: Food was 3 1/2 to 4.  However, the fact that we were able to get a table within 15-20 minutes of arriving on a Saturday night (showing up after every other North Beach restaurant had at least a 2 hour wait) is definitely worth a 1/2 star, if not more.  Don't think this was the case because the restaurant was empty and unpopular.  They are just very effective at moving people in and out without making you feel like you need to rush.  Overall, the staff was very friendly, but nothing was super amazing.  That said, it is a good time if you are with good people (isn't that usually the case??).  I would give it a whirl.

7tEUgFoRzy_TkOgzPQzCkA.review_text: I'm a fan of this restaurant.  You can always get in and they have a lot of variety on the menu.  Pricing is a little lower than average and they have many inexpensive bottled wine choices.    I've never had a bad experience and always receive above average service.  Yes, there are fancier Italian eateries in North Beach that you could go to, but if you want a sure-thing on a budget, Bocce's your place.

gHEctn7SjnPDztr_KEaKvA.review_text: We went to Cafe Bocce during the North Beach Festival as an escape from the crowd.   It's in a great location right off of Grant Street. The restaurant itself is large and looks nice enough. Their outside patio is very cute and charming with great sun during the day.   The service was nothing memorable.   We had a Caprese salad to start. It was bland, and didn't taste fresh. I had the Gnocchi in the Napolitana Cream sauce. Gnocchi are my all time favorite, and I have them everywhere. The sauce was tasty, but the Gnocchi were awful. They were so mushy and doughy that I could barely pick them up with a fork. My boyfriend had the Meatball sandwich. He didn't have much to say about it.   Aside from the restaurant and patio, overall, I would say the food was mediocre to poor from this experience.

DUhm_I_Pw2RrR43haFfseA.review_text: Phenominal food. Live music. Ciappino was Delish!!!

70RE_TQRHWJNQkdaWnPgoA.review_text: This place is great for large parties, but not so great for a romantic dinner.  A good place to take a family or go for a birthday or something.  Food is pretty good, and the prices are fair.  It gets pretty loud and crowded on the weekends.

x8K1ynWiL5z627ZykSGn6A.review_text: Eh. It's definitely cheesy and I definitely felt like a tourist. The food was ok, the service was slow and indifferent. That's not a good combination.   We had the defrosted and then fried mozzarella sticks (too many drinks = bad judgment) and the eggplant pizza. The pizza was ok. Just ok. Not craveworthy, but then again, doesn't seem like any pizza in SF is.   I also have a major issue with a place that is named Bocce, brags about its patio, but doesn't actually have a bocce court. At least not that I could see. I got excited about nothing!  The words "Let's go to Bocce!" will never come out of my mouth, but I won't throw a fit if someone insists on going here. But I will reconsider the friendship.

kZzwW0hGHZo00PS2gWFmYA.review_text: This place is nice and big...good for accommodating big parties.  That was the reason why my friends and I went here twice both during the holiday times.  Both times this place did not wow me at all.  The food was just mediocre...thinking that this place is in North Beach with soooo many different choices of italian cuisine to choose from that it will at least be at par...??

CoR4kuL55yL-38WXncSwpA.review_text: on our quest for finding a great italian restaurant we decided to try bocce cafe.  the restaurant itself is kind of interesting, tucked away down a alley & entering a large lofty building.  we had made reservations of a patio table, which we had to wait for on our arrival.  well, the food is nothing special, its just okay.  is was not tasty as some of the places we had previous dined at.  the service was abit slow & unattentive.  the prices are kind of high for what you are getting.  i had ordered the cioppino & my wife had ordered a pasta dish.  neither of us were over impressed with the food.  we left feeling unfulfilled & hungry.    overall, the experience was okay, nothing majorly special about the restaurant or the food.  service was slow & unattentive.  the prices are abit high in comparison to the quality of the food.  parking is pretty horrible during any time of day, best to park in one of the near by parking lots & walk up.

LSx5kjDC73vC8cmHHyCa7Q.review_text: Bocce Cafe was a favorite of mine in the early 90's.  I rediscovered it last night with a large group of birthday revelers.  What a treat and what a terrific value ... also one of the most comfortable restaurants in North Beach.  I had the eggplant/kalamata/marinara rigatoni--simply divine and a mere $9.95.  Shared a well-sculpted prosciutto-melone as well.  Meanwhile the Friday night jazz trio provided an impeccable soundtrack.  Bocce easily rises to the top of my casual Italian dining list.
