5Tc0YXgYDvTTlps0e8xTNg.review_text: Okay so this place should really get 3 stars based on the food but my friends and I made complete and utter assholes of ourselves here yesterday and so they deserve the full 5 stars.  The food wasn't great; it was okay at best.  The service was great though.  My friend Jared after pompously ordering a drink for our friend Nez actually apologized to the waiter by saying "Hey man, sorry if I sounded like an asshole because I am."  Then we proceeded to get SHITTY drunk at 4pm on this idle Monday because we were celebrating our friend's release from INS hell.  Highlights include me screaming at Jared that he's a fuckhead, much to the overlooked tourist couple behind us's chagrin.  Jared spewing wine across the patio and then going over to the tourist couple's table to offer them some of our wine.  Ohhhh...the WORST behavior I think I've EVER exhibited in broad daylight.  So if you want to get away with that...come here.  I'm too embarrassed to ever go back.

pPDnLdtSbD-qdplEh7Y4uw.review_text: My all time favorite place for dinner in North Beach-- super affordable food and valet parking. The Gamberi Salad is delicious. Huge patio and live music also make for a good date spot.

NM8xzqVmP3GcLuc2_INvXQ.review_text: Great average place for Italian food.   The food is okay and service is okay.  But it is the place if you want to go to rustic Italian villa type of place.   Great for groups. Cheap too.  But don't expect too much about the food.

ySnJRrXNpbHuGYsm5mEAVA.review_text: love this place! i frequent here quite a bit and love everything on the menu!  i've even taken out of town friends here and they have really enjoyed themselves. live music nights are the best, and try to sit outside cause it's absolutely great! they have heat lamps, so don't worry.  love their food and you get a great selection and big portions...it can be somewhat expensive depending on what you are ordering and the drinks you order, but overall would recommend nonetheless.  UPDATE 11/15/08 So I formerly rated this restaurant at 4 stars, but I returned last night after a bit of a hiatus and found it to be so mediocre that I almost had to ask the waiter if I was, in fact, at Bocce or if there was some new and random restaurant in its place! I had the marinara gnocchi and found it to be blatantly the frozen-then-defrost kind. They poured Prego sauce on it and called it an Italian meal. So unfortunate. The only positive I could find about the food was the portobello mushroom appetizer, with the goat cheese, tomatoes and spinach. Absolutely gorgeous presentation and descent in taste. Otherwise, I don't think I'll return to this restaurant anytime soon.

UI1LI2GRG_K3p-Cr--NuRw.review_text: Came here with the coworkers for a very belated birthday dinner.  There wasn't much to choose from on the menu but I did get lasagna. It was good but there was a bit too much sauce. It wasn't the type of lasagna that I wasn't used to.  The restaurant is beautiful inside, and when you're going into the restaurant from outside, it looks like you're entering a forest.

VIsIWxUjxwm8Nydz7WoX6Q.review_text: Mmm mmm. I can't get enough of this place. My college friends and I discovered this place two and a half decades ago (it helped that someone knew one of the cooks back then). And I'm still coming here. It might be a bit noisy sometimes on the weekends, with the live music and the crowds; but, what a great place to go and lounge around on the couch seating, just eating, drinking, and talking away the evening.

_g39TigHROtYXL2ODJCdGA.review_text: My friend and I happened upon this place and were pleasantly surprised. Located next to one of my favorite pizza places in North Beach, Bocce Cafe was the right price and had great service. We shared the vegetarian "tour of Italy" (vegetarian is not on the menu, but the waiter was happy to oblige). For a measly 22$ we were brought out an aromatic white platter filled with 2 heaps each of vegetarian lasagne, fettuccini alfredo, pesto ravioli, gnocchi in a creamy tomato sauce and eggplant parmasean. Granted, these were not the most adventuresome offerings the restaurant had but how could I complain? For only 11$ each I got to try all of the above dishes in a quaint patio setting (sans people grazing by my plate on Columbus). The hits were the pesto ravioli, and the vegetarian lasagne. Misses were the eggplant (too many layers of eggplant, too eggy) and the gnocchi was a bit pasty. Other than that, this place was good eats on the cheap. I will definately be back.

xpRAjmgL-pIcIY_9iOpcQw.review_text:
Quite possibly the worst Italian food I've ever had.  Hell, quite probably.  Possibly the worst meal I've ever had served by a waiter.
  To quote the 1998 Zagat:
  "Terrible food and lots of it" 
  "inexpensive, but should be free."

xUdatc17gX7Kd3G4h2n3MA.review_text: Bocca, bocca, bocca. I thought you were the one. You looked great when I first saw you. You played hard to get by making me wait, and teased me with your rum drinks at the bar. When you finally let me in you really got me worked up by sitting me outside directly next to the heater. There was laughter, winks, conversation, and toasty buns. Things were going great.   Now you decide to throw it all away. You don't serve the rum drinks to tables despite being made at the same bar. Can you say bait and switch? You realize you didn't plan the seating correctly despite everyone having reservations. You move us by the open door and attack us with the door flap repeatedly. Our buns freeze! You smile as we grimace to the delusional karaoke singer barfing through the speaker directly above our table. I won't even start on the horrible salmon fettuccine marinara.  Lose my number Bocca. Don't even think about drunk texting me. I'll put it on facebook. I will!

1uUe0qjOvaV_QbcD-3KWAg.review_text: I dined this establishment recently on a Saturday with a group of friends.  I had high HIGH hopes for this place (this was my first visit) as I love North Beach and I have several haunts that have a special place in my heart.  I was eagerly awaiting my experience as we walked through the ivy-clad pathway to get to the front door......and then things changed when we got inside .  We checked in with the hostess, and was seated shortly thereafter at a table not far from the door (which was fine as we were waiting for two more guests)  However, this place gets busy, and this area gets very congested with people waiting for their tables.  Our server was sweet enough, but for an evening out on the town, I would like a server who is a little more polished, whereas if I was at Denny's, the server would have been fine.  One thing about this place-they want to get you in and out!  The server checked back several times ( we wanted to chat awhile) ever so slightly frustrated that we weren't placing our order as of yet.  We did, however, place an order for Bruchetta for the table.  This was not a good interpretation for this popular appetizer.  It was stale toast with a type of stewed tomato mixture on top that can be purchased at any Safeway or Trader Joe's.  One of my table guest actually had his bread plate cleared before he could sample the Bruchetta!  A testament to their wanting to get us in and out.    My entree was Ravioli.  For anyone who knows me, ravioli is on the shortlist for my last meal on earth.  The sausage they used had no zing, nor could I taste the nuances of the cheeses they used.  The sauce, perhaps the most important part, was nothing special either.  The $18.00 + price was too high for what I got on my plate.  I tasted the seafood canneloni someone in the party ordered.  It was a mixture of finely chopped seafood, which was sooooo finely chopped, you could not tell what kind of seafood it was!!!  All in all, the food was just ok.  It's what I would expect at Macaroni Grill, but not on Green Street in the heart of North Beach.  Oh how I miss the Gold Spike and Dante Benedetti's New Pisa!

li0Hwxz08hpK81Z7eH1YvA.user_location: North Beach/Telegraph Hill, San Francisco, CA
li0Hwxz08hpK81Z7eH1YvA.review_text: Sorry, no not good. The atmosphere isn't that bad I guess... feels a little out of place like it should be in Tahoe or something. Live music is always good. But the food isn't very good or authentic.

cHiKdJkqz6HI0cuVxtW1dQ.review_text: I tried this little place with some friends and had a very satisfying meal.  The entrance is a long shaded path that leads to the front door...very romantic.  The indoors part of the restaurant was warm and rustic with a log-cabin-type charm.  The outdoor patio was my favorite part, which is where we ate.  They have big tables for larger groups and small intimate spots for two.  We enjoyed the antipasto and a variety of dishes that were all traditional in preparation and all very good.

TLzwLBhPoO33w85VOXz97g.review_text: This place is very special for me. I think I am NBL, North Beach Lover. I like every thing about NB. Include Chinatown and Stockton Street. I think that Stockton St is hard-core Chinatown more than anywhere else in the city. I still get such a kick out of walking around there especially Stockton Street meets Columbus and Green. The intersection is like black bean sauce meets tomato sauce, east meets west, noodle meets pasta, local meets out of townners.  But, traditional NB dining must be Italian. In my mind, North Beach=Italian Food. I don't feel eating anything else but Italian when I am in NB.  Bocce Cafe is one of our early date spot.  I haven't been here for a while, but, .... did not changed very much. You know, what I like about NB is that, .... easy going, stay as long as you want, just talk and hang out kind of attitude. It's not just food. The whole atmosphere.  And this is very typical NB place.  We got pretty ordinary menu as: Carpaccio Fried Calamari Pizza Gnocchi  Beef meat ball  a bottle of red, forgot the name, i think it was $30.  Those were very good, one of our guest ordered steamed vegetable which is just broccoli and carrot, very simple, but it wasn't over cooked, and nicely dressing w/ olive oil and vinegar that I really liked it.  I think it is easy to forget about simple things seem that it is not such a big of deal kind of things. I think the place is under-rated because most food here are not a big deal food. That's what I like about Italian food.  There was a jazz trio on when we were there Saturday night. We had a great time.

LOi1qbpl2hTP0cwSDDuyBQ.review_text: Many years ago this was the Old Spaghetti Factory. It's huge and can accommodate large parties. We ate here last night on NYE.  Ten of us.  Service was efficient but not attentive.   We started with two platters of the antipasti platters.  Fine, but I wouldn't necessarily order.  No shout outs.  I  had a cup of minestrone soup which I enjoyed. No Lima beans.  Yea!  I ordered a pasta dish.  Penne with meat sauce.   It was o.k.  We left without ordering coffee or dessert as we wanted to get to our NYE party down at the Wharf.  Prices are reasonable and food is decent so if you've got a large party, consider this place.  $62 per couple.  Didn't feel like I ate $31 myself but that's what happens when you go with a large group. You subsidize other people.

91Mo2-qrDaZsFC2zM8Yuqw.review_text: Recommended Dish: Combination for Two. Parking may not be easy to find but this restaurant is great for large groups. Make sure to have reservations for the weekends especially with large groups, otherwise your wait is most likely going to be close 1-2 hours, even with small groups of 2 or 4. This restaurant has the best gnocchi I have ever tasted--a perfect combination of chewiness and cream sauce. If you go to this restaurant be prepared to leave in a wheelbarrow--their portions for the combination for two will make you loosen your belt. Considering the location, its atmosphere, and its food, the price isn't bad!

ahLv2f0jY7tGg3RAfneYcQ.review_text: I'd forgotten how much I liked Italian food until I came to Bocce Cafe. A group of us came here for dinner before going to see Beach Blanket Babylon a couple of blocks away, and it was a good choice. For starters we ordered the calamari and the mussels, and they were both very tasty. I killed the mussels practically by myself, and I slurped every drop of broth that came with it; at least, every drop that I could get on to my spoon. If I could have, I probably would have slurped the broth straight from the pot! But my mama taught me better, unfortunately. For our entrees we tried their ribeye steak, meat lasagna, and linguine with salmon in pesto sauce, and they were also all delicious. I particularly liked the steak and the lasagna, and would definitely order those again when I come back here.   The only thing I would ding them on would be the server we had that night.  She left us alone for way too long when we were deciding on our entrees, and we finally had to flag a busboy to get her so we could place our orders.  But, the kitchen more than made up for her slack because the food came out pretty darn quick.  Hmmm, should that make me suspicious?  Did you guys just microwave our food?  The restaurant was pretty dead when my group and I arrived, and that scared me into thinking that perhaps it was dead for a reason (i.e. it's not good), but it filled up by the time we left around 7:30 pm.  I guess Italians dine a little late?  Anyway, the bill for the 4 of us came to a little over $100 plus tip, which I thought was pretty reasonable.  All in all, I would definitely consider coming back to Bocce Cafe on those days when I'm not trying to watch my figure. And who am I kidding? The days I try to watch my figure are, sadly, few and far between.

KcEfVfc5nTPBDonYjJ3wOw.review_text: After a long day of shopping, I came to Bocce Cafe with two of my friends.  It was an awkward entrance but an even more awkward time to dine here. The restaurant was completely empty except for the 3 of us gals.  If I remember correctly, I ordered the chicken parmigiana, my friend ordered a pasta with pesto and one more that has slipped my mind. The food was pretty good, I thoroughly enjoyed my friend's pesto pasta.  The wait staff was kind and friendly and the interior decor was very enticing. I would come back a second time.

UvRUygcyvpJuHh1BiZrrbQ.review_text: Went here on Friday night with friends and the boy. The food was good but it wasn't incredible enough that I would go back or recommend to anyone. I ordered the veal it was breaded had capers and a lemon sauce. It was just TOOO lemon based. All you can taste was sour lemon. The veggies were fine nothing special and the wine bottle was cheap for a Malbec which was surprising. The dessert Flanish type was horrible. It had nutmeg in it which I hate.  Overall, I guess if you don't wanna spend a lot and you have a large group go here.   If you aren't too sophisticated and arent a foodies than go here.

QKhJkTpDuwnR6TozGT1eqg.review_text: This is a top pick for restaurants in North Beach.  I've been here only three times, but I've been won over. Really nice ambiance - only a little room for improvement ::coughcoughPATIOcough::  but it still is really nice throughout.  The food is delicious, service is good.  They don't have the cheapest food, or the largest portions, but they found the sweet spot in between. It definitely gets crowded on Friday/Saturday nights, but if you get there early (~6pm) it's not bad at all.  The key area where it failed the 5th star is parking.  I don't mind driving around looking for parking, but my fiancée can't stand it - and it doesn't really do any good in North Beach anyway - street parking is non-existent on weekends.  So you have to pay for the valet.  $10.  Plus tip.  It could be worse.  But it could be better.  So it *almost* gets 5 stars.

1x4WFy2H7RN299qNTw6l_w.review_text: I have been here about 4 or 5 times now.  The food has never really impressed me, but the ambiance is what makes this place worth coming back for.    It is not to say the food is bad, it isn't.  It is just as others have said, ..nothing really special.

MIDv5jrDZc3ePwLbRXE3Jw.review_text: 3.5 stars.  My boyfriend and I came here for a late dinner around 9. The place was really nice to my surprise! They have nice indoor seating or patio seating. We reserved a table which was kinda close to the door. The waiter was kind enough to switch our table so I wouldn't get too cold from the wind!   The food was good, but not great. My boyfriend ordered the meat lasagna while I ordered the tortellini stuffed with meat. The dishes were decent but not overly delicious. I guess we had high expectations.   I would recommend this place for a causal dining. I like the atmosphere, friendly service, and decent food.

eL6bC4fHezCj1-yBT5QDpA.review_text: We arranged for a pre wedding gathering at Bocce cafe and it was just wonderful!  The manager was knowledgeable, professional and very helpful with guiding me to the correct choices for food and drinks.  Bocce has a wonderful patio with an enclosed space we used for 60 guests and it was the perfect spot.   All of our guests had room to mingle and sit if they wished.  We served delicious appetizers and pizza that were all rave about.  The servers were very responsive with bringing out more food as we needed it and bringing additional bottles of wine.   Bocce cafe was very flexible with the time.... we had reserved 4-6 but spilled well over into 7 without a problem. The cafe is located in the beautiful North Beach area, the cost was very reasonable and the food remarkable.  I would highly recommend this place for a group gathering and certainly for a simple dinner out!

y_-9AdXtE5gQyakspOVkwQ.review_text: Went to Bocce last night for a girl's night and it was great fun! The owner was very attentive to our needs as was our waiter. They were happy for us to spend 2.5 hours eating dinner with no pressure to leave. I had the goats cheese salad which was delicious followed by the meat lasagne. The lasagne was cooked perfectly and the sauce was delicious!. They had a jazz band playing which aded to the atmosphere for the night. Overall, an enjoyable experince and we will be back!

8ilYdOcteBu4Hoa0veVNpA.review_text: I want to give 3.5 stars  Hard to find, but really interesting place.   When you walk in, it's like you're leaving the city and into italy. Huge open restaurant with super high ceilings. Wow, and they have a very nice outdoor seating area too. This place seems really old though..   Place would be amazing for groups.   Food was pretty good. I liked the calamari and the shrimp pizza the best. Also had pasta with pesto and that was good too.   Service was okay, nothing special.   They seem pretty empty though so if you don't want to wait, this place would be great.

QNBtqkCqiy7jIsIoLiY0yw.review_text: It was wonderful we went around 5 on a Wednesday and there was hardly anyone there so our service was excellent! I ordered linguine with clams my only complaint was It was a little small though it was very garlicy and delicious!

YbZg36FoMgkKcTEPae5siA.review_text: Decent food at a decent price.  I've gone here a few times with a reasonably sized party. Both times, we were seated pretty quickly. It's a bit of a trek from Russian Hill, but totally worth it. I had penne pasta and a goat cheese salad.  Definitely a good, hearty meal.

3XChzdVSI4aoXjr8YTx_KA.review_text: I'm going to give this place the benefit of the doubt, since it's in my neighborhood and I love the patio seating, but this was my worst experience at a restaurant here in SF.  We had an appetizer of carpaccio, which I love, but it made me seriously sick.  No biggie, that happens.  What I couldn't stand though, was the table of yuppies that let their hellion children run through the restaurant, around our table, screaming their heads off, while management did nothing. That hasn't happened at any other restaurant here, which doesn't exactly make me want to go back to Bocce.  Management that ignores this kind of behavior doesn't entice me to come back.  If I hadn't been so hungry, I'd have gotten up and stormed out, and from the looks of things, most of the other diners felt the same way.

NkVYcoaThHjOfTTgq6OdHQ.review_text: i first came here about 5 years ago for a company X-mas party and i have always like this restaurant! they have a pretty outdoor patio section and also a nice long bar inside if you're just stopping in for drinks. the food is good solid italian fare and not too expensive. i used to come in here a lot to get take out when i lived in north beach. a nice romantic place for a date too!

fojptcVycoRhrLUU7XSSNg.review_text: Exactly what every other Yelper said, 'great for get togethers."  My friends and I made a reservation for a party of 12 as a birthday dinner.  The place gets pretty packed for the inside seatings, so I'd recommend making a reservation in advance if you want to sit inside close to the live music.  Food is good, better than Johnny Curinos.    The parking is valet, so bring a few extra bucks for tips.

hAw6oI0VDiV5DokJL9-pNg.review_text: My family of 3 stopped in for an afternoon snack, yet were treated like $$$$ customers.  One coke,  2 waters...We shared a large Ceasar salad- delicious, with thin SLICES of parmasan- wow-and we couldn't finish it.  We noticed Gnocci on the menu, (little dumplings made from potato) with 3 sauce options:  Napolitani (light red sauce), a creme sauce, and pesto.  We asked if the chef could do a Gargonzola sauce, as we loved this cheesy sauce on our Italy trip last summer.  Our server asked & brought back a "Yes" answer, (mentioning that it would be a few dollars extra because of the cheese required) and also brought a loaf of incredible bread with dipping sauce.  The Gnocci arrived and it was even more awesome than the salad and bread. The bill came to just $32!!!  We will return!

aNHWwrDXZ_HqkkHXtomO8w.review_text: I went here for the second time this weekend and again I wasn't impressed. The first time I went here I found that the pasta lacked flavor and was under cooked. This weekend I went for a friend's birthday dinner. It took the waiter almost 40 minutes to take our order. Again the food was sub par. Not recommended. There are so many other better restaurant options!

jLUEHlRuGxobG44LcHLabA.review_text: Ordered delivery and was given a time quote of 45 minutes to an hour. Two hours and three phone calls later, my food showed up cold, soggy, and unappetizing. Garlic fries were terrible and the "marinated" olives were shriveled. The Caesar salad was wilted and drenched in dressing. On my third call to see where my food was, I asked for a refund and they told me to tell the delivery guy, even though they had already charged my credit card. Will never order from here again.

gAwoOE_6TajZqpjOldGSIg.review_text: What happened here? I used to bring large groups all the time, or went with friends to enjoy the patio on a nice afternoon. Food was always OK and very inexpensive. The little secret corridor you walk through always delights first timers and feels like a little secret place.  Recently, I brought a work party of 6 for lunch and was really disappointed. First, there were only two tables going in the whole place. The lights were mostly off and on a rainy January day, it was really depressing. How about  floor lamp or something? It was also FREEZING and smelled weird. Any chance for some heat in this huge open space? We were chattering with cold.  Worst part: the service was really slow. The waiter was really nice, but it took FOREVER for our any food to come out and we waited a long time between courses. What was the chef doing back there?  Maybe this is not a good part of town to come for lunch anymore, or maybe the recession is hitting hard, but it's sad to sit virtually alone in a huge dank restaurant and feel good about the experience. Worst part: one person in our party was from the Midwest. She is the type to look for chain restaurants in the greatest dining city in the US (she even went to McDonalds  on her first day in town- gasp) and I could tell she hated her meal and was thinking Olive Garden could do better. For shame!

XijcmeHr-8gcM8JSebzj9Q.review_text: This is the second time I have been to Bocce Cafe. The first was lunch with my daughter a few years ago. Hubby and I were up in City for a date weekend and I remembered it as being pretty good plus it had a lovely patio.   I would give Bocce 3.5 stars. When we came in there were no tables outside but they gladly sat us inside at a nice table so we could order drinks and an app. All good - had the melon and prosciutto (excuse the spelling). We did not have that long of a wait till an outside table opened up and we moved. Still all good.   Then we waited...and waited...and waited...and..finally the waiter shows up. Takes our order and puts down the most pathetic excuse for bread I have ever had. Did they go to Safeway to get this?? And bad bread in North Beach in SF is just inexcusable.   So now we wait and wait some more. Hubby ordered the Cesar salad and it finally came. Was very good! Then we waited..and waited.. - this was ridiculous. I don't mind a relaxing meal but this was beyond slow. Plus they just let the dirty dishes sit there. Finally, the entrees come (veal for hubby and the crab stuffed ravioli for me). Entrees were very good but sauce on mine was too heavy. Basically drowned out the dish.   We finished our dinner, the waiter finally shows up again, takes the dishes and...wait for it.... hands us the check! No offer of coffee/tea, does not try to sell us dessert, nada. My husband i(s a serious coffee addict) asks if he can have an espresso. I guess this waiter was never taught to up sell. So we wait for that. Finally we are done!   Net: food was OK, atmosphere is wonderful, live music with good band too. Please go out and buy good break - really!   Service: we know the service was good for other tables because we observed other people receiving it. I think we just caught a dud. I think we would come back here for lunch but perhaps not for dinner.

legEZzXG28Hy0ikwMnOLzQ.review_text: Interesting old school Italian spot in North Beach.  Wonderful service & food. HUGE space especially compared to most of the other places on Green, but you don't know it until after heading down a long walkway & reaching the entrance near the back. Looks small from out front.  Decor is unique... mostly sofas & chairs surrounding tables. Very large open dining room/bar area + a patio out back beyond this.  Doesn't get the foot traffic that the other joints further down Green do, but this is a very good option.

eA7nRFfEfkbI0h1c6MbaIA.review_text: We went here for my 50th birthday then on to Club Fugasi.  WOW _ dinner was so good my husband wants to come back here for our anniversary.  He never wants to go to the same place twice.  Food was fabulous, don't let the very affordable prices fool you.

C3F0KQ-vh_5dU3uSM4OmkQ.review_text: GOOD: Good Food Good Price Outdoor seating Live Music (some nights) Valet Parking  BAD: Long Wait Over Crowded Bar (over flowing into dinning room) Can be very noisy

b1Iu7lgKqMB6i-6-bXjmfQ.review_text: We've been a few times - so maybe this time it was an off night. The service was extremely slow and not very good. One of our meals was sent back because it "didn't taste right"

seorMT4O-MaOTZ6n1WVyyQ.review_text: I would have missed this place if it wasn't for a friend's recommendation. We went as a group of about 40 to celebrate my husband's and his best friend's birthday. I must say, for that many people, service speed was good and the food was really tastey! Especially the bread!! My only complaint was that it got awfully loud with the music and a full restaurant of people trying to talk to one another - I felt like I was yelling by the end of the evening. I would, however, go back.

QETT2YHMDtMvW6HRlNX0Ng.review_text: This is the best spot to go for a large group for sure! The food is decent and definitely well priced and its in a good location if you want to hit up some North Beach Bars after...  And the drinks are cheap so drink up before going out!  The angel hair pasta was pretty good (I added feta which truly enhanced my eating experience) but I dont suggest the manicotti- not great at all...

ZVxh68z6aqdjPAeRFaj5qw.review_text: You can check my blog on customer service:  tlbooey.wordpress.com/20… Overall, food was good!  Portions HUGE.  The place is super cute with a quaint and cozy interior.  I had the daily special of chicken breast - it was yumms!  I nibbled on the garlic bread and that was pretty good.  It wasn't SUPERIOR, but it was good.  I'll be back for sure.

SQ8z2PehILAO1sHdMfXEew.review_text: Bocce Cafe is a real find in an bustling area with fierce competition for Italian restaurants.   You might have to drive around to look for parking, but the dependable food and reasonable prices will make up for your troubles.  I was pleased with my Caesar salad and Penne with Vodka sauce, served with salmon. The gnocci my friend ordered was the real star. Perfect texture and consistency. Next time I'll order that.  Two other friends ordered spinach ravioli which I found to be just OK. We enjoyed their wine selection too, and literally closed the place down.  All in all, a great choice for affordable Italian food.

b8n3Oc_zTAvME4b0VkSsmw.review_text: Look at me go with all these back-to-back five star reviews. Guess I'm just a lover, and this Bocce Cafe joint is certainly a place for lovers. SO ROMANTICAL. The enchanted forest princess pathway entrance, delicious food and Tiziano chianti are just few of many reasons why Bocce Cafe just got added to my Ti Amo, North Beach! list. Yeah, it ain't no secret I'm a fan of this hood, and neon naked girl signs and drunks getting stoned in the street only add to my affinity for all things NB.   So after we found street parking like a pro, we made our way down this cute little back alley and found ourselves at the entrance of Bocce Cafe around the corner, all vine-covered walls, sparkly lights and trees. Like I said, enchanted forest fantasy land over here. Upon arriving inside, we hesitated at the door wondering if they were closed. "What time is it, anyway?" I remember PC asking, because the place was pretty much dead. DEAD. That's right, ALL CAPS dead. There were seriously only two other people dining inside and it was only a little past 8. I blame the economy for the emptiness, because it sure as hell had nothing to do with the service or the food. As soon as we sat down -- at a lovely table near the patio, where there were also twinkly lights decorating the outside (big fan of the xmas lights) -- we got warm bread from our equally warm waiter. Seriously, the guy had such a friendly, respectful demeanor and was quick to bring our wine, which was filled to brim by the way. No dinky half-filled glass so you can swirl it around bullshit here. My dad owned an Italian restaurant in Oakland back in the day and always said the key to their success was in the waiters and the wine. Treat the guests like royalty. Bravo! That's how it should be, am I wrong? Never. So out came our appetizer, the bruschetta, which I barely touched because I was so busy yapping away, but I do remember the few bites I had of it were fabuloso. I ordered the ravioli in meat sauce and my manfriend ordered the linguine with clams. My ravioli was tender and the meat sauce was meaty. What more can you ask for outta ravioli -- tender, meaty, heaven. I didn't try the boy's linguine, but I'm assuming he enjoyed it since he finished his entire bowl. I was waiting for him to pick up the plate and lick it clean, which I would've loved because nothing is more heartwarming than watching someone thoroughly enjoy their first real meal after a long day. Me? I barely ate half my ravioli because I couldn't get enough of that Tiziano! I love good Tuscan vino and this Sangiovese-based red wine really hit the spot. Like really. A LOT. Ha! Something about the spirit of Tiziano Vecellio and a beautiful autumn night in North Beach. What more can you ask of life but for the sun amidst small stars. That, my yelp friends, is a quote straight from Vicellio himself. Yea, I bring the knowledge. Best wreck.

zDltf7SGyDANcA6ndZkF7A.review_text: I rediscovered Bocce Cafe after years of forgetting about its existence. I had a vague recollection of this amazing little restaurant set back in off the street with a cozy inside but it had been so long since I'd been there, I completely forgot the name and thus, it slipped from my memory.  Well, that changed when I was given a recommendation by somebody to visit here and I was catapulted back, remember what a great time I had once had there. Unfortunately this time around was not quite the same experience.  service was piss poor. We had what felt like 4 people waiting on us and thus, had no idea what the hell was going on; we ordered a round of drinks which we didn't receive and had to ask a few people before we finally got the person who had taken the drink order. She had forgotten about it.    I ordered the vegetarian lasagna and to be perfectly honest, was bitterly disappointed. The sauce had this weird kick to it. It tasted like it should have been poored over a burrito rather than pasta.  I don't know if my memory is not serving me correctly or if this place has gone down hill, either way it wasn't what I'd call, "repeat worthy."

8lYiVXc09_0EVpTJWVgmVA.review_text: Great option for  large parties - this is where we had our rehearsal dinner.  We wanted to place that was large enough to fit everyone, but with a fun, chill atmosphere!  It's a great place for loud, crazy family members and friends (which was the case for our wedding)  :-)  The food was not THAT memorable, although that was the LAST thing I was concerned with that evening!  But the overall experience deserves at least 4 stars.

JUJ8jVLcjbCK5FRGfyxXrg.review_text: I went to Bocce last night for a company dinner. This place was ideal because it was spacious and had long tables to accommodate our party of 12. IF I had not come with a big party I would be complaining about our service. The waiter was pretty quick to take our order for appetizers and drinks but when it came to ordering our entrees it felt like forever. Fortunately, the appetizers and good conversations held me over.  I was disappointed when I got my entree. I got the monacatti (it's like a vegetarian italian burrito) Why did I listen to the waiter? Never listen to the waiter! there's always someone in the background telling them to push certain items. That or my waiter had really bad taste. He said the monacatti was his faavorite dish. Hmm.. So anyways, I pushed the dish aside and mooched off my coworkers spaghetti and meat ball which was much more satisfying. All the entrees were $15+. It's a good deal because of its portion, but all the dishes seem to lack in flavor.  Overall this place is mediocre in food and customer service,  but it's good for big groups.

WO4ojAvstSzj7cQ42nV-Yg.review_text: Although this place is very cute, has live music, and is good at seating large parties,  it has TERRIBLE food.  Even though it is reasonably priced, I'm not sure that I would come back and eat here. I'd rather spend the extra couple bucks and eat at any of the other fabulous Italian places in North Beach. I've eaten here twice, and it just got worse each time. No one i was with even came close to finishing their meal and it definitely was not worth the $.

0zA3iSAgSPz55GOBXpn63Q.review_text: Walking around North Beach on a mid-day Friday, we avoided the crowds by selecting this Bocce Cafe for lunch. We had the place all to ourselves! A party of 4 ahead of us actually left without being seated because they thought there was something wrong with a N. Beach restaurant without a crowd.  We scored a lovely, sunny table outdoors with a friendly cat alongside. The server was attentive, but not interruptive. We had two salads: Insalata Gamberi (grilled, marinated prawns; feta; organic greens), in which I substituted Caesar dressing for the olive oil; also, the Spinach Salad (not the warm one w/shallots), which had bacon, apple, and bleu cheese, for which we asked for additional oil and vinegar. Ample warm bread with lots of side dishes of whole garlic cloves in dipping oil w/Balsamic.  It was a perfect lunch, very quiet!  Why not 5 stars? Inside the restaurant, if you don't see the patio, it was dark and kind of cold-seeming. We had already walked down the alleyway and seen the patio out back, so we knew something those folks didn't know who left prematurely: The patio is the seller here. I think the interior decorations could be "warmer", and the entire establishment more inviting from the entrance to the alleyway on Green Street. Restaurants in North Beach have a lot of competition (Caffe Sport, Fior d'Italia, and Joe's are all nearby), so putting yourself out front is really important for survival. Also, while the organic greens were much appreciated, I'll harp on this again: No excuse for not having more organics on any menu in the San Francisco Bay Area.   I completely disagree with the reviewer who assigns "suburbanites" to this location and mentions the menu rivals Olive Garden. That's cold. And we saw no "kid-friendly" indications during our very quiet and enjoyable lunch hour.

4EQSMqnhbRRMdWeGefRVag.review_text: I had read some of the not so good reviews before heading out to this place last night, so I was a little apprehensive, but I found it to be a cute little place to have a great dinner.  Our group started out with some Hefeweizen and we tried out the bruschetta.  I honestly wasn't a fan of the bruschetta....the bread was over-toasted and the basil was nearly non-existent.  We were served 3 pieces and I think we only ate 2.  Our entrees fared much better.  I personally ordered the risotto pescatore.  Creamy, plump risotto mixed in with shrimp, mussels, calamari, salmon, and clams...I thought it was a wonderful dish that blended all the various flavors of the seafood while still keeping their individual characteristics (i.e. the brinyness of the mussels, the chewy texture of the calamari).  An awesome dish and something I would definitely go back and try again.  Another plus is that you're mere blocks from a ton of bars and clubs, so it would be a good spot to hit up before going out and having some fun on Broadway.  One word of advice though....  4 Hefeweizens during dinner+ peer pressure from your dinner companions + an insanely hot Russian server who makes Anna Kournikova look like Kathy Bates = embarassing pickup attempts at the end of the night  So if you go back and have Yuliya as your server, apologize on my behalf for anything stupid I might have said...and tell her to call me!  =)

uT_J1dCJ3KQ6L_iZy0_UjA.review_text: This place is super-cheap.  $3.5 for a pint, pasta for $7, lasagna for $10.  The quality is reasonable, and the service is fine.

aIAxdHmluYYJRBOfPgv7og.review_text: Great place for simple italian food with lots of great flavors. everything on the menu is great and worth every penny

X4RmwwxpRjAkjm50DYLmoA.review_text: Okay, granted I waltzed into this place ready to upchuck due to a stomach bug...I think 3 stars can be extrapolated to mean 4 stars.  The price to portion ratio was mo-nayyyyyyyy!  It's a little secret garden-esque upon arrival and completely empty on a Sunday night (weird? no idea...), but great for our group of 6.  Highly recommend the calamari palermo (stew), and through my samplings of various pastas around the table I can say that many of them are more than edible and quite tasty.  Most notable were the cappellini pomodoro and the goat cheese ravioli with a 'shroom sauce.  MMM.  If only I ordered a main of my own I can offer more than "the minestrone soup is aite..."

uE3AW15w6qEBip4YarEpyg.review_text: Oh Bocce Cafe, let me count the ways of how I love you.  1) Love the spaghetti and meatballs 2) Love the outdoor patio in the summer 3) Love the fig tree that's in the outdoor patio 4) Love the live jazz music that they occasionally have on weekend nights 5) Love the little cat without a tail that runs around outside 6) Love that you can bring huge groups of people here with little notice during the summer time 7) (I don't love this, but my friends seem to) It's really close to one of those new age hip fro yo places to get dessert at.

qoYZ6QbVczMo3Dtyaeubhg.review_text: GOOOOOOOOALLLLL!!!! Watched the world cup here. Average food. Great garlic bread. They kept the beer flowing and had a projector screen installed for the big game. Go Italia!

p-rz5nElTuSyUV1Dzui6Yg.review_text: I thought the atmosphere felt more Latina than Roman, but the waiter was very Italian and the food was pretty tasty. I almost never order macaroni in a restaurant. Or should I say pasta, so I'm understood. I had spaghetti and meatballs and enjoyed it very much. Huge portions so be ready to get a doggy bag.  It was a work holiday party and there were 3 others between getting there and leaving there. Lots of wine and yelling and drunken whooping it up.   It was all around ok in my book and will go there next time I go to Grant and Green.

HXsmou8DbqIHNezko9A_4w.review_text: After a day of exploring San Fransisco (on foot), this was a great way to relax and fill up on great food.  We learned about it from local on the street. Ended up, this was an excellent option! Knocci melts in your mouth! Since we were there at the time of year when figs are ripe, the owner brought some of his home-grown figs to our table. Again, delicious! If in San Fransisco, this place is must.

d19VWxkXk3glukbSsE-VUw.review_text: another 3.5 star review. this place could be really great, if only the food could live up to the great atmosphere. Still, even if you don't get the best chicken marsala here, it is still a good place for groups, especially if it is nice out and you get the patio. I've taken out-of-towners here before who have been totally wowed, but you can only do that with people who are used to Italian food by way of the Olive Garden. If you are trying to wow a date, maybe chose some place with slightly better food and a little more intimate setting.

ixYLMqLBLo4tfcuQ-ewk9g.review_text: Go for the outdoor patio and reasonable priced beer, but don't go for the food.  While a sub-$10 plate of pasta is a good deal in North Beach, I could do better with pasta and a jar of sauce from Safeway.

2_cvh63d0CM33n1cP-3YZA.review_text: Bocce is my favorite place for Italian in North Beach because its not super expensive and its delicious. The only problem is that the service is very hit or miss. The first two times I went it was perfect, but the second time we ended up waiting 30 minutes just to get some bread, and another hour for our food.   The most recent time I went was for a large party and we had reserved space for 30. They sat us one table at a time (there were three in the same area) and then ended up making us all squeeze into two because they didn't give enough time for the third table to finish. I think their wait staff/kitchen need a little bit more training, but if you're OK with the possibilty of waiting a while the food is delicious.

ImnTunkFy436QwrK6Ry6rg.review_text: Mediocre Italian food. The bread could have been served at any other type of restaurant and the bread served with our bruschetta was burnt. The margarita pizza was not authentic Italian and the ingredients were not fresh, but it was still decent. I imagine the pasta dishes are better. The ambiance is great, and so is the service.

NlwU5lEqEEiibiK8HTmpLg.review_text: Every year (for the last four years) I have set up the party for our group of @100 to have lunch and a presentation here.  Every year, Ramon is soooo helpful.  We usually get a variety of appetizers (the calamari is totally killer) and then select three entrees from which each person in the group can pick, all of which have been excellent.  We've had vegetarian lasagna, chicken parmigiana, grilled salmon, cioppino, grilled steak, and pizza.  In fact, it's because of the pizza I can't give Bocce five stars -- they never let me know that they had a limited number of pizza ovens, so for a lunch that started at 1:00 and should have ended at 4:00 with dessert, pizzas were still coming out of the oven!  I totally forgive them because everything else is so great -- the staff is wonderful and the drinks are great.  The bar has a fine selection of top shelf alcohol.

UgsglZydc-zFWL0aP4xRSA.review_text: Bad night for Bocce!  Used to like this little neighborhood gem but popularity has gone to their head!  Over booking a problem!  We arrived at 7:50 for 8pm reservation -  told it would be 15 miunutes - made way to bar to get drinks - checked back in at 8:15- only thing the hostess would tell me is that it seems people are lingering longer than usual and had no idea when we would be seated - waited 45 minutes......walked out at 8:35. Never to return in the immediate future!

epLJZbpPFmnZi-xduMzKZg.review_text: Outdoor was closed off, so our huge group of 35 couldn't see outside. But I didn't need to go outside to know that Bocce is magical. We had a huge three tables set up with our own menu that immediately when I sat down saw what I wanted Chicken Parmigiana with prosciutto, mozzarella, chicken on top of a huge bed of veggies! We started off with as much wine and bruschetta as we wanted, I didn't hold back on either. Starting off with a white wine and when I got my food moved to a Noir that I wasn't too fond of so moved back to my Grigio.   After an amazing dinner and snacking on some of my coworkers Ravioli ala Spinaci, we moved over to dessert, Tiramisu. I think I'll fly up to SF take a cab to North Beach and walk inside of Bocce Cafe just for their Tiramisu, it was THAT GOOD! Don't remember how long we were there, but do know we closed the place down.   I have to say, I loved that bartender and his patience with our group.   Oh the bar!

NhRFY4KQtCiU76GsSlvvRw.review_text: This is a pretty cool joint for big groups. Food is OK. Service is excellent, and the live jazz is always a plus. No real recommendations, everything is on par. Very close to a bunch of bars and clubs.

5C9n2AJ-lft5eC1bTrl7Ig.review_text: We wondered in here after passing several places with long line and not wanting to wait. I always get nervous where everywhere is busy I I choose then place that's empty but my fears were unwarranted. We shared the mussels to start and the broth was amazing. For entrees I had the gnocchi with a pesto sauce which tasted great and my had the sausage calzone.  The calzone had a thinner type crust which he enjoyed a lot. I would be happy to come back to Bocce again.

Po-th7nTUaWsqY9G2ouQog.review_text: Nice family run eatery. Girls nite out with good pizza and beer. Service was quite good really liked our server Jill. Would go back for the music.

23wQqI-DYwKkIp1av55A1Q.review_text: Blah.  Unimpressive, less than run-of-the-mill Italian food.  One star for the decor on the patio--which is beautifully decorated with white lights.  There are trees that hang over you while you eat and they were blooming huge, pretty white flowers.   The other star is for the fact that I ate for free, which is not really attributable to the restaurant, but to a friend (from out of town) who gave me a gift certificate.   We started with the Caprese salad, which was just ok--the tomatoes were a bit under ripe, but otherwise, it was alright.  The garlic bread was tasty.  Unfortunately, the meals were quite a disappointment.  I had the linguini tossed in garlic, oil, and sauteed zucchini.  The ONLY flavor I could detect was a truckload of salt.  No garlic, not even olive oil.  The pasta was also lacking any flavor.  My boyfriend had the linguini in clam sauce and, instead of a sauce, it was a watery broth that barely coated the linguini.  Blech.  In addition, the service was harried and interactions were brief, as it seemed as though our waiter was serving the majority of the restaurant.  Not his fault, but didn't add any enjoyment to the experience. After providing them with the gift certificate, we sat for a good 20 minutes waiting for the check to see if there was a remainder on the gift certificate (which there should have been, regardless of whether or not I wanted to return) and to see the final tally so we could tip appropriately.  The server never came back, so we threw some cash on the table and left.  I think if I get a gift certificate here again, I'll just give it away and spend my money elsewhere.

XHvfw3UU2YtvvKMLV_oWSg.review_text: Sweet Caroline Uh Uh O... So we had a reservation last night for 6. We were seated in a cozy corner table. The booth side had pillows and looked really cushiony and comfortable. We brought 2 bottles of wine ($12 corkage) and were immeadatly opened to start our good time. Lounge singer was in full effect hence the Sweet Caroline reerence. Now to get on with it- The food really good. I had the meat lasagna- came out super duper hot so I had to wait a little bit to eat it. Really cheesy. Tasty sauce. Scott had the Manicotti. It came out with this beautiful green sauce. A little rich for me, but hey, Manicotti is a rich dish. Defintley some delish Manicotti. I will most defitley be back- really decent prices for some grubbin Italian food.

e9d8GLTHjdSMTUc6M54USg.review_text: I thought this place was great!  You walk through this kind of Ivy archway / walkway and feel like you are leaving the city completely.    The ambiance is great and the price you pay for the amount of food you get is sweet!  I don't have anything really spectacular to say about the staff, they were just kind of there, serving the food...but I don't complain when I don't have to pay a lot for a good amount of food.  Plus the atmosphere in the place is enough to keep your attention!  This is definitely a place I plan on visiting again!

4Fyf9qPOqjpYofVqNVQfgA.review_text: 'Went here for my birthday. I said to my family, "I'd like to go to a place that has an outdoor patio." I've never been to A16 but that's where they said they were going to take me. When we got there it was a two hour wait so we headed off to Bocce Cafe.  When I heard "Cafe" I pictured something else. I imagined eating on the sidewalk in full view of hundreds of tourists and breathing the exhaust of cars driving by on Columbus Ave. To my surprise it was not. It was tucked away in a little alley and the outdoor patio was intimate and nicely lit with little white lights. Inside was much bigger than I expected too and reminded me of a ski lodge.  The food was good but I think the cioppino was the same thing as the seafood linguine minus the noodles. We had plenty of bread and wine and all in all it was a great experience just because I was with my family... and I didn't have to pay for anything. On that note I can't comment on the prices.  The cat wandering around the patio was unwelcome though. I don't know if it belonged to the owners or if it was just a stray but while I'm eating I don't like animals crawling under the table and rubbing my legs.  I'd still go back here though. I think it would be good for a date or a large group.

K60RV1oPNy6LKtkYH2wq4Q.review_text: Went here for a friend's birthday with a party of 12 and we had a great table outside. The atmosphere is cheezy and fun and the food is pretty good but not great. It's pretty cheap and the portions are a good size.  You can get dinner for two with dessert for a little over $20.

7QgJHvGSCndSf-zOsAHf3A.review_text: I. Love. Bocce.   My friend recommended it to me and said it was his favorite Italian restaurant in the city so I had to try it. I went this past weekend for the third time and, like the last two visits, the food was great. For appetizers, I have had the bruschetta, carpaccio, and fried calamari. For entrees, I have had cappellini alla tina, eggplant with capers, and the clams linguini. Even the bread they serve is delicious, baked warm every time and brushed with butter.   Essentially, I want to try everything on the menu.  The restaurant is large and can accommodate large groups. It also has a large patio out back with extra seating. The interior reminds me of a winter lodge, with wooden frames and a very home-y feeling.  The only reason I would not give it 5 stars is because the service is consistently slow. The food comes out fine, but the waiters and waitresses seem to take their precious time, even when the restaurant is not busy.

2bHSZhM0huV8LRh3YHaOSQ.review_text: So far I've only spoken to Wellat at Bocce on the phone about reserving space for a family reunion (thanks for the suggestion Yelpers!).  And?  I'm officially smitten.  He was so sweet and helpful and eager to make this event as perfect as it can be.  He's typically and Italian-ly laid back, so we'll see how things progress, and I'll certainly update once we've actually eaten there, but so far, things look good!  **Update** Family reunion dinner went off without a hitch.  Note to self though, pre-select menu in advance next time so we don't have to deal with splitting bills for that many people.  If it's a flat per person rate, you can't go wrong; trying to track down who had that glass of really pricey cab, not so much. We clogged the bar up quite a bit until we were seated, but that was more an inconvenience to other diners rather than ourselves.  I was initially worried about them seating us outside, but the patio is tented and was plenty warm and left lots of room for the younguns to scamper about once they were done picking at their pizzas.  The staff was friendly, the food delish.  I'd definitely eat here again next time I'm looking for a spot in NB, and I'd recommend them for group functions too.

J9b9YUP1bWSkO3T7XS6uYA.review_text: After being told a few doors down by a very large hairy man with a shirt unbuttoned a little too much and with a huge gold cross around this neck that we would have to wait about 30 minutes to eat in his dive restaurant, I was losing hope.  It was 7 p.m. on Saturday night.     But, just as despair was setting in, we came across Bocce Cafe!  Let me just put in a note that the ambiance here is great.  You have to wait through a little area with a green trellis to just get into the restaurant.  We were immediately seated on the porch in the back, which was gorgeous.  I ordered a "make your own" pasta from the list of penne with olive oil, garlic, and vegetables.  My one complaint is that it was a little too heavy on the garlic, but was still a great dining experience.    Also, this meal didn't kill the wallet as so many dinners in North Beach have a tendency to do.  After two entrees, a drink, and an appetizer, we paid about $32 total including tip and went off on our merry ways.

1zyE713RTVjBoO55_XjZiA.review_text: Bocce has a great outdoor patio that can accompany large groups and sits under a number of very neat fig trees.  On a nice summer evening, it can be the perfect outside dinner evening with that special someone.    Outside of the nice seating arrangements, Bocce Cafe could definitely improve on their Italian food quality.  We had a lasagne was very "wet" (either was previously frozen or they just used too much sauce when cooking it in the oven) and had layers that did not stick very well together.  My gf rated it a 5 out of 10.  My grilled squid appetizer was nothing like I was expecting.  I received the squid appetizer in a silver cooking pot and it looked more like a soup that also included tomatoes, capers, and olives.    With all the flexibility of Italian food options in North Beach, aim for another Italian spot if you're there just for the food.  If you prefer a good setting for a lot of people and nice outdoor environment, then Bocce will work for you.

QBXAIu1Vm-nKXUwBqZ5H7Q.review_text: Great for groups, I agree. I had an office goodbye lunch there and the mood was great, except for the Bingo troupe inside singing showtunes. Those old gals can get rowdy!  The outdoor seating area is completely different from the inside decor. The food isn't the greatest, but the sunshine, wine and food that sits in your belly like a brick is worth the experience. I would like to go there at night, when the little lights are lit along the border and you can share more than just a sip with someone you dine with, wink wink
